$LIBDEF.text:
/* REXX - Exec to invoke MXI using LIBDEFs                         */
/*                                                                 */
/*        Optional parm can be passed to MXI to force an initial   */
/*        display screen                                           */
/*                                                                 */
parse arg ztrail
address TSO "ALLOC FI(MXIXPT) DA('SYS2.MXI.LOAD') SHR REUSE"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('SYS2.MXI.LOAD') STACK"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('SYS2.MXI.PANELS') STACK"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('SYS2.MXI.TABLES') STACK"
address ISPEXEC "SELECT PGM(MXI) PARM("ztrail") NEWAPPL(MXI) NOCHECK",
                "PASSLIB SCRNAME(MXI)"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address TSO "FREE FI(MXIXPT)"
exit

/*

$STEPLIB.text:
/* REXX - Exec to invoke MXI using Gilbert Saint-flour's Dynamic   */
/* STEPLIB facility.                                               */
/*                                                                 */
arg hlq
if hlq = "" then HLQ = 'SYS2.MXI'
address TSO "ALLOC F(MXIXPT) DA('"hlq".LOAD') SHR REUSE"
address TSO "STEPLIB OPEN(MXIXPT) APF(YES) QUIET IKJEFT01"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('"hlq".PANELS') STACK"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('"hlq".TABLES') STACK"
address ISPEXEC "SELECT PGM(MXI) NEWAPPL(MXI) PASSLIB"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address ISPEXEC "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address TSO "STEPLIB CLOSE QUIET"
address TSO "FREE F(MXIXPT)"
exit

$SUPPORT.text:
Trouble-Shooting Guide for MXI
------------------------------

If MXI is either abending or producing unexpected results, the following
few simple steps could help resolve the problem.

o Ensure that the MXI load library is in a single extent. MXI has two
  VERY large load modules and I have seen strange 0C4 abends occur when
  the load library is in multiple extents.

o Verify that you do not have earlier releases of MXI modules ahead of
  the intended new MXI modules. This is especially critical for
  authorised commands and those that can have authorised and
  non-authorised versions (eg the "DA" command).

o If the problem occurs online, try running it in batch mode.
  If this also fails, it is a good chance that there is a problem in
  the MXI code.

o As supplied, MXI will wait for a maximum of 5 seconds to get a
  response from the operator command and once a response is received it
  will wait a further second for the message buffer to be filled.

  If you want to change these limits, please see the $MXIOPTN member of
  this dataset.

o If MXI abends, please send me the SYSUDUMP output (in EBCDIC binary
  if possible) and I will attempt to fix the problem as soon as I can.

o When reporting problems, it helps a lot if you mention the release
  of MVS, JES and DFSMS and if you are running RACF and RMF.

o MXI sometimes uses undocumented/unsupported methods to get some of
  its information. It is possible that the source of this information
  is liable to change by IBM without warning (the most common
  consequence of this is an 0C4 abend). I try to keep this sort of
  code to a minimum, but sometimes IBM leave me with no choice....


Rob Scott
mxisupport@rocketsoftware.com
www.rocketsoftware.com

CSVLLIX1.text:
CSVLLIX1 TITLE 'LLA EXIT 1 Driver'
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Name            : CSVLLIX1
*
* Function        : Invokes MXILLIX1
*
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
CSVLLIX1 CSECT
CSVLLIX1 AMODE 31
CSVLLIX1 RMODE ANY
         BAKR  R14,R0                 linkage stack
         LR    R12,R15                copy entry address to base
         USING CSVLLIX1,R12           address it
         LR    R10,R1                 Save address of LLP1
         ICM   R15,B'1111',=V(MXILLIX1)
         BZ    NOMXI
         BALR  R14,R15                Invoke MXI version of exit
NOMXI    DS    0H
         XR    R15,R15                Clear
         XR    R0,R0                  Clear
         PR                           return
         YREGS
         END

MXCT.text:
MACRO
          MXCT
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MXCT
.*
.* Function        : MXI Common Storage Table
.*
.* Pointed to      : SSCTSUSE of the MXI subsystem entry
.*
.* Location        : E-CSA Subpool 241 Key 4
.*
.* Changes
.* 2002/08/02  V4.2  Add SMF-88 Fields
.* 2002/09/04  V4.2  Add MXIU84 support for CMF
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXCT      DSECT
MXCTID    DS   CL4               MXCT eyecatcher
*
MXCTSIZE  DS   F                 MXCT Size
MXCTADDR  DS   A                 MXCT Address
MXCTSP    DS   X                 MXCT Subpool
MXCTKEY   DS   X                 MXCT Storage Key
*
MXCTFLG1  DS   X                 MXCT Flag settings #1
MXCTDOWN  EQU  X'80'             MXCT is not to be used as it is about
*                                to be deleted.
MXCTCSV   EQU  X'40'             CSVLLIX1 is active and recording info
*                                in MXCTCSVA
MXCTU83   EQU  X'20'             MXIU83 is active and recording info
MXCTU84   EQU  X'10'             MXIU84 is active and recording info
MXCTFLG2  DS   X                 MXCT Flag settings #2
MXCTR70   EQU  X'80'             The SMF 70 Copy Area is ready to
*                                receive data from MXIU83/4.
MXCTRCSV  EQU  X'40'             The CSV Table (MXCS) is ready to
*                                receive data from CSVLLIX1
MXCTSMF   EQU  X'20'             CSVLLIX1 is to write an SMF record to
*                                record each LLP1 instance
*                                The record number is specified in the
*                                MXCTSMFR field
MXCTR88   EQU  X'10'             The SMF 88 Copy Area is ready to
*                                receive data from MXIU83
MXCTFLG3  DS   X                 MXCT Flag settings #3
*                                Reserved
MXCTFLG4  DS   X                 MXCT Flag settings #4
*                                Reserved
*
MXCTU83N  DS   CL18              IEFU83 Exitname
          DS   0F
MXCTS70L  DS   F                 Length of SMF Type 70 Copy Area
MXCTS70A  DS   A                 Address of SMF Type 70 Record Copy
MXCTS70S  DS   X                 SMF 70 Copy Area subpool
MXCTS70K  DS   X                 SMF 70 Copy Area storage key
MXCTSMFR  DS   X                 SMF record type for CSVLLIX1
          DS   X                 Reserved
MXCTMXLS  DS   A                 Address of CSV Table (MXLS)
MXCTMX88  DS   A                 Address of SMF-88 Table (MX88)
MXCTU84N  DS   CL18              IEFU84 Exitname
*
MXCTLEN   EQU  *-MXCT            length of MXCT
          MEND

MXDT.text:
MACRO
          MXDT
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MXDT
.*
.* Function        : MXI Result Set Header
.*
.*                   The MXDT is the result set header that preceeds
.*                   the array of 80-byte records that contain the
.*                   data to be displayed to the user.
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXDT      DSECT
MXDTID    DS   CL4               Eye-catcher = Command Type
MXDTNUM   DS   F                 Number of entries
MXDTSIZ   DS   F                 Size of MXDT+Array
MXDTTTL   DS   CL80              Title line
MXDTLB2   DS   CL80              Label line 2
MXDTLB3   DS   CL80              Label line 3
MXDTUSER  DS   F                 Reserved
          DS   0D
MXDTHSZ   EQU  *-MXDT            Size of header
MXDTEST   DS   0C                First entry of result set array
*
          MEND

MXIAUTH.text:
MACRO
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Name       : MXIAUTH
.*
.* Function   : Constructs the MXI security table
.*
.*
.* Syntax     : MXIAUTH START,NOENTRY=(ALLOW/DENY)
.*
.*            : MXIAUTH END
.*
.*            : MXIAUTH SET,
.*                    CMD=cmd_name,
.*                    USER=userid,
.*                    GROUP=group,
.*                    ACCESS=(ALLOW/DENY)
.*
.* Keywords   : START
.*                 Denotes the beginning of the security table.
.*                 This must be the first entry. The 'NOENTRY'
.*                 keyword specifies the access for any command
.*                 not specifically listed.
.*
.*            : NOENTRY=(ALLOW/DENY)
.*                 Specifies which access will be given for a command
.*                 that is not specifically specified in the security
.*                 table. The default value is DENY.
.*
.*            : END
.*                 Denotes the end of the security table.
.*
.*            : SET
.*                 Creates an security rule in the current table.
.*
.*            : CMD=cmd_name
.*                 Specifies the MXI command that is to have a security
.*                 rule applied. The command must be specified in full
.*                 (ie NO masking is allowed).
.*
.*            : USER=userid
.*                 Specifies the userid pattern mask to be used for
.*                 authority checking. The user is compared to the
.*                 ACCEUSRI field of the ACEE.
.*                 You can specify a placeholder character of '%' and
.*                 a wildcard character of '*' in the userid value.
.*
.*            : GROUP=group
.*                 Specifies the group pattern mask to be used for
.*                 authority checking. The group is compared to the
.*                 ACCEGRPN field of the ACEE.
.*                 You can specify a placeholder character of '%' and
.*                 a wildcard character of '*' in the group name.
.*
.*            : ACCESS=(ALLOW/DENY)
.*                 Specifies whether access to the comamnd is to be
.*                 allowed or denied. Default value is ALLOW.
.*
.*
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Changes
.* 02/05/2000   Rob Scott     Code Written                     V2.2.A
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
&LABEL    MXIAUTH &INVOKE,                                             X
               &NOENTRY=DENY,                                          X
               &CMD=,                                                  X
               &USER=,                                                 X
               &GROUP=,                                                X
               &ACCESS=ALLOW
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Ensure that we have all required parms
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'START').RULESTRT
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'END').RULEEND
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'SET').RULESET
           AGO .MSG0001
.RULESTRT  ANOP
           AIF ('&USER' NE '').MSG0003
           AIF ('&CMD' NE '').MSG0003
           AIF ('&GROUP' NE '').MSG0003
MXISECTB   CSECT
           DC   CL8'MXISECTB'
           DC   CL8'&SYSDATE'
           DC   CL8'&SYSTIME'
           DC   AL4(NUMSECTB)
           AIF  ('&NOENTRY' EQ 'DENY').STARTDNY
           AIF  ('&NOENTRY' EQ 'ALLOW').STARTALW
           AGO .MSG0011
.STARTDNY  ANOP
           DC   XL4'00000001'
           AGO .ENDSTART
.STARTALW  ANOP
           DC   XL4'00000002'
           AGO .ENDSTART
.ENDSTART  ANOP
BEGSECTB   DS   0D
           AGO  .END
.RULESET   ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Process the defined rules
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&CMD' EQ '').MSG0005
           AIF (K'&CMD GT 4).MSG0002
&CMDL      SETA K'&CMD
&CMDLC     SETC '&CMDL'
           DC   AL1(&CMDLC)       Set length of CMD
           DC   CL4'&CMD'         Command name
.SETTYPE   ANOP
           AIF ('&ACCESS' EQ 'ALLOW').SETALLOW
           AIF ('&ACCESS' EQ 'DENY').SETDENY
           AGO .MSG0006
.SETALLOW  ANOP
           DC   X'02'             Set ACCESS = ALLOW
           AGO  .SETUTYP
.SETDENY   ANOP
           DC   X'01'             Set ACCESS = DENY
           AGO  .SETUTYP
.SETUTYP   ANOP
           AIF ('&USER' NE '').SETUSER
           AIF ('&GROUP' NE '').SETGROUP
           AGO  .MSG0007
.SETUSER   ANOP
           AIF ('&GROUP' NE '').MSG0008
           DC   X'04'             Set USER rule
           AIF (K'&USER GT 8).MSG0009
&USERL     SETA K'&USER
&USERLC    SETC '&USERL'
           DC   AL1(&USERLC)      Set length of USER
           DC   CL8'&USER'        Set userid value
           AGO  .SETEND
.SETGROUP  ANOP
           AIF ('&USER' NE '').MSG0008
           DC   X'08'             Set GROUP rule
           AIF (K'&GROUP GT 8).MSG0010
&GRPL      SETA K'&GROUP
&GRPLC     SETC '&GRPL'
           DC   AL1(&GRPLC)       Set length of GROUP
           DC   CL8'&GROUP'       Set group value
           AGO  .SETEND
.SETEND    ANOP
           AGO  .END
.*
.RULEEND   ANOP
           AIF ('&USER' NE '').MSG0004
           AIF ('&CMD' NE '').MSG0004
           AIF ('&GROUP' NE '').MSG0004
ENDSECTB   DS 0H
NUMSECTB   EQU (ENDSECTB-BEGSECTB)/16
           END
           AGO  .END
.MSG0001   MNOTE 12,'Invalid invocation - Use START/SET/END'
           AGO .END
.MSG0002   MNOTE 12,'Invalid length for CMD - Must be 1-4 characters'
           AGO .END
.MSG0003   MNOTE 12,'Do not specify any keywords for START'
           AGO .END
.MSG0004   MNOTE 12,'Do not specify any keywords for END'
           AGO .END
.MSG0005   MNOTE 12,'CMD value missing'
           AGO .END
.MSG0006   MNOTE 12,'Invalid value for ACCESS - Use ALLOW/DENY'
           AGO .END
.MSG0007   MNOTE 12,'USER or GROUP must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG0008   MNOTE 12,'USER and GROUP are mutually exclusive'
           AGO .END
.MSG0009   MNOTE 12,'Invalid length of USER - Must be 1-8 characters'
           AGO .END
.MSG0010   MNOTE 12,'Invalid length of GROUP - Must be 1-8 characters'
           AGO .END
.MSG0011   MNOTE 12,'NOENTRY keyword must be specified'
           AGO .END
.END     MEND

MXIGOPTS.text:
MACRO
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Name       : MXIGOPTS
.*
.* Function   : Constructs the MXI global options table
.*
.*
.* Syntax
.*
.*            : MXIGOPTS DSCB=(ON/OFF),
.*                    MENUHIDE=(ON/OFF),
.*                    EMCSWAIT=nn,
.*                    EMCSFILL=nn,
.*                    DAENQ=(ON/OFF),
.*                    XMEM=(YES/NO),
.*                    MAXROWS=nnnnn,
.*                    WTORZAP=(ON/OFF),
.*                    MSGMAKE=(ON/OFF),
.*                    MSGOPER=(ON/OFF),
.*                    LOGRRECS=nnnn,
.*                    LOGRRLEN=280,
.*                    LLAMODS=nnnn,
.*                    LLASMF=(NO/nnn),
.*                    CA1PWD=(ON/OFF),
.*                    MQ=cccc,
.*                    DB=cccc,
.*                    DB2MON1=(YES/NO),
.*                    DEFMQQ=queuemask,
.*                    PORT=nnnnn
.*
.* Keywords   : DSCB=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies the global default setting for DSCB
.*                 collection. This setting affects the APF, LINK and
.*                 LPA commands.
.*                 The default setting is OFF.
.*
.*            : MENUHIDE=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies whether commands that the user is not
.*                 authorized to use appear on the primary option
.*                 menu.
.*                 The default setting is ON.
.*
.*            : DAENQ=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies whether the enqueue display is shown
.*                 automatically when the DA command is used on a
.*                 single address space.
.*                 The default setting is ON.
.*
.*            : EMCSWAIT=nn
.*                 Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait for
.*                 a response to an operator command ('/').
.*                 The default setting is 5 seconds.
.*
.*            : EMCSFILL=nn
.*                 Specifies the number of seconds to wait for the
.*                 EMCS message buffer to fill after the expiration
.*                 of the EMCSWAIT value. A value higher than 1 will
.*                 improve the chance of capturing all of the output
.*                 from commands that produce a high volume of
.*                 messages at the cost of a slower response time.
.*                 The default setting is 1 second.
.*
.*            : TIMEOUT=mmss
.*                 Specifies the timeout value (mm = mins, ss = secs)
.*                 for remote requests. All four digits MUST be
.*                 specified including leading zeros.
.*                 The default setting is 60 seconds = 0060.
.*
.*            : MAXROWS=nnnnn
.*                 Specifies the maximum number of lines that can be
.*                 displayed in response to a single MXI command.
.*                 Any value lower than 1000 or higher than 99999 is
.*                 ignored.
.*                 The default setting is 40000.
.*
.*            : LLAMODS=nnnn
.*                 Specifies the maximum number of LLA modules that
.*                 are tracked via the MXILLIX1 exit.
.*                 Any value lower than 100 or higher than 9999 is
.*                 ignored.
.*                 The default setting is 5000.
.*
.*            : WTORZAP=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies whether a conformation WTOR is issued
.*                 when the ZAP command is used.
.*                 The default setting is ON.
.*
.*            : MSGMAKE=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies whether a audit message is issued when a
.*                 user issues the 'MAKE' command.
.*                 The default setting is OFF.
.*
.*            : MSGOPER=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies whether a audit message is issued when a
.*                 user issues the '/' command.
.*                 The default setting is OFF.
.*
.*            : PORT=nnnnn
.*                 Specifies the port number used by the MXI TCP/IP
.*                 server. This value must be common to all systems
.*                 that run the MXI TCP/IP server and must not be
.*                 shared with any other software.
.*                 The default value is 8001.
.*
.*            : LLASMF=(NO/nnn)
.*                 Specifies the SMF record number to be used to record
.*                 the LLA modules statistics in CSVLLIX1. The SMF
.*                 record appends the LLP1 parameter list to a standard
.*                 SMF record header.
.*                 If you do not require SMF records to be written,
.*                 then specify 'NO'.
.*                 The default setting is NO.
.*
.*            : LOGRRECS=nnnn
.*                 Specifies the maximum number of log streams that
.*                 are recorded from the SMF 88-1 records captured
.*                 by the MXIU83 exit.
.*                 Any value lower than 100 or higher than 9999 is
.*                 ignored.
.*                 The default setting is 1000.
.*
.*            : LOGRRLEN=280
.*                 Specifies the length of a SMF 88-1 record. This
.*                 option should not be changed unless IBM change
.*                 the length of the SMF record.
.*
.*            : CA1PWD=(ON/OFF)
.*                 Specifies whether commands the CA-1 password is
.*                 shown on the CA1 command display.
.*                 The default setting is ON.
.*
.*            : DB=cccc
.*                 Specifies the default DB2 subsystem name to
.*                 use if not specified.
.*                 The default setting is DSN1.
.*
.*            : DB2MON1=(YES/NO)
.*                 Specifies whether MXI will automatically start
.*                 the DB2 MONITOR1 trace when using DBxx commands.
.*                 The default setting is YES.
.*
.*            : MQ=cccc
.*                 Specifies the default MQSeries subsystem name to
.*                 use if not specified.
.*                 The default setting is CSQ1.
.*
.*            : DEFMQQ=queuemask
.*                 Specifies the default queue name mask passed on the
.*                 MQQ.
.*                 The default setting is *
.*
.*            : XMEM=(YES/NO)
.*                 Specifies whether MXI can perform cross-memory
.*                 services for certain authorised commands. This
.*                 includes scheduling SRBs into another address
.*                 space or using AR Mode methods.
.*                 This setting only applies when MXI is running
.*                 in authorised mode.
.*                 The default setting is YES
.*
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Changes
.* 09/05/2002   Rob Scott     Code Written                     V4.1
.* 17/10/2002   Rob Scott     Added MQ                         V4.2
.*              Rob Scott     Added LOGRRECS                   V4.2
.*              Rob Scott     Added LOGRRLEN                   V4.2
.*              Rob Scott     Added LLASMF                     V4.2
.*              Rob Scott     Added CA1PWD                     V4.2
.*              Rob Scott     Added MQ                         V4.2
.* 19/11/2002   Rob Scott     Added DB                         V4.3
.* 20/01/2003   Rob Scott     Added DEFMQQ                     V4.3
.* 14/02/2003   Rob Scott     Added XMEM                       V4.3
.* 11/03/2003   Rob Scott     Added DB2MON1                    V4.3
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
&LABEL    MXIGOPTS &DSCB=OFF,                                          X
               &MENUHIDE=ON,                                           X
               &DAENQ=ON,                                              X
               &EMCSWAIT=05,                                           X
               &EMCSFILL=01,                                           X
               &MAXROWS=40000,                                         X
               &LLAMODS=5000,                                          X
               &LOGRRECS=1000,                                         X
               &LOGRRLEN=280,                                          X
               &TIMEOUT=0060,                                          X
               &WTORZAP=ON,                                            X
               &MSGMAKE=OFF,                                           X
               &MSGOPER=OFF,                                           X
               &LLASMF=NO,                                             X
               &CA1PWD=ON,                                             X
               &MQ=CSQ1,                                               X
               &DB=DSN1,                                               X
               &DEFMQQ=*,                                              X
               &XMEM=YES,                                              X
               &DB2MON1=YES,                                           X
               &PORT=8001
MXIOPTN  CSECT
MXIOPTN  AMODE 31
MXIOPTN  RMODE ANY
.DSCBTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&DSCB' EQ 'ON').DSCBON
           AIF ('&DSCB' EQ 'OFF').DSCBOFF
           AGO  .MSG01
.DSCBON    ANOP
DSCB     DC    X'01'   Set DSCB to ON
           AGO  .MENUTEST
.DSCBOFF   ANOP
DSCB     DC    X'00'   Set DSCB to OFF
           AGO  .MENUTEST
.MENUTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&MENUHIDE' EQ 'ON').MENUON
           AIF ('&MENUHIDE' EQ 'OFF').MENUOFF
           AGO  .MSG02
.MENUON    ANOP
MENUHIDE DC    X'01'   Hide unauth commands on primary menu
           AGO  .WAITTEST
.MENUOFF   ANOP
MENUHIDE DC    X'00'   Show unauth commands on primary menu
           AGO  .WAITTEST
.WAITTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&EMCSWAIT' EQ '').MSG03
EMCSWAIT DC    AL1(&EMCSWAIT)
.FILLTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&EMCSFILL' EQ '').MSG04
EMCSFILL DC    AL1(&EMCSFILL)
.ZAPTEST   ANOP
           AIF ('&WTORZAP' EQ 'ON').ZAPON
           AIF ('&WTORZAP' EQ 'OFF').ZAPOFF
           AGO  .MSG05
.ZAPON     ANOP
WTORZAP  DC    X'01'   Issue WTOR for ZAP commands
           AGO  .MAKETEST
.ZAPOFF    ANOP
WTORZAP  DC    X'00'   Do not issue WTOR for ZAP commands
           AGO  .MAKETEST
.MAKETEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&MSGMAKE' EQ 'ON').MAKEON
           AIF ('&MSGMAKE' EQ 'OFF').MAKEOFF
           AGO  .MSG06
.MAKEON    ANOP
MSGMAKE  DC    X'01'   Issue message when MAKE command entered
           AGO  .OPERTEST
.MAKEOFF   ANOP
MSGMAKE  DC    X'00'   Do not issue message when MAKE command entered
           AGO  .OPERTEST
.OPERTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&MSGOPER' EQ 'ON').OPERON
           AIF ('&MSGOPER' EQ 'OFF').OPEROFF
           AGO  .MSG07
.OPERON    ANOP
MSGOPER  DC    X'01'   Issue message when / command entered
           AGO  .DAENQTST
.OPEROFF   ANOP
MSGOPER  DC    X'00'   Do not issue message when / command entered
           AGO  .DAENQTST
.DAENQTST  ANOP
           AIF ('&DAENQ' EQ 'ON').DAENQON
           AIF ('&DAENQ' EQ 'OFF').DAENQOFF
           AGO  .MSG011
.DAENQON   ANOP
DAENQ    DC    X'01'   Show enqueues on DA display
           AGO  .PORTTEST
.DAENQOFF  ANOP
DAENQ    DC    X'00'   Do not show enqueues on DA display
.PORTTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&PORT' EQ '').MSG08
PORT     DC    AL2(&PORT)  TCP/IP Port Number
.MROWTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&MAXROWS' EQ '').MSG09
           AIF ('&MAXROWS' LT '1000').DEFMROW
           AIF ('&MAXROWS' GT '99999').DEFMROW
MAXROWS  DC    AL4(&MAXROWS) Maximum number of rows on display
           AGO  .LLAMTEST
.DEFMROW   ANOP
         MNOTE 4,'MAXROWS invalid - using default of 40000'
MAXROWS  DC    AL4(40000)  Maximum number of rows on display
.LLAMTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&LLAMODS' EQ '').MSG010
           AIF ('&LLAMODS' LT '100').DEFLLAM
           AIF ('&LLAMODS' GT '9999').DEFLLAM
LLAMODS  DC    AL4(&LLAMODS) Maximum number of LLA modules tracked
           AGO  .TIMETEST
.DEFLLAM   ANOP
         MNOTE 4,'LLAMODS invalid - using default of 5000'
LLAMODS  DC    AL4(5000) Maximum number of LLA modules tracked
.TIMETEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&TIMEOUT' EQ '').MSG012
TIMEOUT  DC    CL4'&TIMEOUT'  Remote command timeout value
.LLATEST   ANOP
           AIF ('&LLASMF' EQ '').MSG013
           AIF ('&LLASMF' NE 'NO').GOTSMF
LLASMF   DC    AL1(0)  Do not cut an SMF record in MXILLIX1
           AGO  .ENDLLA
.GOTSMF    ANOP
           AIF ('&LLASMF' LT '200').MSG016
           AIF ('&LLASMF' GT '255').MSG016
LLASMF   DC    AL1(&LLASMF) SMF record type for MXILLIX1
.ENDLLA    ANOP
.CA1TEST   ANOP
           AIF ('&CA1PWD' EQ '').MSG014
           AIF ('&CA1PWD' EQ 'ON').CA1ON
           AIF ('&CA1PWD' NE 'OFF').MSG015
CA1PWD   DC    X'00'   Do not show the CA-1 password
           AGO  .ENDCA1
.CA1ON     ANOP
CA1PWD   DC    X'01'   Show the CA-1 password
.ENDCA1    ANOP
.LOGRTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&LOGRRECS' EQ '').MSG017
           AIF ('&LOGRRLEN' EQ '').MSG018
           AIF ('&LOGRRECS' LT '100').DEFLOGR
           AIF ('&LOGRRECS' GT '9999').DEFLOGR
LOGRRECS DC    AL4(&LOGRRECS) Maximum number of LOGR records
LOGRRLEN DC    AL2(&LOGRRLEN) Length of a SMF 88-1 record
           AGO  .ENDLOGR
.DEFLOGR   ANOP
         MNOTE 4,'LOGRRECS invalid - using default of 1000'
LOGRRECS DC    AL4(1000) Maximum number of LOGR records
LOGRRLEN DC    AL2(&LOGRRLEN) Length of a SMF 88-1 record
.ENDLOGR   ANOP
.MQSUB     ANOP
           AIF ('&MQ' EQ '').MSG019
MQ       DC    CL4'&MQ' MQ Series subsystem
.DBSUB     ANOP
           AIF ('&DB' EQ '').MSG020
DB       DC    CL4'&DB' DB2 Subsystem
           AIF ('&DEFMQQ' EQ '').MSG021
&DEFMQQL   SETA K'&DEFMQQ
           AIF (&DEFMQQL GT 48).MSG022
DEFMQQ   DC    AL1(&DEFMQQL),CL48'&DEFMQQ' Default MQQ queue name mask
.XMEMTEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&XMEM' EQ 'YES').XMEMYES
           AIF ('&XMEM' EQ 'NO').XMEMNO
           AGO  .MSG023
.XMEMYES   ANOP
XMEM     DC    X'01'   Set XMEM to YES
           AGO  .XMEMDONE
.XMEMNO    ANOP
XMEM     DC    X'00'   Set XMEM to NO
.XMEMDONE  ANOP
.MON1TEST  ANOP
           AIF ('&DB2MON1' EQ 'YES').MON1YES
           AIF ('&DB2MON1' EQ 'NO').MON1NO
           AGO  .MSG024
.MON1YES   ANOP
MON1     DC    X'01'   Set DB2MON1 to YES
           AGO  .MON1DONE
.MON1NO    ANOP
MON1     DC    X'00'   Set DB2MON1 to NO
.MON1DONE  ANOP
.OPTNEND   ANOP
RESERVED DS    0D
           END
           AGO  .END
.MSG01     MNOTE 12,'DSCB must be ON or OFF'
           AGO .END
.MSG02     MNOTE 12,'MENUHIDE must be ON or OFF'
           AGO .END
.MSG03     MNOTE 12,'EMCSWAIT must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG04     MNOTE 12,'EMCSFILL must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG05     MNOTE 12,'WTORZAP must be ON or OFF'
           AGO .END
.MSG06     MNOTE 12,'MSGMAKE must be ON or OFF'
           AGO .END
.MSG07     MNOTE 12,'MSGOPER must be ON or OFF'
           AGO .END
.MSG08     MNOTE 12,'PORT must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG09     MNOTE 12,'MAXROWS must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG010    MNOTE 12,'LLAMODS must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG011    MNOTE 12,'DAENQ must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG012    MNOTE 12,'TIMEOUT must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG013    MNOTE 12,'LLASMF must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG014    MNOTE 12,'CA1PWD must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG015    MNOTE 12,'CA1PWD must be ON or OFF'
           AGO .END
.MSG016    MNOTE 12,'LLASMF must specify a number between 200 and 255'
           AGO .END
.MSG017    MNOTE 12,'LOGRRECS must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG018    MNOTE 12,'LOGRRLEN must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG019    MNOTE 12,'MQ must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG020    MNOTE 12,'DB must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG021    MNOTE 12,'DEFMQQ must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG022    MNOTE 12,'DEFMQQ must be between 1 and 48 characters'
           AGO .END
.MSG023    MNOTE 12,'XMEM must be YES or NO'
           AGO .END
.MSG024    MNOTE 12,'DB2MON1 must be YES or NO'
           AGO .END
.END     MEND

MXIHAPF.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - APF Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current APF dataset list.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @APF dsn-mask DSCB(ON/OFF)
+
!Keywords      +
  @dsn-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the dataset name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
               +The default value for dsn-mask is '*'.
  @DSCB(ON)    +Specifies that DSCB collection should be activated.
  @DSCB(OFF)   +Specifies that DSCB collection should be inactivated.
+
!Examples
+ @APF SYS1.*+     List all SYS1 datasets in the current APF list.
+ @APF * DSCB(ON) +List all APF datasets and collect DSCB information.
+
!Considerations
  +If the@SET DSCB ON+command has been issued, or the@DSCB(ON)+keyword has
  +been specified, the APF command will collect DCB and space allocation
  +information for each dataset displayed.
+
!Output Panel Fields
+ @Dataset       +  - The APF list entry dataset name.
+                     When@DSCB+is@ON+the dataset name will only be active for
+                     point-and-shoot functions when it exists on the specified
+                     volser.
+ @Volser        +  - Volume Serial definition for the dataset.
+                     When@DSCB+is@OFF+this field shows the volser from either
+                     the PROGxx member defining the APF list, or the volser on
+                     the SETPROG command used to add the dataset.
+                     When@DSCB+is@ON+this field shows the actual volser that
+                     the dataset resides upon.
+ @Blksz       ¢(*)+- Block size of dataset.
+ @Tracks      ¢(*)+- Total allocated tracks used by the dataset.
+ @%Use        ¢(*)+- Percentage of the allocated tracks used by the dataset.
+ @XT          ¢(*)+- Number of primary and secondary extents of the dataset.
+
+
+              ¢(*)+- Only available when the@DSCB+settings is@ON+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHASID
)END

MXIHASID.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - ASID Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current address space usage from the ASVT control block.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @ASID+
+
!Output Panel Fields
+ @Address Space Definitions
+ @Maximum Defined        +- The value from USERMAX in IEASYSxx
+ @Reserved Non-Reusable  +- Additional address space entries reserved to
+                         +  replace those marked non-reusable at address space
+                         +  termination (RSVNONR in IEASYSxx)
+ @Reserved Start Commands+- Additional address space entries reserved to
+                         +  satisfy MVS start commands (RSVSTRT in IEASYSxx)

+ After the above three fields, each type of address space is summarised and
+ the following information displayed :

+ @Address Space Type     +- The type of address space
+ @Number                 +- The amount of address spaces of this type
+ @Percentage             +- The percentage of the total address space entries
                          +  (Total = USERMAX plus RSVNONR plus RSVSTRT)
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCAT
)END

MXIHAUTO.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - AUTO Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Automatically refreshes the screen after a specified interval. The process
+  can be interrupted by pressing the ATTN key.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @AUTO nn
+
!Keywords
+ @nn     +Specification in seconds (5 - 99) of time to wait before refreshing
+         +the screen. The default is 5 seconds.
!Examples
+ @AUTO 9 +Refresh the screen every 9 seconds.
+
!Considerations
+  AUTO can be issued on the displays resulting from the following
+  MXI commands :
+
+ ¢CS   ¢DA   ¢ENQ  ¢ENQC ¢EXC  ¢HSMQ ¢INIT ¢PAGE ¢PLEX
+ ¢RS   ¢SGRP ¢SMFD ¢SP   ¢TAPE ¢UIC  ¢WTOR ¢XCFM ¢XCFS
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDS
)END

MXIHCAT.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CAT Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current allocated or open catalogs.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CAT dsn-mask
+
!Keywords      +
  @dsn-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the dataset name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
               +The default value of dsn-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @CAT CATALOG.USER* +Show all catalogs that start 'CATALOG.USER'
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Dataset         +- Dataset name of catalog
  @Volser          +- Volume serial of catalog
  @Type            +- Type of catalog (User/Master)
  @Flags           +- Attributes for the catalog
                     ¢Y +Allocated to the Catalog Address Space
                     ¢S +Catalog is SMS managed
                     ¢V +Using catalog data space cache
                     ¢I +Using the in-storage catalog
                     ¢C +Catalog is closed
                     ¢D +Catalog has been deleted
                     ¢A +Catalog is tape volume catalog
                     ¢R +Catalog defined for cross system sharing
                     ¢E +Catalog defined for extended catalog sharing
                     ¢K +Catalog is locked
  @Searches        +- Number of searches performed for catalog entries. This
                     +figure is in thousands (000's).
  @Hit%            +- Percentage of requests satisfied by the catalog cache.

)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCA1
)END

MXIHCA1.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CA1 Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #

#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current CA-1 configuration information
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CA1+
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The display is split into two main sections
+
!Base Configuration
+ @Release          +- Release of CA-1
+ @Password         +- CA-1 password
+ @X-SVC Number     +- Decimal SVC number for the X-SVC
+ @Y-SVC Number     +- Decimal SVC number for the Y-SVC
+ @TMC Dataset      +- The TMC dataset name
+ @Audit Dataset    +- The Audit dataset name
+ @Active           +- Is CA-1 active?
+ @Initialized      +- Has CA-1 been initialized?
+ @Batch Active     +- Is CA-1 batch active?
+ @Password Replied +- Has the CA-1 password been used?
+ @WTO Subsystem    +- Status of the WTO subsystem intercepts
+ @OS Intercepts    +- Status of the Operating System intercepts
+
!Exit Information
+ @Exit             +- Exit module name
+ @Status           +- Status of exit (Active/Inactive)
+ @Address          +- Entry point address
+ @Location         +- Storage location
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCDE
)END

MXIHCDE.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CDE Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Job Pack Area Queue (JPAQ) and modules loaded for each
+  TCB.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CDE mod-mask ONLY(JPAQ) JOB(jobname)
+ @                        ASID(asid)
+
!Keywords      +
  @mod-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the module name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mod-mask is '*'.
  @ONLY(JPAQ)  +An optional keyword that restricts the display to show only
               +entries in the Job Pack Area Queue.
  @JOB(jobname)+An optional keyword that specifies the address space name whose
               +CDE structure is to be examined. Wildcards are not allowed.
  @ASID(asid)  +An optional keyword that specifies the hexadecimal ASID whose
               +CDE structure is to be examined. All four bytes of the
               +ASID keyword MUST be completed. Wildcards are not allowed.

               +Note that the JOB() and ASID() keywords require MXI to be
               +running authorized. For further information on running MXI in
               +authorized mode, please see the@MISC+section of this HELP dialog
+
!Examples
+ @CDE ISP*           +  List all loaded modules starting 'ISP'.
+ @CDE HAS* JOB(JES2) +  List HAS prefixed modules for the JES2 address space.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Module         +- Name of the module
  @Major          +- When non-blank, this entry is a minor CDE and this field
                  +  contains the name of the corresponding major CDE
  @EPA            +- Entry point address of the module
  @Length         +- Length of the module
  @SP             +- Decimal subpool number of the module
  @TCB            +- The address of the owning TCB or 'JPAQ' for entries on
                  +  the job pack area queue
  @Pgm            +- The name of the owning TCB program or blank for JPAQ
                  +  entries
  @Use            +- Hexadecimal use count of the module
  @APF            +- Was module loaded from an APF authorised dataset (APF/No)
  @AC             +- Authorisation code of the module (00/01)
  @Rent           +- Is module Re-entrant (Rent/No)
  @Rent           +- Is module Re-usable (Reus/No)
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCDR
)END

MXIHCDR.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CDR Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the configuration data records for online devices.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CDR unit-mask ONLY(type) NOT(type)
+
!Keywords      +
  @unit-mask   +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the unit address. For three
               +digit devices, the leading zero MUST be specified.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of unit-mask is '*'.
  @ONLY(type)  +Restrict the display to only show the CDRs for devices of a
               +particular class :
               ¢COMMS   += Communications Devices
               ¢CTC     += CTC Devices
               ¢DASD    += Disk Devices
               ¢DISPLAY += Display Devices
               ¢TAPE    += Tape Devices
               ¢UNITREC += Unit Record Devices (Printers, Readers..etc)
  @NOT(type)   +Restrict the display by omitting CDRs for devices of a
               +particular class :
               ¢COMMS   += Communications Devices
               ¢CTC     += CTC Devices
               ¢DASD    += Disk Devices
               ¢DISPLAY += Display Devices
               ¢TAPE    += Tape Devices
               ¢UNITREC += Unit Record Devices (Printers, Readers..etc)
+
!Example
+ @CDR 034*      + List all CDR information for devices 0340-034F
+ @CDR ONLY(DASD)+ List all CDR information for DASD devices
+
!Output panel fields
+ @Unit             +- The unit address of the device
+ @Paths            +- The paths to the device
+ @DevType          +- The device type (as reported by IOSCDR)
+ @DevSer           +- The device serial number
+ @CUType           +- The control unit type (as reported by IOSCDR)
+ @CUSer            +- The control unit serial number
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCF
)END

MXIHCF.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  ¯ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CF Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
¯MXIHAREA                                                                      ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Coupling Facilities
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CF cf-mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @cf-mask     +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the Coupling Facility name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of cf-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @CF CPC* +    List all coupling facilities starting 'CPC'
+
!Considerations
  +The@CF+command requires MXI to be running in authorized mode. For further
  +information on running MXI authorized, see the@MISC+section of this Help
  +dialog.
+
!Output Panel Fields (Multiple Coupling Facilities)
  @Name             +- Name of the Coupling Facility
  @Status           +- Current status of the Coupling Facility :
                      ¢Active     +-+CF is active
                      ¢Change-Pend+-+Policy change pending
                      ¢Failed     +-+CF has failed
                      ¢Reconcile  +-+CFRM policy to CF reconcile is in progress
  @Node             +- Node name of the Coupling Facility :
                      ¢type.supplier.plant.sequence
  @ID               +- CPC ID of the Coupling Facility
  @LPAR             +- LPAR number of the Coupling Facility
  @#Sys             +- Number of connected systems
  @#Str             +- Number of structures
  @Size             +- Dump Size of the Coupling Facility in K
+
!Output Panel Fields (Single Coupling Facility)
  @Name             +- Name of the Coupling Facility
  @Status           +- Current status of the Coupling Facility :
                      ¢Active     +-+CF is active
                      ¢Change-Pend+-+Policy change pending
                      ¢Failed     +-+CF has failed
                      ¢Reconcile  +-+CFRM policy to CF reconcile is in progress
  @CPC Node         +- Node name of the Coupling Facility :
                      ¢type.supplier.plant.sequence
  @CPC ID           +- CPC ID of the Coupling Facility
  @LPAR             +- LPAR number of the Coupling Facility
  @Dump Size(K)     +- Dump Size of the Coupling Facility
  @Connected Systems+- Systems connected to this CF
  @Structures       +- The structures associated with this CF
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCHP
)END

MXIHCHA.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - Summary Of Changes -----------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Changes For Version 4.3
¢o +Added the@MENU+command and changed the entire menu system.
¢o +Added the@GQE+command to show common storage getmains.
¢o +Add LSQA subpools to the@SP+command.
¢o +Add MIPS information to the@CPU+command.
¢o +Added the@DB+command to list DB2 subsystems.
¢o +Added the@DBBP+command to list DB2 buffer pools.
¢o +Added the@DBDA+command to list DB2 threads.
¢o +Added the@DBEP+command to list DB2 EDM pool statistics.
¢o +Added the@DBGP+command to list DB2 getpage requests.
¢o +Added the@DBLK+command to list DB2 locking statistics.
¢o +Added the@DBZP+command to list DB2 system parameters.
¢o +Added the@JOB() ASID()+and@PGM()+keywords to the@USP+command.
¢o +Added the@CLIENT=+keyword to MXISERV to increase remote security.
¢o +Added the@USERTRAN=+keyword to MXISERV to allow client userid
   +translation.
¢o +Added a TCP/IP security exit to enhance non-MVS client request security.
¢o +Added point-and-shoot SORT on column headings for all tabular displays.
¢o +Added the CADS count to the@DSP+display.
¢o +Added the DSNS count to the@PAGE+display.
¢o +Point and shoot on the jobname in the@CSR+display now takes you to the
¢  +GQE display showing orphaned storage that matches the jobname.
¢o +Add owner information to the@SP+command output for a single subpool/key
   +combination.
¢o +Non-authorised commands can now be protected via internal or external
   +security.
¢o +Removed the leading zero on address space id restriction on the@DA+command.

!Changes For Version 4.2
¢o +Added the@CDR+command to list device serial numbers.
¢o +Added the@CON+command to show MCS console screen images.
¢o +Added the@ENC+command to list enclaves.
¢o +Added the@LOGR+command to list log streams.
¢o +Added the@MQ+command to show MQ Series subsystems.
¢o +Added the@MQC+command to show MQ Series channels.
¢o +Added the@MQCS+command to show MQ Series channel status.
¢o +Added the@MQDA+command to show MQ Series active threads.
¢o +Added the@MQQ+command to show MQ Series queues.
¢o +Added the@MQU+command to show MQ Series page set usage.
¢o +Added the region information to the@DA+display for a single ASID.
¢o +Added the@ONLY(INIT)+keyword to the@DA+command.
¢o +Added the@LLASMF+global option to specify the SMF record number to
¢  +be used in the MXILLIX1 exit.
¢o +Add support for CMF when collecting type-70 records.
¢o +Added the@CCT@MCT+and@RCT+control block definitions to the@MEM+
¢  +command.
¢o +Added the OMVS info to the RACF GROUP display on the@RL+command.
¢o +Added the@CDR+information to the@DASD+and@TAPE+displays.
¢o +Removed the leading zero on unit address restriction on the@TAPE+and
   @UCB+commands.

!Changes For Version 4.1
¢o +Added the@RSYS+command to connect to remote systems
¢o +Added the@MXI TCP/IP Server+address space.
¢o +Added the@MXI+subsystem.
¢o +Added the@LLA+command to show LLA module fetch statistics.
¢o +Added the@SOFT+command to show system software levels.
¢o +Indicate SCOPE=COMMON dataspaces on the@DSP+command display.
¢o +Changed the panel title lines to include system information (CPU% etc).
¢o +MXI global options now specified via macro statements rather than
   +zaps.
¢o +Renamed the help panels.

!Changes For Version 3.4
¢o +Added the@DEV+command to show DASD activity (if RMF is active).
¢o +Added the@HSM+command to show HSM configuration.
¢o +Added the@WLMA+command to show WLM Application Environments.
¢o +Added the@WLMS+command to show WLM Scheduling Environments.
¢o +Added the@ZAP+command to alter common storage contents.
¢o +Added the@JOB()+and@ASID()+keywords to the@PID+command.
¢o +Added the@VIEW()+keyword to the@HFS+command so that the user can toggle
¢  +between path and dataset views of the file systems.
¢o +The@WTOR+command now accepts a pattern mask for the system name so that the
¢  +results can be filtered.
¢o +Added the OMVS segment on the@RL+display for USER profiles.
¢o +Added the Sysplex information to the@IPL+display.
¢o +All IDs listed in the RACF access lists are now point-and-shoot.
¢o +The@LINK+command now indicates datasets that acquire APF auth by the
   +LNKAUTH=LNKLST setting rather than specific APF list entries.
¢o +The@HSMQ+command now reports on HSM command requests.
¢o +The@CAT+command now displays certain catalog cache information.
¢o +Add support for UIC values greater than 255 for z/OS in ESAME mode.
¢o +The E-MCS wait time limits for the@/+command are now placed in the MXIOPTN
¢  +CSECT rather than RDSEMCS. New zap instructions included in the INSTLIB
¢  +dataset.

!Changes For Version 3.3
¢o +Added the@DAE+command to list Dump Elimination information.
¢o +Added the@HFS+command to show OpenEdition file systems.
¢o +Added the@LX+command to list linkage indexes and PC routines.
¢o +Added the@OMVS+command to show OpenEdition configuration.
¢o +Added the@PID+command to show OpenEdition processes.
¢o +Added the@WLMC+command to list WLM classification rules.
¢o +Added the@WLMG+command to list WLM classification groups.
¢o +Added the@SET CONSOLE+command to specify the E-MCS console name used by MXI
   +in the '/' command.
¢o +Added the@ONLY()+and@NOT()+keywords to the@RCLS+command.
¢o +Added the@ONLY()+and@NOT()+keywords to the@UCB+command.
¢o +Added the@CPU(MAX)+and@CPU(MIN)+keywords to the@MAKE+command.
¢o +The@RL+command now prompts in ISPF mode if no keywords specified.
¢o +The@HSMQ+command now uses cross-memory techniques to gather the required
   +information rather than parsing operator command responses.
¢o +Added AFC information to the@CPU UIC+and@RS+command displays.
¢o +Added the UCB address on the@DASD+display for a single volume.
¢o +Added the UCB address on the@TAPE+display for a single unit.
¢o +Added the Installation Data to the@RL+command output.
¢o +Added HWNAME, VMUSERID and LPARNAME to the@IPL+command display.
¢o +Added the SVT control block to the@MEM+and@MAP+commands.
¢o +Commands that the user is not authorised to use are no longer shown on their
¢  +MXI Primary Option Menu.
¢o +Removed the@PC+command.
+
!Changes For Version 3.2
¢o +Authorised commands can now be protected via the RACF FACILITY class.
¢o +Added the@AUTO+command to automatically refresh the screen.
¢o +Added the@DS+command to maintain a personal dataset list.
¢o +Added the@EMCS+command to show E-MCS consoles.
¢o +Added the@INIT+command to show JES2 initiators.
¢o +Added the@MCS+command to show the MCS consoles.
¢o +Added the@MDQ+command to show the memory delete queue.
¢o +Added the@RACF+command to show RACF information.
¢o +Added the@RCLS+command to show RACF class information.
¢o +Added the@RL+command to show specific RACF profile information.
¢o +Added the@SRVC+command to show the WLM service classes.
¢o +Added the@WLM+command to show the WLM policy information.
¢o +Added the@XM+command to show the cross-memory connections
¢o +Changed the@VMAP+command to show user region info.
¢o +Changed the@DA+command to include cross-memory connection info.
¢o +Changed the@DA+command to replace performance group number with WLM service
¢  +class for goal mode systems.
¢o +Changed the@IPL+command to include WLM mode setting.
¢o +The@DASD+command now shows if volume is in CAXWA chain.
¢o +When the display for ONE DASD volume is shown, the point-and-shoot action
¢  +for the volser will invoke ISPF DSLIST for the volume.
¢o +The@EXC+command now sorts the address space exceptions by severity.
¢o +Added the SMFDUMP (TYPE=SYS) exception to examine the number of SMF
¢  +datasets in DUMP REQUIRED status.
¢o +The pull down menus have been re-arranged.
¢o +The point and shoot action for dataset names can now be switched between
¢  +EDIT and VIEW via the SET SCREEN command.
¢o +Added the following command aliases to the MXICMDS ISPF table :
¢      @OJOB   + DA * ONLY(JOB)
¢      @OSTC   + DA * ONLY(STC)
¢      @OTSU   + DA * ONLY(TSU)
¢      @JOBS   + DA * ONLY(JOB)
¢      @SYSTEM + DA * ONLY(STC)
¢      @USERS  + DA * ONLY(TSU)
+
!Changes For Version 3.1a
¢o +Implemented pull down menus.
¢o +The @SORT+command now accepts a column name and direction rather than using
¢  +point-and-shoot methods.
¢o +All tabular displays now have just ONE line of column heading rather than
¢  +TWO lines. All column names are now ONE word.
¢o +Added the@DSP+command to show dataspace information.
¢o +Added the@PEEK+command to show all ISPF screen images for a TSO user.
¢o +Added the@WTOR+command to show all outstanding operator replies.
¢o +Added the@CPF+command to show the command prefix table.
¢o +Added the@JOB()+and@ASID()+keywords to the@MEM+command to allow listing
¢  +of the storage within any address space.
¢o +When authorized, the@MEM+command can now browse fetch protected common
¢  +storage.
¢o +Added the WTOR exception (TYPE=SYS) to examine number of outstanding
¢  +operator replies.
¢o +Add support for dynamic LPA modules.
¢o +Add new fields to the@SSI+display to indicate dynamic subsystem attributes.
¢o +The@SYM+command now shows dynamic symbols as well as static symbols.
¢o +Cater for multi-volume datasets in the EXCP count for the@DDNS+command.
¢o +Cater for DASD volumes whose serial number is less than 6 characters.
¢o +Removed the@NET+command.

!Changes For Version 2.2a
¢o +Added an internal security table to control authorized commands.
¢o +Added the@JOB()+and@ASID()+keywords to the@CDE+command to allow listing
¢  +of the JPAQ and TCB modules for other address spaces.
¢o +Added the@JOB()+and@ASID()+keywords to the@TCB+command to allow listing
¢  +of the TCB structure of other address spaces.
¢o +Added the@CHP+command to list channel path information.
¢o +Added the@MAKE+command to change address space swapability.
¢o +Added the@/+command to issue operator commands.
¢o +Added the@ONLY(JPAQ)+keyword to the@CDE+command.
¢o +Changed the primary@DASD+command display to show Free DSCBs instead of
¢  +Free Extents
¢o +The@TYPE=DASD+and@TYPE=TASK+exception rules now support the use of
   +pattern masks for volsers and jobnames.
¢o +The@PRT+command will use USERID if the TSO prefix is null.
¢o +Added the OMVS and RTLS statements to the@PARM+command.
¢o +Fixed the@TAPE+command storage creep problem.

!Changes For Version 2.1e
¢o +Added the@AGRP+command to display SMS aggregate groups.
¢o +Added the@UCB+command to show the actual UCB addresses of all devices.
¢o +Added the@CDE+command to show the JPAQ and TCB loaded modules.
¢o +Added the@ONLY()+and@NOT()+keywords to the@DASD+command.
¢o +Added subsystem version information (via SSI-54) to the@SSI+command.
¢o +Added support for JES3.
¢o +Added the@UCB+map to the@MEM+command.
¢o +Changed the@SGRP+command to show all volumes defined to the SMS storage
¢  +group when the more detailed display is shown.
¢o +Changed the@TAPE+command to accept unit address masking.
¢o +Changed the@SVC+command to accept masking.
¢o +Removed the authorized version of the@CAT+command.
¢o +The command parsing routines have been changed so that all commands that
¢  +accept keywords do NOT have to have the positional mask specified.
¢o +Added SMS Status to the DASD display for a single volume.
¢o +Improved authority checking when running under ISPF or REXX.
+
!Changes For Version 2.1d
¢o +Added the@SORTXA+and@SORTXD+commands to allow correct sorting of hex values.
¢o +Added the@JOB()+and@ASID()+keywords to the@DDNS+command to allow listing
¢  +and searching of dataset allocations for other address spaces
¢o +Added the@A=asid+form of the@DA+command to allow specification of
¢  +hex address space id. The ASID column in the@DA+command display is
¢  +now point-and-shoot.
¢o +Added the@TCB+command to list TCB and RB structures
¢o +Added the@USP+command to list user subpool storage by TCB
¢o +Changed the@SRCH+command to show only one line per dataset if a match is
¢  +found. Invoking the 'point-and-shoot' action on the dataset name will then
¢  +show each individual member within that dataset.
¢o +Added the CPUS exception (TYPE=SYS) to examine number of online CPUs.
¢o +Renamed the@SMF+command to@SMFD+
¢o +Changed the@SMF+command to list general SMF information
¢o +Added the@MAP+command to allow easy switching to DSECT mapping while on
¢  +the@MEM+display.
¢o +Changed the@EDT+command to show the allocated jobname and device type for
¢  +each device
¢o +Changed the@DA+command to show CPU Time Limit value.
¢o +Adjust the TCB mapping when MAP(TCB) is used on the@MEM+command.
¢o +Added the@VER+command to list the MXI version and generation information.
¢o +The@ISPF Tab to point and shoot+setting is now toggled on for MXI if
¢  +not set in the ISPF profile. The setting is reset (if changed) on exit
¢  +from MXI.
¢o +Re-worked the HELP dialog.
¢o +Cater for null commands when using the MXIREXX API.
¢o +Allow MXIREXX API to accept new parameter 'NOTITLES'.
¢o +Allow MXIREXX API to accept authorized commands.
¢o +Fixed 0C6 abends when entering invalid format keywords for@SVC+and@MEM+
¢  +commands.
+
!Changes For Version 2.1c
¢o +Added the@EXC+command to list system exceptions.
¢o +Added CPU% and SIO to the@DA+command.
¢o @ENQC+command now lists both Enqueue conflicts and all RESERVEs.
¢o +Allow the@SRCH+command to be issued on the@PARM+display.
¢o +Adjust the CVT mapping when MAP(CVT) is used on the@MEM+command.
¢o +Allow the@MPF+command to recognise SUP(ALL) entries
¢o +Allow the NORMAL attribute to be used for point-and-shoot fields when using
+   the@SET SCREEN+command.
¢o +Ensure that all scrollable panels have 'Row n or n' placed in the top right
+   corner.
¢o +Assign console key of 'MXI' to all E-MCS consoles and ensure that the
+   migration ID is always released.
+
!Changes For Version 2.1b
¢o +Added the@DA+command to list active address spaces.
¢o +Added the@RS+command to list real and auxiliary storage usage by address
   +space.
¢o +Added the@UIC+command to list UIC information by address space.
¢o +Added the@SGRP()+keyword to the@DASD+command to filter on SMS storage group.
¢o +Changed the@DASD+display for multiple volumes to include percentage used
   +and mount attribute.
¢o +Changed the@DASD+display for a single volume to include EDT unitnames,
   +jobname, open DCBs, free VIRs and device capacity.
¢o +Changed the@TAPE+display for a single device to include EDT unitnames.
¢o +Changed the@PARM+command to show all PARMLIB datasets.
¢o +Changed the@DDNS+command to show EXCP counts for each dataset
¢o +Display routine now remembers sort order and current line when a
   +scrollable list is refreshed by pressing the enter key.
¢o +Added alternate display panel for displays that do not need the top two
   +title lines.
+
!Changes For Version 2.1a
¢o +Added the@CS+command to list common storage usage by address space.
¢o +Added the@CSR+command to list common storage remaining (or orphaned) by
   +address space.
¢o +Added the@CA1+command to display CA-1 configuration.
¢o +Added the@DCLS+command to display SMS data classes.
¢o +Added the@LLS+command to display linklist sets.
¢o +Added the@LLSU+command to display linklist set usage by address space.
¢o +Added the@CAX+keyword to the@CAT+command to force usage of the CAXWA chain
   +instead of using the E-MCS method.
¢o +Changed the@LINK+and@LPA+displays to include APF status and also the volume
   +serial when DSCB is OFF.
¢o +Added the MXICMDS ISPF table to be placed in ISPTLIB. This ensures that MXI
   +commands are not mistaken for in-house commands.
¢o +Added support for MXI to be invoked via ISPF SELECT PGM(MXI) PARM(cmd).
+
!Changes For Version 1.3c
¢o +Changed main panel to use correct screen defaults.
¢o +Cater for shorter RIBE length in MVS Version 5 for@ENQ+and@ENQC+commands.
¢o +Changed the@EDT+command to handle 4-digit devices and 31-bit UCBs.
¢o +Changed the@PARM+command OS-Level requirements to OS/390 1.2.
¢o +Cater for empty SYSIN when running in Batch mode.
¢o +Fixed 0C4 abend in the CF command when there is more than one coupling
¢  +facility.
¢o +Fixed 0C4 abend during initialisation when RMF is not present.
¢o +Cater for ERBSMFI missing when using the@STOR+command.
+
!Changes For Version 1.3b
¢o +Added the@CF+command to show coupling facility information.
¢o +Added the@HSMQ+command to show DFHSM request queues.
¢o +Added the@NET+command to show VTAM major nodes.
¢o +Added the@SCLS+command to display SMS storage classes.
¢o +Added the@MCLS+command to display SMS management classes.
¢o +Changed the@EDT+command to cater for dynamic UCBs.
¢o +Removed the CAXWA logic from the@CAT+command.
¢o +Changed the@SMS+display to scrollable.
¢o +Make all command names on the main panel 'point-and-shoot'.
¢o +Fixed IPL prose date display problems.
¢o +Changed the@CPU+command to handle more than 999Mb of real/expanded storage.
+
!Changes For Version 1.3a
¢o +Added the@MAP()+and@LEN()+keywords to the@MEM+command.
¢o +Added the@JOB() MAJ()+and@SYS()+keywords to the@ENQ+command.
¢o +Added the@DSCB()+keyword to the@LINK LPA+and@APF+commands.
¢o +Added the@SGRP+command to display SMS storage groups.
¢o +Added the@SMS+command to display SMS configuration.
¢o +Added the@SMSM+command to display SMS modules.
¢o +Added the@SPD+command to display subpool descriptions.
¢o +Changed the@SP+command to show detail to the block level if requested.
¢o +Changed the@SRCH+command to bypass VIO datasets.
¢o +Point-and-shoot fields can now be selected using the TAB key.
¢o +Cater for increased answer area size for JES2 SSI-54 call.
¢o +Standardize date and time formats (yyyy/mm/dd hh.mm.ss) and add Year 2000
¢  +support.
¢o +Changed the@SET+command syntax to replace the old DSCB, ENQJ, ENQM and ENQS
¢  +commands.
¢o +REXX API now uses IRXEXCOM instead of IKJCT441.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHTOC
)END

MXIHCHP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CHP Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the online channel paths.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CHP chp-mask ONLY(type) NOT(type)
+
!Keywords      +
  @chp-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the channel path ID.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of chp-mask is '*'.
  @ONLY(type)  +Restrict the display to only show channels that are connected to
               +devices of a particular class :
               ¢COMMS   += Communications Devices
               ¢CTC     += CTC Devices
               ¢DASD    += Disk Devices
               ¢DISPLAY += Display Devices
               ¢TAPE    += Tape Devices
               ¢UNITREC += Unit Record Devices (Printers, Readers..etc)
  @NOT(type)   +Restrict the display by omitting channels that are connected to
               +devices of a particular class :
               ¢COMMS   += Communications Devices
               ¢CTC     += CTC Devices
               ¢DASD    += Disk Devices
               ¢DISPLAY += Display Devices
               ¢TAPE    += Tape Devices
               ¢UNITREC += Unit Record Devices (Printers, Readers..etc)
+
!Examples
+ @CHP 1%                + Show channels 10 to 1F
+ @CHP ONLY(DASD)        + Show channels attached to DASD devices
+ @CHP 2* NOT(TAPE)      + Show those channels in the 20-2F range that are not
+                        + connected to tape devices
+
