!Considerations
+  One line is shown for each channel per online device.
+
!Output panel fields
+ @CHP              +- Channel path ID
+ @Type             +- The channel path type
+ @Unit             +- Attached device unit address
+ @Devtype          +- The type of device from the UCBTYP field
+ @Devclass         +- The class of device
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCON
)END

MXIHCON.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CON Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the MCS console screen image of the nominated console.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CON name
+
!Keywords      +
  @name        +An optional keyword that specifies the console name.
               +If no keyword is specified, the first valid console found is
               +used.
+
!Examples
+ @CON 01      +  Show screen image of MCS console '01'.
+ @CON SYS1MSTR+  Show screen image of MCS console 'SYS1MSTR'
+
!Considerations
  +The@CON+command requires MXI to be running in authorized mode. For further
  +information on running MXI authorized, see the@MISC+section of this Help
  +dialog.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCPF
)END

MXIHCPF.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CPF Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the command prefix table.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CPF+
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Prefix          +- The command prefix used to route a command to a system
                   +  or subsystem.
  @Jobname         +- The name of the owning address space.
  @System          +- The name of the system to which this prefix is defined.
  @Scope           +- The scope of the prefix :
                     ¢System  +- The prefix applies to commands issued on the
                              +  system specified in 'System Name'.
                     ¢Sysplex +- The prefix applies to commands issued anywhere
                              +  within the sysplex.
  @Remove          +- Whether of not the prefix should be removed when entered
                   +  on the receiving system.
  @Faildisp        +- Failure Disposition :
                     ¢Purge   +- COMMTASK will automatically delete the prefix
                              +  when the system or subsystem fails.
                     ¢Syspurge+- COMMTASK will automatically delete the prefix
                              +  when the sysplex fails.
                     ¢Retain  +- The prefix will be retained in the event of
                              +  system or subsystem failure.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCPU
)END

MXIHCPU.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CPU Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays information concerning the CPU configuration.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CPU+
+
!Considerations
+  Without the MXI subsystem installed, the CPU command will not show LPAR
+  information if one or more of the following is true :
+
+  o System running under VM
+  o RMF is not active
+  o Processor not in PR/SM mode
+  o Operating system is OS/390 R10 or above
+
+ When the MXI subsystem is installed and the MXIU83 exit is active,  MXI can
+ gather LPAR information from SMF Type 70 records.
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The display is split into three main sections
+
!Processor Information
+ @CPU Model        +- The model number of the processor
+ @CPU Type Code    +- The model type of the processor
+ @Physical CPUs    +- The number of physical CPUs on the processor including
+                   +  those offline to this MVS image.
+ @Total MIPS       +- Estimated total MIPS.
+ @SU/Second        +- Service Units per second.
+ @MIPS/CPU         +- Estimated MIPS per CPU.
+ @CPU Adjustment   +- Value taken from RMCTADJC.
+ @MSU              +- Used for PSLC (not applicable for Amdahl machines).
+ @Serial Numbers   +- CPU serial numbers.
+
!Main Storage Information
+ @Real Online      +- The amount of real storage online (in Mb)

+  The following five fields are NOT shown when the system is running in ESAME
   (ARCHLVL=2) mode.

+ @Real Offline     +- The amount of real storage offline (in Mb)
+ @Real AFC         +- The number of real storage frames on the Available Frame
                    +  Queue
+ @Expanded Online  +- The amount of expanded storage online (in Mb)
+ @Expanded Offline +- The amount of expanded storage offline (in Mb)
+ @Expanded AFC     +- The number of expanded storage frames on the Available
                    +  Frame Queue.
+
!Logical Partition Information
+ @Configured LPARs +- The number of logical partitions defined

+ @LPAR Name        +- The name of the logical partition.
+ @LPAR Number      +- The number of the logical partition.
+ @Logical CPUs     +- The number of the logical CPUs available to this logical
+                   +  partition.
+ @Dedicated CPUs   +- The number of the CPUs that are dedicated to this
+                   +  logical partition.
+ @Relative Share   +- The relative share of CPU resources available to the
+                   +  logical partition.
+ @Cap              +- If the logical partition is capped (Yes/No)
+ @WTC              +- If the wait completion has be turned on in the logical
+ @                 +  partition definition (Yes/No)
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCS
)END

MXIHCS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CS Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current common storage usage by address space. This command
+  requires that VSM TRACK SQA(ON) CSA(ON) is specified in DIAGxx.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CS mask+
+
!Keywords
+  The value of 'mask' can be used to limit the display based on all or part of
+  the job name
+  A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%' can be used.
+  The default value for mask is '*'
+
!Example
+ @CS CIC*   +  - List common storage usage for all jobs starting 'CIC'
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Jobname         +- The address space name or one of the following special
                   +  values :
                     ¢*SYSTEM*+- Storage assigned to the operating system
                     ¢*TOTAL* +- Total amount of ALL jobs and system usage
                     ¢*UNKNOW*+- The owner of the storage cannot be determined
  @JobID           +- JES assigned job identifier (if available)
  @Date            +- The date (yyyy/mm/dd) that the address space started (if
                   +  available)
  @Time            +- The time (hh.mm.ss) that the address space started (if
                   +  available)
  @CSA             +- The amount (bytes) of CSA storage below the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space is using
  @E-CSA           +- The amount (bytes) of CSA storage above the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space is using
  @SQA             +- The amount (bytes) of SQA storage below the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space is using
  @E-SQA           +- The amount (bytes) of SQA storage above the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space is using
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHCSR
)END

MXIHCSR.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - CSR Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current common storage remaining after the owning address space
+  has ended. This command requires that VSM TRACK SQA(ON) CSA(ON) is specified
+  in DIAGxx.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @CSR mask+
+
!Keywords
+  The value of 'mask' can be used to limit the display based on all or part of
+  the job name.
+  A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%' can be used.
+  The default value for mask is '*'
+
!Example
+ @CSR CIC*  +  - List orphaned common storage for all jobs starting 'CIC'
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Jobname         +- The address space name or the following special value :
                     ¢*TOTAL* +- Total of all orphaned common storage for all
                              +  address spaces
  @JobID           +- JES assigned job identifier (if available)
  @Date            +- The date (yyyy/mm/dd) that the address space ended (if
                   +  available)
  @Time            +- The time (hh.mm.ss) that the address space ended (if
                   +  available)
  @CSA             +- The amount (bytes) of CSA storage below the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space left allocated
  @E-CSA           +- The amount (bytes) of CSA storage above the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space left allocated
  @SQA             +- The amount (bytes) of SQA storage below the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space is left allocated
  @E-SQA           +- The amount (bytes) of SQA storage above the 16Mb line that
                   +  the address space is left allocated
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDA
)END

MXIHDB.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DB Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the defined DB2 subsystems and allow the user to select which
+  subsystem to connect to for subsequent MXI DB2 commands.
+
+  The subsystem name chosen from the displayed list by point and shoot
+  action is stored in the ISPF profile as the default DB subsystem.
+  This can be changed at ANY point during a MXI session by re-issuing
+  the DB command.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DB submask
+
!Keywords      +
  @submask     +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the subsystem name.
               +The default value is '*'.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
+
!Examples
+ @DB D*             +List all DB2 subsystems that start 'C'.
+ @DB DSN1           +Set the DB subsystem to DSN1. All subsequent
                     +MXI DB2 commands will be directed to the
                     +DSN1 subsystem.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name            +- The subsystem name.
  @Status          +- The status of the DB2 subsystem (Active/Inactive).
  @Prefix          +- The command prefix for the DB2 subsystem.
+
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDBBP
)END

MXIHDBGP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DBGP Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays DB2 getpage requests for each active thread.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @GP DB(sub)
+
!Keywords      +
  @DB(sub)     +Direct the DBGP command to use the 'sub' DB2 subsystem.
+
!Examples
+ @DBGP              +List getpage requests from the current DB2 subsystem.
+ @DBGP DB(DSN2)     +List getpage requests from the DSN2 subsystem.

!Output Panel Fields
  @Token           +- The token value of the thread.
  @BP0-GP          +- Getpage requests for BP0 through to BP49.
  @BP0-SR          +- Synchronous reads for BP0 through to BP49.
  @BP8K-GP         +- Getpage requests for BP8K through to BP8K9.
  @BP8K-SR         +- Synchronous reads for BP8K through to BP8K9.
  @BP16K-GP        +- Getpage requests for BP16K through to BP16K9.
  @BP16K-SR        +- Synchronous reads for BP16K through to BP16K9.
  @BP32K-GP        +- Getpage requests for BP32K through to BP32K9.
  @BP32K-SR        +- Synchronous reads for BP32K through to BP32K9.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDBLK
)END

MXIHDBZP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DBZP Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the derived DB2 system parameters in pseudo assembler macro source
+  statements.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DBZP DB(sub)
+
!Keywords      +
  @DB(sub)     +Direct the DBZP command to use the 'sub' DB2 subsystem.
+
!Examples
+ @DBZP              +List system parms from the current DB2 subsystem.
+ @DBZP DB(DSN2)     +List system parms from the DSN2 subsystem.
+
!Considerations
 +For the DBZP command to function correctly, the userid must have the MONITOR1
 +DB2 privilege.
+
!Known Limitations
 +The statements are presented WITHOUT ending commas or continuation characters
 +in column 72.
 +The RESTART/DEFER positional keyword on DSN6SPRM is not currently reported
 +by MXI.
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDCLS
)END

MXIHDDNS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DDNS Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current allocated DDNAMEs and their associated datasets.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DDNS dd-mask JOB(jobname)
+              @ASID(asid)
+
!Keywords      +
  @dd-mask     +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the DDNAME.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
               +The default value for dd-mask is '*'.
  @JOB(jobname)+An optional keyword that specifies the address space name whose
               +dataset allocations are to be examined. Wildcards are not
               +allowed.
  @ASID(asid)  +An optional keyword that specifies the hexadecimal ASID whose
               +dataset allocations are to be examined. All four bytes of the
               +ASID keyword MUST be completed. Wildcards are not allowed.

               +Note that the JOB() and ASID() keywords require MXI to be
               +running authorized. For further information on running MXI in
               +authorized mode, please see the@MISC+section of this HELP dialog
!Example
+ @DDNS ISPPLIB          +List all datasets allocated to ISPPLIB for the current
+                        +address space.
+ @DDNS PROC* JOB(JES2)  +List all datasets allocated to ddnames starting
+                        +'PROC' in the JES2 address space.
+ @DDNS * ASID(02BC)     +List all datasets allocated to ddnames in the address
+                        +space whose ASID is '02BC'.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @DDName          +- The DD Name allocated
  @Cat             +- The concatenation sequence number of the current DDNAME.
  @Unit            +- DASD Device unit address
                   +  If the DDNAME is allocated to a non-DASD device, this
                   +  field will be blank and the point-and-shoot functions
                   +  for this entry will be inactive
  @Volser          +- Volume serial number of the dataset allocated to the
                   +  DDNAME. This field is blank for VIO
  @EXCP            +- Recorded I/O count for the dataset.
  @Dataset         +- The name of the dataset allocated to the DDNAME
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDEV
)END

MXIHDEV.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DEV Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the device activity for online DASD volumes. It can be directed to
+  collect data depending on either volume serial or unit address.
+
+  This command requires RMF to be installed and active.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DEV  ser-mask   SGRP(sgrp-mask) RESP(ms)
+ @     U=unt-mask
+
!Keywords      +
  @ser-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the volume serial number.
               +The default value for ser-mask is '*'.
  @unt-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the unit address.
  @sgrp-mask   +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the SMS Storage Group name.
  @ms          +An optional minimum response time specification in milliseconds.
               +Devices are only displayed whose response time is greater than
               +or equal to the specified value. The range is from 0 - 999.
               +The default value is 0.

  +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%' can be used
  +in all of the masks.
+
!Examples
+ @DEV  MVS%00                + List all DASD volumes MVSx00
+ @DEV  U=08*                 + List all DASD units in the range 0800-08FF
+ @DEV  SGRP(PROD*)           + List all volumes in the SMS Storage Group 'PROD'
+ @DEV  RESP(10)              + List all volumes whose response time is >= 10ms.

!Output Panel Fields
  @Volser          +- Volume serial number for the volume
  @Unit            +- Device unit address for the volume
  @MX              +- Number of exposures if a multiple exposure device
  @LCU             +- Hex logical control unit number
  @User            +- Number of users of the device.
  @DCB             +- Number of open DCBs on the device.
  @SSCH            +- Start SubChannel count per second
  @RESP            +- Response time (ms). This does NOT include IOSQ time.
  @CON%            +- Percentage device connect time
  @DSC%            +- Percentage device disconnect time
  @PND%            +- Percentage function pending time
  @ACT%            +- Percentage function active time
  @SGRP            +- SMS Storage Group
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDSP
)END

MXIHDS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DS Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays your personal dataset list from where you can use point-and-shoot
+  to invoke ISPF EDIT, VIEW or DSLIST.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DS mask
+
!Keywords
+  The value of 'mask' can be used to directly pass control to ISPF DSLIST
+  without presenting the personal dataset list. Note that a value of '*' is
+  is ignored and the personal dataset list is displayed.
+
+  o  If the dataset name contains the '*' wildcard or '%' placeholder the
+     dataset name and volser will be passed to ISPF DSLIST (option 3.4) when
+     the user performs point-and-shoot.
+  o  Otherwise the dataset name and volser are passed to ISPF EDIT (or VIEW).
+  o  If the dataset name contains brackets, it will be marked unusable.
+  o  If the dataset does not exist then it will be marked unusable.
+  o  The@DS+command will sort the dataset list prior to display.
+
+  The personal dataset list is defined using the@SET DS+command.
+
!Considerations
+  The@SRCH+command CAN be used on the DS display.
+
!Examples
+ @DS              +- Shows saved list of personal datasets.
+ @DS SYS1.*       +- Invokes ISPF DSLIST with SYS1.* as the level
+
!Panel Fields
  @Dataset          +- The dataset name or DSLIST mask
  @Volser           +- Optional volume serial
  @Blksz        ¢(*)+- Block size of dataset
  @Tracks       ¢(*)+- Total allocated tracks used by the dataset
  @%Use         ¢(*)+- Percentage of the allocated tracks used by the dataset
  @XT           ¢(*)+- Number of primary and secondary extents of the dataset
+
                ¢(*)+- Not available for DSLIST entries
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHFIND
)END

MXIHDSP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DSP Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the dataspaces that are in use.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DSP nam-mask JOB(jobname) SCOPE(COMMON)
+ @             ASID(asid)
+
!Keywords       +
  @nam-mask     +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
                +displayed list on all or part of the dataspace name.
                +The wildcard character of '*' and placeholder character of '%'
                +can be used. The default value of nam-mask is '*'.
  @JOB(jobname) +An optional keyword that specifies the address space name whose
                +dataspaces are to be listed.
                +The wildcard character of '*' and placeholder character of '%'
                +can be used. The default value is '*'.
  @ASID(asid)   +An optional keyword that specifies the hexadecimal ASID whose
                +dataspaces are to be listed. All four bytes of the ASID keyword
                +MUST be completed. Wildcards are not allowed.
  @SCOPE(COMMON)+An optional keyword that limits the displayed list to those
                +dataspaces that are SCOPE=COMMON.

                +Note that this use of this command requires MXI to be running
                +authorized. For information on running MXI in authorized
                +mode, please see the@MISC+section of this HELP dialog
+
!Examples
+ @DSP I*             +  List all dataspaces starting 'I'.
+ @DSP * JOB(VLF)     +  List all dataspaces owned by VLF.
+ @DSP SCOPE(COMMON)  +  List all SCOPE=COMMON dataspaces.
+
!Considerations
  +The maximum CADS value under z/Architecture mode will include TWO reserved
  +entries used internally by z/OS that are not accounted for in the user
  +specified MAXCAD value in IEASYSxx.
  +
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name           +- Name of the dataspace.
  @Jobname        +- The jobname of the address space that owns the dataspace.
  @ASID           +- Hex ASID of the owning address space.
  @ASCB           +- The address of the ASCB of the owning address space.
  @ASTE           +- The ASTE address for the dataspace.
  @Stoken         +- Hex token of the dataspace.
  @Scope          +- Whether the dataspace is SCOPE=COMMON or not
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHDYNX
)END

MXIHDYNX.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - DYNX Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Dynamic Exit information
+
!Command Syntax
+ @DYNX name-mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @name-mask   +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the dynamic exit name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of name-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @DYNX SYSJES2.*+ List all dynamic exits defined to SMF subsystem JES2
+
!Considerations
 + The@DYNX+command requires MXI to be running in authorized mode. For
 + information on running MXI authorized, see the@MISC+section of this
 + Help dialog.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name          +- Name of the Dynamic Exit
  @Module        +- Name of the load module associated with the Dynamic Exit
  @EPA           +- Entry point address of the module
  @Location      +- Storage location of the module
  @Length        +- Length of the module
  @Filter        +- Specifies the conditions under which the exit will get
                 +  control. This can be '*' for all jobs, a partial jobname
                 +  using '*' as a wildcard or a specific jobname (no wildcard
                 +  specified). When the exit is using STOKENs to control the
                 +  execution of the exit, this field will be set to '<stoken>'
  @Status        +- Exit Status (Active/Inactive)
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHEDT
)END

MXIHEDT.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - EDT Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Eligible Device Table entries.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @EDT unt-mask +
+
!Keywords      +
  @unt-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the unitname.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of unt-mask is '*'.
+
!Examples
+ @EDT SYS*  +  List EDT unitnames that start 'SYS'.
+ @EDT 3390  +  List all devices in generic unitname of 3390.
+
+When more than one EDT unitname matches the specified pattern mask, a summary
+list is displayed.

!Output Panel Fields
  @Unitname        +- The generic or esoteric unitname
  @Devclass        +- The device class of the unitname
  @Type            +- The type of unitname (Generic/Esoteric)
  @VIO             +- Unitname is eligible for VIO (VIO/No)
+
+Note : A unitname of '********' is added to this list. Selection of this field
+       will display all device classes.
+
+When only a single EDT unitname matches the specified pattern mask, a more
+detailed display is presented.

!Output Panel Fields
  @Unit            +- Unit address of device in the unitname
  @Unitname        +- The generic or esoteric unitname
  @Devclass        +- The device class of the unitname
  @Type            +- The type of unitname (Generic/Esoteric)
  @VIO             +- Unitname is eligible for VIO (VIO/No)
  @Status          +- Unit status (Online/Offline)
  @Volser          +- Volume Serial of the unit (if applicable)
  @Jobname         +- Name of the job currently using the device
  @Devtype         +- The hex device type from the UCB
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHEMCS
)END

)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)

)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - ENQ Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Enqueue information.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @ENQ min-mask JOB(job-mask) MAJ(maj-mask) SYS(sys-mask)
+
!Keywords      +
  @min-mask      +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
                 +displayed list on all or part of the minor name (rname).
                 +The wildcard character of '*' and placeholder character of '%'
                 +can be used.
                 +The default value for min-mask is '*'.
  @JOB(job-mask) +Specifies that only Enqueue information for address spaces
                 +that match the 'job-mask' pattern are to be displayed.
                 +The default value is '*'.
  @MAJ(maj-mask) +Specifies that only Enqueue information for resources with a
                 +major name that matches the 'maj-mask' pattern are to be
                 +displayed.
                 +The default value is 'SYSDSN'.
  @SYS(job-mask) +Specifies that only Enqueue information for systems that match
                 +the 'sys-mask' pattern are to be displayed.
                 +The default value is '*'.
+
!Examples
+ @ENQ                         +Show Enqueues using current defaults
+ @ENQ SYS1.*                  +Show Enqueues for all SYS1 datasets
+ @ENQ SYS1.* JOB(CIC*)        +Enqueues for all SYS1 datasets for CIC* jobs
+ @ENQ MAJ(SYSZVTOC)           +Show SYSZVTOC enqueues
+ @ENQ * MAJ(SPF*) JOB(USER%%) +SPF Enqueues for USERnn jobs
+
!Considerations
+  (1) Up to 40,000 results can be shown.
+  (2) The values for MAJ, JOB and SYS can also be changed by using the
+      appropriate@SET+command (e.g. SET JOB CICS*).
+  (3) The values passed on the MAJ, JOB and SYS keywords are active for all
+      subsequent ENQ commands until re-specified.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Major        +- The major name (or qname) used to enqueue the resource
  @Minor        +- The minor name (or rname) used to enqueue the resource
  @Jobname      +- The jobname that issued the enqueue
  @Req          +- The status of the enqueue :
                +     ¢S   +: Job has shared control of the resource
                +     ¢E   +: Job has exclusive control of the resource
                +     ¢SW  +: Job is waiting for shared control
                +     ¢EW  +: Job is waiting for exclusive control
                +     ¢SO  +: Job has shared control of the resource and
                +             other jobs are waiting for exclusive control
                +     ¢EO  +: Job has exclusive control of the resource and
                +             other jobs are waiting for exclusive or shared
                +             control
                +     ¢xxR +: Enqueue is in fact a RESERVE
                +     ¢xxG +: RESERVE has been converted to a Global Enqueue
  @Sys          +- The system that the enqueue was issued on
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHENQC
)END

)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - ENQC Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #

+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays any enqueue contention on the system.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @ENQC+
+
!Considerations
+  (1) If enqueue contention exists, the resources are shown in the same
+      format as the@ENQ+command.
+  (2) The current MAJ, JOB and SYS settings are ignored.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHEXC
)END

MXIHEXC.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - EXC Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current system exceptions.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @EXC XPT(xx)
+
!Keywords      +
  @XPT(xx)       +An optional exception table suffix 'xx'. This two character
                 +value is appended to 'MXIXPT' to form the name of the table
                 +that is to be used. The table is held a a load module and is
                 +loaded either from the MXIXPT DDname or from JOBLIB, STEPLIB
                 +or MVS linklist.
                 +If this keyword is omitted, the default value of XPT(00) is
                 +used unless it has been previously overwritten by the@SET XPT
                 +command.
+
+The exceptions are displayed under four main sections.
+
!System Wide Exceptions
  +These exceptions can include the following :
   o +System CPU percentage busy
   o +UIC value
   o +Number of free ASVT slots
   o +CSA, SQA, E-CSA and E-SQA percentage used
   o +Amount of CSA and E-CSA converted to SQA and E-SQA
   o +The number of online CPUs
+
!Enqueue Conflicts and RESERVEs
  +Any RESERVEs and enqueue conflicts are ALWAYS shown regardless of
   the success of loading the MXIXPTxx exceptions table.
+
!DASD Volume Exceptions
  +These exceptions ALWAYS include listing any DASD devices that are
  +pending offline and can also include exceptions for DASD volumes that
  +should or should not be online.
+
!Address Space Exceptions
  +These exceptions can include the following :
   o +Address space CPU percentage busy
   o +Real and expanded storage frames in use
   o +Working set size
   o +Non-VIO auxiliary storage slots
   o +CSA, SQA , E-CSA and E-SQA usage
   o +Number of minutes that the address space has been waiting
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHGQE
)END

MXIHFIND.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - FIND Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Finds, highlights and scrolls to a specified character string.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @FIND  char @ NEXT
+ @F            FIRST
+ @             LAST
+ @             PREV
+ @             ALL
+
!Keywords
+ @char   +Must be a single word or character string.
+ @NEXT   +Searches forwards through the data. (Default).
+ @FIRST  +Searches forwards from the beginning of the data.
+ @LAST   +Searches for the last occurrence of the character string.
+ @PREV   +Searches backwards through the data.
+ @ALL    +Searches all of the data for all occurrences of the character string
+
!Associated Commands
+ @IFIND  +Repeats the previous FIND command.
+ @RESET  +Resets the highlighted 'found' strings.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMAKE
)END

MXIHGQE.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - GQE Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Getmain Queue Elements that describe all allocated
+  blocks of common storage.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @GQE mask T(type)+
+
!Keywords
+ @mask      +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
+            +displayed list on all or part of the address space name.
+            +A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
+            +can be used.
+            +The default value for mask is '*'.
+
+ @T(type)   +Restrict the display to only show GQE entries of a particular
+             type:
+            ¢C   += Active common storage from CSA or E-CSA.
+            ¢S   += Active common storage from SQA or E-SQA.
+            ¢C-  += Orphaned common storage from CSA or E-CSA.
+            ¢S-  += Orphaned common storage from SQA or E-SQA.
+            ¢-   += All orphaned common storage.
+
!Examples
+ @GQE CIC*      + - List common storage GQEs for all jobs starting 'CI C'
+ @GQE T(C)      + - List all active CSA and E-CSA storage.
+ @GQE T(-)      + - List all orphaned common storage
+ @GQE T(-) JES2 + - List all orphaned common storage that was owned by  JES2.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Address        +- Starting address of common storage block.
  @Length         +- Length of allocated storage.
  @T              +- Type of storage :
                    ¢C + Active CSA or E-CSA
                    ¢C-+ Orphaned CSA or E-CSA (Owner Gone)
                    ¢S + Active SQA or E-SQA
                    ¢S-+ Orphaned SQA or E-SQA (Owner Gone)
  @Owner          +- Owner of the storage.
  @SP             +- Subpool number.
  @Key            +- Storage protect key.
  @Return         +- Return address from Getmain.
  @Date           +- Date (yyyy/mm/dd) and time (hh.mm.ss) that the sto rage
                  +  was allocated.
  @GQE            +- GQE address.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHGRS
)END

MXIHGRS.text:

)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function

!Output Panel Fields
  @Type            +- Type of Resource Name List (Include/Exclude/Reserve)
