MXIHHFS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - HFS Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the mounted OpenEdition HFS File Systems.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @HFS mask VIEW(type)
+
!Keywords      +
  @mask        +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the path or dataset name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mask is '*'.
  @VIEW(type)  +An optional keyword that specifies which view is chosen for the
               +summary display.
               + ¢VIEW(PATH)+: shows the first 44 bytes of the path name.
               + ¢VIEW(DSN) +: shows the MVS dataset name.
               +The default value is VIEW(PATH).
+
!Example
+ @HFS /u*               +List all HFS file systems that start '/u'.
+ @HFS SYS1.* VIEW(DSN)  +List all HFS file systems whose MVS datasets have a
+                        +high level qualifier of 'SYS1'.
+
!Considerations
+  This command requires OS/390 2.6 or above.
+
+When more than one HFS file system matches the specified pattern, a summary
+list is displayed.

!Output Panel Fields
  @Path            +- The first 44 bytes of the path name.
  @Dataset     ¢(*)+- The MVS dataset name.
  @Type            +- The type of file system :
                       ¢MVS     +- MVS Local File System
                       ¢Remote  +- Remote File System
                       ¢Pipe    +- Pipe file system
                       ¢Socket  +- Socket file system
                       ¢XPFS    +- Cross System PFS (XPFS)
                       ¢CSPS    +- Char special streams
  @Volser      ¢(*)+- The volume serial of the MVS dataset.
  @Mode            +- The write protection mode (RO/RW).
  @Status          +- The status of the file system.
  @Sys             +- The owning system.
+
+              ¢(*)+- Only available when VIEW(DSN) specified.
+
+When only one HFS file system matches the specified pattern, a more detailed
+list is displayed.
+
!File System
  @Dataset Name    +- The MVS dataset name.
  @Volume Serial   +- The volume upon which the the above dataset resides.
  @System          +- The owning system.
  @Type            +- The type of file system :
                       ¢MVS     +- MVS Local File System
                       ¢Remote  +- Remote File System
                       ¢Pipe    +- Pipe file system
                       ¢Socket  +- Socket file system
                       ¢XPFS    +- Cross System PFS (XPFS)
                       ¢CSPS    +- Char special streams
  @Mode            +- The write protection mode (RO/RW).
  @FS-Type         +- The file system type name from the FILESYSTYPE parmlib
                   +  statement.
  @Status          +- The status of the file system.
  @Device Number   +- The device number of the file system.
  @Parent Device   +- The parent device number.
  @Security        +- Whether security is to be used to access this file
                      system.
  @SetUID          +- Whether SetUID can be issued for this file system.
  @Path            +- The full path name.
  @Mount Parameter +- Any parameters specified on the mount request.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHHSM
)END

MXIHHSM.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - HSM Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current HSM configuration.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @HSM+
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The display is split into three sections
+
!HSM Information
+ @Jobname                +- The name of the HSM address space.
+ @Version                +- The version of HSM.
+ @Parmlib Suffix         +- The suffix of the ARCCMDxx member.
+ @Host                   +- The HSM host number.
+ @Backup Prefix          +- The prefix used for all HSM backup datasets.
+ @Migrate Prefix         +- The prefix used for all HSM migration datasets.
+ @Backup Tasks           +- Maximum concurrent backup tasks.
+ @Dump Tasks             +- Maximum concurrent dump tasks.
+ @Recall Tasks           +- Maximum concurrent recall tasks.
+ @Tape Recall Tasks      +- Maximum concurrent tape recall tasks.
+ @Migrate Tasks          +- Maximum concurrent migrate tasks.
+ @Int Migrate Tasks      +- Maximum concurrent volume interval migrate tasks.
+ @Recover Tasks          +- Maximum concurrent recover tasks.
+ @MCVT Address           +- Address of the MCVT control block in the HSM
                          +  address space.
+ @ASCB Address           +- Address of the HSM ASCB.
+ @ASID                   +- Hex address space ID of HSM.
+ @QCT Address            +- Address of the QCT control block.
+ @SMF Record             +- The SMF record number used by HSM.
+
!CSA MWE Queue Control
+ @Max Limit              +- The maximum size of the CSA MWE queue.
+ @Active Limit           +- The percentage limit of the CSA queue when
+                         +  HSM is active. After this limit is reached
+                         +  and HSM is active, only batch WAIT MWEs will be
+                         +  added to the CSA queue.
+ @CSA Used               +- Percentage of the CSA MWE queue currently being
+                         +  used.
+ @Inactive Limit         +- The percentage limit of the CSA queue when
+                         +  HSM is inactive. After this limit is reached
+                         +  and HSM is inactive, no MWEs will be added to the
+                         +  CSA queue.
+ @MWEs Per ASID          +- Maximum number of MWEs to allow per ASID in the
+                         +  CSA queue.
+
!Subtask Status
+ @task-name              +- The status of various internal HSM tasks are
+                         +  displayed.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHHSMQ
)END

MXIHHSMQ.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - HSMQ Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current HSM Request Queue.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @HSMQ
+
!Considerations
+  The HSMQ command processes unsupported control block chains in the HSM
+  address space to retrieve the information required. It is possible that
+  the information returned may be missing some of the active requests. It is
+  also possible that this command will report zero requests when running
+  Multiple Address Space HSM (MASH).
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Request         +- Type of HSM Request (Migrate, Recall,..etc)
  @Status          +- The status of the request. This is either '*' or
                   +  the position number in the request queue.
  @Number          +- HSM assigned request sequence number
  @Userid          +- The userid that issued the HSM request
  @Dataset         +- The dataset name affected by the HSM request OR the
                   +  command text if the type of request is 'Command'.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHINIT
)END

MXIHINIT.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - INIT Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the status of the JES2 initiators.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @INIT+
+
!Considerations
+  This command is valid only when JES2 is the primary subsystem.
+
+  There is also a requirement that the modules HASMHCCT and HASMSJB are
+  available to MXI via the LOAD instruction. These modules are used to
+  determine certain JES2 control block offsets that are used to gather
+  the initiator information. These modules are found in the SHASMIG dataset
+  which is usually in the linklist.
+
+  If MXI is running authorised and the SHASMIG dataset is NOT APF authorised,
+  then the BATCH invocation of this command requires the following JCL card to
+  be added the the jobstep:
+
+  //SHASMIG  DD  DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.SHASMIG
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @ID              +- The ID of the initiator.
  @Classes         +- The job classes the initiator can serve up to a
                   +  maximum of 12 entries.
  @Status          +- The status of the initiator.
  @Jobname         +- The name of the job running in the initiator.
  @Step            +- The name of the current step.
  @ProcStep        +- The name of the current procedure step.
  @JobID           +- The JES2 assigned job identifier.
  @C               +- The job class.
  @Owner           +- The owner of the job.
  @ASID            +- The hex address space identifier.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHIPL
)END

MXIHIPL.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - IPL Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current IPL and LOAD information.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @IPL+
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The display is split into five main sections
+
!IPL Information
+ @Volume Serial          +- The volume serial of the System Residence volume
+ @Load Parm              +- The load parameter used during the IPL
+ @Unit Address           +- The unit address of the System Residence volume
+ @CVT Version ID         +- The Version ID that is stored in the CVT prefix
+ @Date                   +- The date (yyyy/mm/dd) of the IPL
+ @Julian Date            +- The julian date (yyddd) of the IPL
+ @Time                   +- The time (hh.mm.ss) of the IPL
+ @Prose                  +- The date of the IPL in text format
+
!Load Information
+ @IODF File              +- The dataset name of the IODF file
+ @Unit Address           +- The unit address of the IODF file
+ @Changed Date           +- The date (yyyy/mm/dd) of the last change to the
+ @                       +  IODF file
+ @Changed Time           +- The time (hh.mm.ss) of the last change to the IODF
+ @                       +  file
+ @OS Config              +- The operating system configuration selected
+ @EDT                    +- The eligible device table selected
+ @Nucleus                +- The MVS Nucleus selected
+ @NUCLSTxx               +- The NUCLSTxx member selected
+ @LOADxx Dataset         +- The dataset that the LOADxx member was read from
+ @Unit Address           +- The unit address of the LOADxx dataset
+ @Master JCL From        +- Where the master JCL is loaded from
+ @ARCHLVL                +- The ARCHLVL setting (OS/390 R10+ only)
+ @IEASYSxx               +- Interpolated IEASYSxx suffixes used
+ @IEASYMxx               +- IEASYM specification from LOADxx
+ @HWNAME                 +- The hardware name
+ @VMUSERID               +- The VM Userid (if running under VM)
+ @LPARNAME               +- The LPAR Name (if running in PR/SM mode)
+
!Master Catalog Information
+ @Dataset Name           +- The dataset name of the Master Catalog
+ @Volume Serial          +- The volume serial of the Master Catalog
+ @Catalog Type           +- Type of Master Catalog (VSAM/ICF/SYS%)
+ @Service Limit          +- Catalog Address Space lower service limit
+ @Alias Levels           +- The multi-level alias setting
+
!Configuration Information
+ @JES Node Name          +- The JES defined NJE node name
+ @JES Member Name        +- The JES defined member name
+ @GRS Mode               +- GRS mode of execution (None/Ring/Star)
+ @Job Wait Time          +- The SMF defined job wait time
+ @TCP/IP Address         +- The TCP/IP address of the host
+ @WLM Mode               +- The mode of WLM operation
+
!Sysplex Information
+ @SYSPLEX Name           +- The name of the sysplex
+ @Clone Value            +- The value of &SYSCLONE
+ @Date                   +- The date of the last SYSPLEX cold start
+ @Time                   +- The time of the last SYSPLEX cold start
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHLINK
)END

MXIHLINK.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - LINK Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Linklist datasets.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @LINK dsn-mask DSCB(ON/OFF) LLS(name)
+
!Keywords      +
  @dsn-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the dataset name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
               +The default value for dsn-mask is '*'.
  @DSCB(ON/OFF)+Specifies that DSCB collection is activated or inactivated.
  @LLS(name)   +Specifies that datasets for the linklist set 'name' are shown.
+
!Examples
+ @LINK SYS1.*+    List all SYS1 datasets in the current Linklist.
+ @LINK DSCB(ON)  +List all Linklist datasets and collect DSCB information.
+ @LINK * LLS(TST)+List all Linklist datasets in the linklist set 'TST'.
+
!Considerations
  +If the@SET DSCB ON+command has been issued, or the@DSCB(ON)+keyword has
  +been specified, the LINK command will collect DCB and space allocation
  +information for each dataset displayed.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Dataset          +- The Linklist entry dataset name
  +                    When@DSCB+is@ON+the dataset name will only be active for
                       point-and-shoot functions when it exists on the specified
                       volser
  @Volser           +- Volume Serial definition for the dataset
  @Blksz        ¢(*)+- Block size of dataset
  @Tracks       ¢(*)+- Total allocated tracks used by the dataset
  @%Use         ¢(*)+- Percentage of the allocated tracks used by the dataset
  @XT           ¢(*)+- Number of primary and secondary extents of the dataset
  @APF              +- Is the dataset specifically defined to the APF list.
                    + ¢APF+Yes
                    + ¢LNK+No - but LNKAUTH=LNKLST has been specified so the
                    +      dataset acquires APF authorisation.
+
                ¢(*)+- Only available when the@DSCB+settings is@ON+
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHLLA
)END

MXIHLLS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  ¯ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - LLS Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
¯MXIHAREA                                                                      ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
¯                                                                              ¯
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the defined Linklist sets.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @LLS
+
!Output Panel Fields
+ @Name              + Name of the Linklist set
+ @Status            + Status of the Linklist set (Current/Previous/New)
+ @Sequence          + Sequence number of the Linklist set
+ @Monitor           + Is the linklist set monitored by LLA
+ @ASIDs             + Number of address spaces using this Linklist set
+ @Datasets          + Number of datasets in this Linklist set
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHLLSU
)END

MXIHLLSU.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - LLSU Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the Linklist set usage by address space
+
!Command Syntax
+ @LLSU job-mask LLS(name)
+
!Keywords      +
  @job-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the address space name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
               +The default value for job-mask is '*'.
  @LLS(name)   +An optional keyword that limits the display to only include
               +address spaces that are using Linklist set 'name'.
+
!Examples
+ @LLSU CIC*            + List the Linklist sets for all jobs starting 'CIC'
+ @LLSU IMS* LLS(MYLLS) + List all jobs starting 'IMS' that use the 'MYLSS'
                        + Linklist set.
+
!Considerations
  +The LLS keyword must specify the entire Linklist set name - wildcards cannot
  +be specified.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Jobname          +- The name of the address space
  @JobID            +- JES assigned job identifier
  @ASID             +- Hexadecimal address space identifier
  @ASCB             +- Address of the ASCB control block for this address space
  @ASSB             +- Address of the ASSB control block for this address space
  @LLS              +- Linklist set name used by this address space
  @DLCB             +- Address of the DLCB control block
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHLOGR
)END

MXIHLOGR.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - LOGR Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current active log streams.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @LOGR log-mask
+
!Keywords      +
  @log-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the log stream name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @LOGR ATR* +  List all log streams starting 'ATR'.
+
!Considerations
  +The@LOGR+command requires the MXIU83 exit to be installed and active.
  +It also requires the MXI subsystem. MXI collects log stream information from
  +SMF-88 records collected by the MXIU83 exit which are placed into a common
  +storage area pointed to by the MXI subsystem.
+
+ +After initial installation of the MXIU83 exit, the LOGR command will only be
+ +able to show logger information after the next SMF interval.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Stream          +- Name of the log stream.
  @Struct          +- Name of the structure or '*DASDONLY* for DASD-only log
                   +  streams.
  @T1-Comp         +- Number of Type-1 completions.
  @T2-Comp         +- Number of Type-2 completions.
  @T3-Comp         +- Number of Type-3 completions.
+
+When only one log stream matches the specified pattern mask, a more detailed
+list is displayed.

!Log Stream
  @Log Stream Name +- The name of the log stream.
  @Statistics Date +- The date that the statistics were gathered (yyyy/mm/dd).
  @           Time +- The time that the statistics were gathered.
  @Minimum BLOCKLEN+- The minimum blocklen value of IXGWRITE seen during the
                   +  expiring SMF interval.
  @Maximum BLOCKLEN+- The maximum blocklen value of IXGWRITE seen during the
                   +  expiring SMF interval.
  @Stage Datasets  +- The log stream is using staging datasets.
  @Disconnected    +- The log stream is disconnected from the system.
  @No of IXGWRITES +- The number of IXGWRITE invocations seen during the
                   +  expiring SMF interval.
  @Appl Bytes Req  +- The number of bytes requested by user applications
                   +  on IXGWRITE invocations during the expiring SMF
                   +  interval.
  @Bytes to DASD   +- Count of bytes written ro DASD during the expiring
                   +  SMF interval.

!Structure
  @Structure Name  +- The associated structure name or '*DASDONLY*' for
                   +  DASD-only log streams
  @Current Written +- Count of bytes written to interim storage during the
                   +  expiring SMF interval.
  @Current Instead +- Count of bytes deleted from interim storage instead of
                   +  being written to DASD during the expiring SMF interval.
  @Current After   +- Count of bytes deleted from interim storage after being
                   +  written to DASD during the expiring SMF interval.
  @Instead Invoke  +- Count of times a deletion from interim storage was
                   +  performed during the expiring SMF interval where the data
                   +  was not first migrated to DASD.
  @Instead Invoke  +- Count of times a deletion from interim storage was
                   +  performed during the expiring SMF interval after the data
                   +  was migrated to DASD.
  @Type-1 Complete +- Count of type-1 completions. Log stream contents can
                   +  remain in interim storage. No need to move data from
                   +  interim storage to DASD.
  @Type-2 Complete +- Count of type-2 completions. Log stream is filling
                   +  interim storage but is not critical. Logger must
                   +  move data from interim storage to DASD.
  @Type-3 Complete +- Count of type-3 completions. Space used in interim
                   +  storage by this log stream is critical.

!Events
  @Structure Full  +- Count of the number of times IXGWRITE detected a
                   +  'structure full' condition during the expiring SMF
                   +  interval.
  @Str Rebuild Sta +- Number of 'structure rebuild' events initiated
                   +  during the expiring SMF interval.
  @DASD Shifts     +- Number of log stream DASD-shifts initiated during
                   +  the expiring SMF interval.
  @Str Rebuild End +- Number of 'structure rebuild' events completed
                   +  during the expiring SMF interval.
  @Stage DSN Thresh+- Count of the number of times IXGWRITE detected a
                   +  'staging dataset threshold hit' condition during
                   +  the expiring SMF interval.
  @Offload OK      +- Number of successful offloads performed.
  @Stage DSN Full  +- Count of the number of times IXGWRITE detected a
                   +  'staging dataset full' condition during the expiring
                   +  SMF interval.
  @Offload 90%     +- Number of times offload was initiated due to the
                   +  total in-use list entries reaching 90% during the
                   +  expiring SMF interval.
  @Offload Requests+- Number of times a demand initiated offload was
                   +  requested (via IXGOFFLD) during the expiring SMF
                   +  interval.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHLPA
)END

MXIHLPA.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - LPA Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current LPA dataset list.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @LPA dsn-mask DSCB(ON/OFF)
+
!Keywords      +
  @dsn-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the dataset name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
               +The default value for dsn-mask is '*'.
  @DSCB(ON)    +Specifies that DSCB collection should be activated.
  @DSCB(OFF)   +Specifies that DSCB collection should be inactivated.
+
!Examples
+ @LPA SYS1.*+     List all SYS1 datasets in the current LPA list.
+ @LPA * DSCB(ON) +List all LPA datasets and collect DSCB information.
+
!Considerations
  +If the@SET DSCB ON+command has been issued, or the@DSCB(ON)+keyword has
  +been specified, the LPA command will collect DCB and space allocation
  +information for each dataset displayed.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Dataset          +- The LPA List entry dataset name
  +                    When@DSCB+is@ON+the dataset name will only be active for
                       point-and-shoot functions when it exists on the specified
                       volser
  @Volser           +- Volume Serial definition for the dataset
  @Blksz        ¢(*)+- Block size of dataset
  @Tracks       ¢(*)+- Total allocated tracks used by the dataset
  @%Use         ¢(*)+- Percentage of the allocated tracks used by the dataset
  @XT           ¢(*)+- Number of primary and secondary extents of the dataset
  @APF              +- Is the dataset specifically defined to the APF list
  +
                ¢(*)+- Only available when the@DSCB+settings is@ON+
  +
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHLPD
)END

MXIHLPD.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - LPD Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Link Pack Directory entries (LPA Modules).
+
!Command Syntax
+ @LPD mod-mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @mod-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the module name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mod-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @LPD IGC*  +  List all LPA Modules starting with 'IGC'.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Module         +- Name of the LPA module
  @Major          +- When non-blank, this entry is a minor LPDE and this field
                  +  contains the name of the corresponding major LPDE
  @EPA            +- Entry point address of the module
  @Location       +- Storage location of the module
  @Length         +- Length of the module
  @AC             +- Authorisation code of the module (00/01)
  @APF            +- Was module loaded from an APF authorised dataset (APF/No)
  @Rent           +- Is module Re-entrant (Rent/No)
  @Rent           +- Is module Re-usable (Reus/No)
  @Type           +- Indicator for 'Dynamic' or 'Active' LPA entry
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMCLS
)END

MXIHMAKE.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MAKE Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Change the swap status of a selected address space
+
!Command Syntax
+ $MAKE jobname SWAP(YES/NO)
+ $     A=asid  CPU(MAX/MIN)
+
!Keywords
+ $jobname   +A specific jobname of a single active address space whose
+            +swap status is to be changed.
+ $A=asid    +An alternative specification to jobname that uses the hexadecimal
+            +address space id (ASID) rather than the jobname. Note that all
+            +four hexadecimal digits MUST be specified and that wildcards
+            +cannot be used. Use this form when there is more than one instance
+            +of an address space with the same name.
+ $SWAP(NO)  +Make the specified address space non-swappable.
+ $SWAP(YES) +Make the specified address space swappable.
+ $CPU(MAX)  +Set the address space to have a maximum CPU limit. Use this
+            +to prevent an address space from abending with a 322 system code.
             +Address spaces whose jobstep program is marked as not being timed
             +in the PPT are NOT affected by this keyword.
+ $CPU(MIN)  +Set the address space to have a minimum CPU limit. Use this
+            +to force an address space to abend with a 322 system code.
             +Address spaces whose jobstep program is marked as not being timed
             +in the PPT are NOT affected by this keyword.
+
!Examples
+ $MAKE JOB0001 CPU(MAX) +Make job JOB0001 have a maximum CPU time limit.
+ $MAKE JOB0001 SWAP(NO) +Make job JOB0001 non-swappable
+ $MAKE A=002C SWAP(YES) +Make ASID 002C swappable
+
!Considerations
+ +Use this command with care.
+ +SEC recommends using the@A=asid+form to ensure that the correct
+ +task is affected.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR($)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMAP
)END

MXIHMAP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  " TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MAP Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays storage in DSECT form using the specified control block name.
+
+  If issued on the"MEM+command display, it captures the starting address of
+  the storage display and then dynamically constructs and issues the following
+  command :"MEM address MAP(mapname)+
+
+  If issued on a display other than MEM, it will dynamically construct and
+  issue the following command :"MEM @mapname MAP(mapname)+
+
+  This command is useful when you have followed a 'point-and-shoot' address and
+  wish to view the storage using a known DSECT control block name.
+
!Command Syntax
+ "MEM mapname
+
!Keywords
  "mapname    +Specifies that the storage should be displayed in the DSECT form
              +for control block 'mapname'.
+
!Examples
+ "MAP TCB    +Show the storage for the TCB as a TCB DSECT
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The output is exactly the same as the"MEM+command.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(")  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHPEEK
)END

MXIHMDQ.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MDQ Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the ASIDs that have been marked non-reusable by the system and to
+  which address spaces these ASIDs had latent cross memory links.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @MDQ+
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Jobname         +- Jobname of the non-reusable address space.
  @ASID            +- Hexadecimal ASID.
  @To              +- Number of cross memory connections TO another ASID at
                   +  address space termination. A special value of '*' is used
                   +  to denote connections to ALL address spaces.
  @From            +- Number of cross memory connections FROM another ASID at
                   +  address space termination. A special value of '*' is used
                   +  to denote connections to ALL address spaces.
  @XMSE            +- Address of the XMSE in the PCAUTH private area.
  @ASCB            +- ASCB of the terminated task. Note that certain fields in
                   +  this ASCB have been 'scrambled' by MVS to ensure system
                   +  integrity.
  @Type            +- Direction of the cross memory connection
  @CJOB            +- Jobname of connected address space.
  @CAID            +- Hexadecimal ASID of connected address space.
  @Status          +- The status of the connected address space :
                   +     ¢Active    + The address space is still active
                   +     ¢Inactive  + The address space has terminated
                   +     ¢System LX + This is a system LX connection
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMEM
)END

MXIHMEM.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  " TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MEM Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays storage at the specified address or control block.
+
!Command Syntax
+ "MEM addr    LEN(nnnn) MAP(cbname) JOB(jobname) ASID(asid)
+     "@cbname
+
!Keywords
  "addr+       +Specifies the hexadecimal address. This field is padded left
               +with zeros automatically.
               +When no other keywords are specified, the default value of
               +addr is 00000000. If you wish to specify the LEN() or MAP()
               +keywords you MUST include a value for addr.
  "@cbname     +Specifies that the storage for the 'cbname' control block is to
               +be displayed.
  "LEN(nnnn)   +Specifies the hexadecimal length of the storage displayed. The
               +default is LEN(1000) which displays 4096 bytes.
  "MAP(cbname) +Specifies the 'cbname' DSECT used to format the storage display.
  "JOB(jobname)+An optional keyword that specifies the address space name whose
               +storage is to be examined. Wildcards are not allowed.
  "ASID(asid)  +An optional keyword that specifies the hexadecimal ASID whose
               +storage is to be examined. All four bytes of the ASID keyword
               +MUST be completed. Wildcards are not allowed.

               +Note that the JOB() and ASID() keywords require MXI to be
               +running authorized. For further information on running MXI in
               +authorized mode, please see the@MISC+section of this HELP dialog
+
+
!Examples
+ "MEM 94CD0          + Show storage at 00094CD0 for a length of 4096 bytes
+ "MEM @CVT           + Show the storage for the CVT control block
+ "MEM 94CD0 MAP(TCB) + Show storage at 00094CD0 as a TCB DSECT
+ "MEM 94CD0 LEN(100) + Show storage at 00094CD0 for a length of 256 bytes
+ "MEM @CVT MAP(CVT)  + Show the storage for the CVT as a CVT DSECT
+ "MEM 94CD0 JOB(JES2)+ Show storage at 00094CD0 in the JES2 address space
+ "MEM @TCB ASID(002C)+ Show the TCB for address space id 002C.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  "Address           +- Address of storage displayed
  "Offset            +- Hex offset from starting address
  "0-1-2-3-          +- First 4 bytes of storage (Hex format)
  "4-5-6-7-          +- Second 4 bytes of storage (Hex format)
  "8-9-A-B-          +- Third 4 bytes of storage (Hex format)
  "C-D-E-F-          +- Fourth 4 bytes of storage (Hex format)
  "0---4---8---C---  +- 16 bytes of storage (EBCDIC format)

+When the hex format storage is blank, MXI has been unable to return the
+storage because either the storage is fetch protected or the address does not
+exist.
+
!Output Panel Fields When DSECT Mapping Used
  "Offset Dec        +- Decimal offset from starting address
  "Offset Hex        +- Hexadecimal offset from starting address
  "Field Name        +- The DSECT field name
  "Len               +- Length of field
  "Hex Value         +- Hexadecimal value of the field
  "EBCDIC Value      +- EBCDIC value of the field
+
+When the hex format storage is blank, MXI has been unable to return the
+storage because either the storage is fetch protected or the address does not
+exist.
+
!Valid MVS Control Blocks
"ACEE     +Accessor Environment Element
"ASCB     +Address Space Control Block
"ASSB     +Address Space Secondary Block
"ASVT     +Address Space Vector Table
"ASXB     +Address Space Extension Block
"CCT      +SRM CPU Control Table
"CDE  ¢(*)+Contents Directory Entry
"CSCB     +Command Sched Control Block
"CVT      +Communication Vector Table
"CVTPREF  +CVT Prefix
"ECVT     +Extended CVT
"GDA      +Global Data Area
"LDA      +Local Data Area
"JESCT    +Job Entry Subsys Control
"JFCB ¢(*)+Job File Control Block
"JSCB     +Job Step Control Block
"MCT      +SRM Storage Control Table
"OUCB     +SRM User Control Block
"PSA      +Prefixed Save Area
"PSCB     +Protected Step Control Block
"RB   ¢(*)+Request Block
"RCE      +RSM Control Area
"RCT      +SRM Resource Control Table
"RCVT     +RACF CVT
"SCVT     +Secondary CVT
"SMCA     +SMF Control Table
"SSCT     +Subsystem Control Table
"STGS     +RMF STGS
"SVT      +Supervisor Vector Table
"TCB      +Task Control Block
"TIOT     +Task Input Output Table
"TSVT     +TSO Vector Table
"UCB  ¢(*)+UCB Common Segment
+
!Valid MXI Control Blocks
"MXCT ¢(*)+MXI Common Storage Table
"MXLS ¢(*)+MXI LLA Statistics Table
"MXLE ¢(*)+MXI LLA Statistics Entry
"MXVT     +MXI Vector Table
+
      ¢(*)+Only valid in the MAP keyword
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(")  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMENU
)END

MXIHMENU.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MENU Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays a menu of MXI commands.
+
!Command Syntax
+ $MENU cmdmask ONLY(grp) NOT(grp)
+
!Keywords
+ $cmdmask   +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
+            +displayed list on all or part of the command name.
+            +A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
+            +can be used.
+            +The default value for cmdmask is '*'.
+ $ONLY(grp) +Restrict the display to only show commands that belong to a
+             specific group.
+            +A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
+            +can be used.
+            +The default value for grp is '*'.
             +The MXI supplied command groups are :
+            ¢DATASET  += Dataset related commands
+            ¢DB2      += DB2 related commands
+            ¢MQ       += MQSeries related commands
+            ¢MODULE   += Module related commands
+            ¢PLEX     += Commands related to sysplex issues
+            ¢RACF     += RACF related commands
+            ¢SYSTEM   += General system commands
+            ¢UNIT     += Commands related to logical or physical units
+
+ $NOT(grp)  +Restrict the display to not show commands that belong to a
+             specific group.
+            +A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
+            +can be used.
             +The MXI supplied command groups are :
+            ¢DATASET  += Dataset related commands
+            ¢DB2      += DB2 related commands
+            ¢MQ       += MQSeries related commands
+            ¢MODULE   += Module related commands
+            ¢PLEX     += Commands related to sysplex issues
+            ¢RACF     += RACF related commands
+            ¢SYSTEM   += General system commands
+            ¢UNIT     += Commands related to logical or physical units
+
!Examples
+ $MENU ONLY(DB2)        +Show only DB2 commands
+ $MENU M* NOT(MQ)       +Show all commands that start with 'M' but not any
                         +that are to do with MQSeries.
+
!Considerations
+ The MENU command is the first command executed under ISPF when MXI starts.
+ To override the default "*" keyword that is passed to the MENU command on
+ startup, issue the@SET+command and change the value on the subsequent panel.
+
!Output Panel Fields (Multiple Address Spaces)
  @Command              +- The MXI command.
  @Comment              +- The description of what the command achieves.
  @Group                +- The group to which the command belongs.

)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR($)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMPF
)END

MXIHMISC.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($|_)
¢MXI - HELP - Other Help Topics ------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!General Usage Tips
+ (1)+Most MXI commands can be entered on any MXI panel.
+ (2)+The previous screen output is saved and re-displayed on exit from the
+    +current screen.
+ (3)+Some fields are 'point-and-shoot'. Place the cursor anywhere within a
+     value that is defined as 'point-and-shoot' and press enter. MXI will then
+     take you to the most appropriate display.
+
!MXI Panel Title Line
+ The panel title line contains some important MXI and system information.
+
+ Example :
+
+¢MXI - DA --- SYS1 - IPO1 ----- CPU  23 UIC  254 PAG   30 -----Row 1 of 65
+       ¦      ¦      ¦          ¦       ¦        ¦
+       ¦      ¦      ¦          ¦       ¦        ¦
+    Command   ¦      ¦        System    ¦      System
+              ¦      ¦        CPU% Busy ¦      Total Paging
+            Local    ¦        (SRM)     ¦      Rate
+            System   ¦                  ¦
+                     ¦                System
+                   Remote             High UIC
+                   System
+                   (See RSYS Command)
+
+
!Running an initial command on ISPF invocation
+  To specify an initial command, you must invoke MXI using the SELECT PGM()
+  method and pass the name of the command you wish to execute via the PARM()
+  keyword. For example :
+
+      @SELECT PGM(MXI) PARM(IPL) NEWAPPL(MXI)
+
!Implementing the MXI Personal Dataset Application
+  You can use the MXI@DS+command to provide a fastpath ISPF application to
+  manipulate datasets. When MXI is invoked under ISPF with the initial command
+  of 'DS', MXI will bypass the primary menu display on exit. To take advantage
+  of the facility, code the following statements in your desired ISPF panel.
+
+  o  In the )BODY section :
+
+    ¢E   MXI/DS  MXI Personal Dataset List
+
+  o  In the )PROC section within the ZSEL logic :
+
+    ¢E,'PGM(MXI) PARM(DS) NEWAPPL(MXI) PASSLIB'
+
!Running MXI Authorized
+  To run MXI in authorized mode, ensure that :
+ @(a)+The load module¢MXITSF+is in an APF authorized library.
+ @(b)+The load module¢MXITSF+is available to the TSO user via STEPLIB,
+     +the system linklist or LPA list.
+ @(c)+The@AUTHTSF+section of@IKJTSOxx+has an entry for¢MXITSF
+
!Running MXI in Batch
+The JCL required to invoke MXI in batch is as follows :
+
+ @//BATCH    EXEC PGM=MXI,PARM='BATCH'
+ @//SYSPRINT DD   SYSOUT=*
+ @//SYSIN    DD   *
+  mxi-commands
+ @/*
+
+ The batch invocation accepts most MXI commands as input via the SYSIN DDname.
+ You can specify from 1 to 999 commands as individual card images within the
+ SYSIN input. The output is written to the SYSPRINT DDname, which, if not being
+ directed to spool has the following DCB attributes : RECFM=FBA, LRECL=133,
+ BLKSIZE=13300
+
+ The maximum individual command length is 71 bytes.
+
+ You can also specify an extra parameter of 'NOTITLES' to the MXI batch program
+ which will suppress the production of titles and page-breaks.
+
+
!Batch Example 1
+ @//BATCH    EXEC PGM=MXI,PARM='BATCH'
+ @//SYSPRINT DD   SYSOUT=*
+ @//SYSIN    DD   *
+  SET DSCB ON
+  LINK
+  LPA
+  SET DSCB OFF
+  APF
+ @/*
+
!Batch Example 2
+ @//BATCH    EXEC PGM=MXI,PARM='BATCH,NOTITLES'
+ @//SYSPRINT DD   SYSOUT=*
+ @//SYSIN    DD   *
+  NUC
+  LPD
+  SMSM
+ @/*
+
!Using the MXI REXX Interface
+MXI also has a REXX function interface. One or more MXI commands can
+be passsed to the REXX function and the result of the commands are
+placed sequentially in the specified REXX stem.
+
!Syntax
+   ¢rcode = MXIREXX(stemname,cmd1,cmd2,....,cmdn)
+
!Keywords
+   ¢RCODE   +Return code from the MXIREXX function
+
+   ¢STEMNAME+The name of the stem variable to hold the result of the
+             commands. This must be enclosed in quotes. The maximum
+             length of the stem name is 24 characters including the
+             fullstop at the end of the name.
+
+   ¢CMDn    +The MXI command(s) executed. These must be enclosed in
+             quotes and separated by commas.
+             The maximum support length of a single command is 72
+             bytes.
+
+             NOTE : If you wish to suppress the titles and columns you
+                    can specify a special value of 'NOTITLES' as the
+                    first command passed to MXIREXX.
+
+
+!REXX API Example
+
+  rcode = MXIREXX('line.','SET DSCB ON','LPA',LINK SYS1.*')
+  do i = 1 to line.0
+    say line.i
+    end
+  exit
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHTOC
)END

MXIHMPF.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MPF Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Message Processing Facility information.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @MPF msg-mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @msg-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the message id.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of msg-mask is '*'.
!Example
+ @MPF IEA*  +  List all MPF Entries starting with 'IEA'.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Message        +- Full or partial message identifier
  @Sup            +- Message suppression indicator (Suppress/No/ALL)
  @Retain         +- Message retention indicator (Retain/No)
  @Auto           +- Automation indicator (Auto/No)
  @Token          +- Automation token or blank
  @Member         +- Source MPFLSTxx member
  @Exit           +- Associated MPF user exit
  @EPA            +- Entry point address of the MPF user exit

)INIT

.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMQ
)END

MXIHMQ.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MQ Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the defined MQSeries subsystems and allow the user to select which
+  subsystem to connect to for subsequent MXI MQSeries commands.
+
+  The subsystem name chosen from the displayed list by point and shoot
+  action is stored in the ISPF profile as the default MQ subsystem.
+  This can be changed at ANY point during a MXI session by re-issuing
+  the MQ command.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @MQ submask
+
!Keywords      +
  @submask     +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the subsystem name.
               +The default value is '*'.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
+
!Examples
+ @MQ C*             +List all MQSeries subsystems that start 'C'.
+ @MQ CSQ1           +Set the MQ subsystem to CSQ1. All subsequent
                     +MXI MQSeries commands will be directed to the
                     +CSQ1 subsystem.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name            +- The subsystem name.
  @Status          +- The status of the MQ subsystem (Active/Inactive).
  @Prefix          +- The command prefix for the MQ subsystem.
+
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMQC
)END

MXIHMQDA.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - MQDA Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the MQSeries threads.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @MQDA mask MQ(sub)
+
!Keywords      +
  @mask        +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the thread owning task name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value is '*'.
  @MQ(sub)     +Direct the MQDA display to use the 'sub' MQSeries subsystem.

!Examples
+ @MQDA CSQ*        + Show threads that start 'CSQ'.
+ @MQDA MQ(CSQ2)    + Show threads on queue manager CSQ2.
+
!Considerations
 +If the MQQUEUE and MQCMDS RACF classes are active, you will need the following
 +levels of access in order to see any results for this command :
+
   @RACF MQQUEUE Profiles
    +¢UPDATE+access to¢qmgr.SYSTEM.COMMAND.INPUT+
    +¢READ  +access to¢qmgr.SYSTEM.COMMAND.REPLY.MODEL+
    +¢ALTER +access to¢qmgr.MXI.**+
+
   @RACF MQCMDS Profiles
    +¢READ  +access to¢qmgr.DISPLAY.**+
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name            +- Name of the thread owning task.
  @Sta             +- Status of the thread:
                     ¢N  +- IDENTIFY status
                     ¢T  +- Thread has issued CREATE THREAD
                     ¢QT +- CREATE THREAD has been queued - task is waiting.
                     ¢QD +- Thread is queued for termination as a result of the
                         +  termination of the associated task.
                     ¢D  +- Thread is process of termination as a result of the
                         +  termination of the associated task.
                     ¢*  +- Thread is currently active.
  @Req             +- Number of MQSeries requests issued (wrap-around).
  @Xref            +- Recovery thread cross-reference id.
  @Userid          +- Associated userid.
  @ASID            +- Associated hex address space id.
  @URID            +- Unit of recovery identifier. This is the log RBA of the
                   +  current unit of recovery associated with the thread.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHMQQ
)END
