#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the MQSeries page set usage.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @MQU MQ(sub)
+
!Keywords      +
  @MQ(sub)     +Direct the MQU display to use the 'sub' MQSeries subsystem.

!Examples
+ @MQU MQ(CSQ2)     + Show page set usage on queue manager CSQ2.
+
!Considerations
 +If the MQQUEUE and MQCMDS RACF classes are active, you will need the following
 +levels of access in order to see any results for this command :
+
   @RACF MQQUEUE Profiles
    +¢UPDATE+access to¢qmgr.SYSTEM.COMMAND.INPUT+
    +¢READ  +access to¢qmgr.SYSTEM.COMMAND.REPLY.MODEL+
    +¢ALTER +access to¢qmgr.MXI.**+
+
   @RACF MQCMDS Profiles
    +¢READ  +access to¢qmgr.DISPLAY.**+
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @PSID            +- Page Set ID
  @Pages           +- Number of pages.
  @Free            +- Number of unused pages.
  @P-Data          +- Number of pages used for persistent data.
  @NP-Data         +- Number of pages used for nonpersistent data.
  @Extents         +- Number of extents.
  @Extended        +- Number of times the page set was extended since last
                   +  queue manager restart.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'

+
)AREA MXIHAREA

+
!Example

+               CSECT that starts 'IGC'.

  @Length         +- Length of the module
  @CSECT          +- CSECT name within the module
  @Offset         +- Offset from start of module that this CSECT begins
  @RSECT          +- This entry is an RSECT

  @RM             +- Rmode of the module/CSECT (Any/31/24)
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'

MXIHOMVS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - OMVS Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current OpenEdition (or USS) configuration settings.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @OMVS+
+
!Considerations
+  This command requires OS/390 2.6 or above.
+
!Output Panel Fields
+ @Name             +- Address space name.
+ @ASID             +- Hex ASID.
+ @Parmlib Suffix   +- BPXPRMxx parmlib members.
+ @ASCB Address     +- Address of the OpenEdition address space ASCB.
+ @OCVT Address     +- Address of the OCVT control block.
+ @MAXPROCSYS       +- Maximum number of processes that OS/390 UNIX
                    +  will allow to be active concurrently.
+ @MAXPROCUSER      +- Maximum number of processes that a single user
                    +  is allowed to have concurrently active.
+ @MAXFILEPROC      +- Maximum number of file descriptors that a single
                    +  user is allowed to have concurrently active or allocated.
+ @MAXFILESIZE      +- Maximum size of a file that a process can create.
+ @MAXCPUTIME       +- Maximum CPU time (secs) that a process can use.
+ @MAXUIDS          +- Maximum number of unique UIDs that are active at
                    +  any one time.
+ @MAXRTYS          +- Maximum number of concurrent remote-terminal sessions
+ @MAXPTYS          +- Maximum number of concurrent pseudo-terminal sessions
+ @MAXMMAPAREA      +- Maximum amount of data space storage (in pages) that can
                    +  be allocated for memory mappings of HFS files.
+ @MAXASSIZE        +- Maximum address space region size.
+ @MAXTHREADS       +- Maximum number of concurrent threads per process.
+ @MAXTHREADTASKS   +- Maximum number of concurrent thread tasks per process.
+ @MAXCORESIZE      +- Maximum core dump file size that a process can create.
+ @MAXSHAREPAGES    +- Maximum number of system shared storage pages that can
                    +  concurrently be active using the fork(), ptrace,
                    +  shmat, and mmap services.
+ @IPCMSGQBYTES     +- Maximum number of bytes per message queue.
+ @IPCMSGQMNUM      +- Maximum number of messages per message queue.
+ @IPCMSGNIDS       +- Maximum number of unique message queues.
+ @IPCSEMNIDS       +- Maximum number of unique semaphore sets in the system.
+ @IPCSEMNOPS       +- Maximum number of operations for each semaphore operation
                    +  call.
+ @IPCSEMNSEMS      +- Maximum number of semaphores per semaphore set.
+ @IPCSHMMPAGES     +- Maximum number of pages for shared memory segments.
+ @IPCSHMNIDS       +- Maximum number of shared memory segments.
+ @IPCSHMNSEGS      +- Maximum number of shared memory segments per address
                       space.
+ @IPCSHMSPAGES     +- Maximum number of pages for shared memory segments in the
                    +  system.
+ @SuperUser        +- SuperUser userid
+ @FORKCOPY         +- How user storage is to be copied from the parent process
                    +  to the child process during a fork() system call.
+ @MAXQUEUEDSIGS    +- Maximum number of signals that OS/390 UNIX will
                    +  allow to be concurrently queued within a single process.
+ @SYSCALL Counts   +- Whether or not the syscall layer will accumulate the
                    +  count of the number of syscalls. This information is then
                    +  collected by RMF.
+ @TTYGROUP         +- The TTY group name
+ @STEPLIBLIST      +- The path name of the HFS file that contains the list of
                    +  MVS datasets that are to be used as STEPLIBs for programs
                    +  that have the setuid and setgid bit on.
+ @USERIDALIASTABLE +- The path name of the HFS file that contains the list of
+                   +  MVS userids and group names and their corresponding
+                   +  aliases.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHPAGE
)END

+ @/D A,L+  Issues the 'D A,L' command

!Considerations

+  panel will be presented that prompts for the operator command. Using
+  this panel, up to 100 characters can be entered.
+
)INIT

.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'

MXIHPAGE.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - PAGE Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current PAGE datasets.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @PAGE
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Type            +- Type of Page Dataset (PLPA/Common/Local)
  @State           +- The status of the Page Dataset :
                     ¢OK   +- No problems
                     ¢Full +- No free slots available
                     ¢Bad  +- Dataset is now read-only
                     ¢Drain+- Dataset is draining
                     ¢PgDel+- PAGEDEL is active
                     ¢IoErr+- One of more I/O errors recorded
  @Slots           +- Number of allocated slots
  @Used            +- Number of page slots currently in use
  @%Use            +- Percentage usage of the Page Dataset
  @Volser          +- The DASD Volume that the Page Dataset resides on
  @Dataset         +- The dataset name of the Page Dataset
+
!Considerations
  +The DSNS count includes one reserved slot that used to be used for the
  +duplex dataset. For example, if PAGTOTL=10 and you have 4 LOCAL page
  +datasets, the DSNS count would be calculated as follows :
  +
  +   1 x PLPA
  +   1 x COMMON
  +   4 x LOCAL
  +   1 x Reserved (duplex)
  +
  +   Total used = 7 out of 10 slots.
  +
  +   DSNS=7/10
  +
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHPARM
)END

  @Member           +- The source of the text. This can be either :
                      ¢IEASYSxx+ Text comes from IEASYSxx member of PARMLIB
                      ¢Default + Default value provided by MVS
                      ¢Operator+ Value was entered by an operator or by the
                               + LOADxx member.

¢MXI - HELP - PEEK Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #

#                                                                              #

#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Show all known ISPF screen images for a specified TSO userid.
+
!Command Syntax
+ $PEEK userid
+ $     A=asid
+
!Keywords
+ $userid    +A specific name of a single TSO userid.
+ $A=asid    +An alternative specification to userid that uses the hexadecimal
+            +address space id (ASID) rather than the jobname. Note that all
+            +four hexadecimal digits MUST be specified and that wildcards
+            +cannot be used. Use this form when there is more than one instance
+            +of an address space with the same name.
+
!Examples
+ $PEEK RSCOTT   +Show ISPF screens for userid RSCOTT
+ $PEEK A=002C   +Show ISPF screens for address space 002C
+
!Output
+ The output from this command is one line of summary information for each
+ logical screen along with a monochrome representation of the ISPF screen
+ image. Currently MXI cannot decypher the ISPF screen attributes for every
+ field on a specific screen image, so attribute characters will be visible.
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR($)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHPRT
)END

MXIHPLEX.text:

+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Sysplex Members.

   dialog.

  @Clone            +- Sysplex unique clone value

  @Date             +- Date of last status update
  @Time             +- Time of last status update

  @Operator         +- For missing status, interval at which to issue IXC402D
+
)INIT

)PROC

MXIHPPT.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - PPT Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Program Properties Table
+
!Command Syntax
+ @PPT mod-mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @mod-mask    +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the module name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mod-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @PPT HAS*  +  List all programs in the PPT that start 'HAS'.
+
!Considerations
+  The@PPT+command requires MXI to be running in authorized mode. For further
+  information on running MXI authorized, see the@MISC+section of this Help
+  dialog.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Module       +- Name of the load module
  @Cancel       +- Can the program be cancelled (Cancel/NoCancel)
  @Swap         +- Is the program swappable by SRM (Swap/NoSwap)
  @DSI          +- Does the program maintain dataset integrity (DSI/NoDSI)
  @Pass         +- Does the program use security checking before opening
                +  datasets (Pass/NoPass)
  @SysT         +- Is the program considered a system task (Syst/NoSyst)
  @Priv         +- Is the program considered privileged by SRM (Priv/NoPriv)
  @Key          +- Default storage key the program is given control in (0-15)
  @Pref         +- Preferred Storage options :
                +   ¢S+  : Short-term fixed pages must be in preferred storage
                +   ¢L+  : Long-term fixed pages must be in preferred storage
                +   ¢N+  : Program is allowed to use non-preferred storage
  @SAff         +- System Affinity mask (or None)
  @Def          +- How was this program defined
                +  ¢SCH+: SCHEDxx member of PARMLIB
                +  ¢IBM+: Provided by IBM and defined internally to MVS
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHRACF
)END

MXIHPRT.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - PRT Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Prints the displayed information to a dataset.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @PRT+
+
!Considerations
+  Note that ALL of the collected information is printed to the dataset, this
+  includes any data that is not shown on the physical screen.

+  The dataset name that contains the printed information has the following
+  naming standard :

  @'prefix.userid.MXI.command.Dyyddd.Thhmmss.LIST'

+  Where :   @prefix  - +The current prefix for your userid. If this value
                        +is null, then it will be omitted.
             @userid  - +Your userid. If your userid is the same as your prefix,
                        +then it will be omitted.
             @command - +The MXI command verb used to display the data.
             @yy      - +2-digit year value.
             @ddd     - +Julian day value.
             @hhmmss  - +Time in hours, minutes and seconds.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHRL
)END

MXIHRACF.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - RACF Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current RACF configuration information
+
!Command Syntax
+ @RACF+
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The display is split into four main sections
+
!Considerations
+  This command requires a minimum level of RACF 2.2
+
!Base Configuration
+ @Version          +- The version (v.rr.m) of RACF
+ @Primary Database +- The name of the primary database
+ @Volume Serial    +- The volser of the primary database
+ @RCVT Address     +- The address of the RCVT
+ @Protect All      +- Protect All setting (Fail/Warn/Off)
+ @List of Groups   +- List of Groups checking status
+ @DASDVOL          +- DASDVOL protection status
+ @TAPEVOL          +- TAPEVOL protection status
+ @ADSP             +- ADSP status
+ @TAPEDSN          +- TAPEDSN protection status
+ @Enhanced Generic +- Usage of enhanced generics
+ @AIM Stage        +- Application Identity Mapping Stage :
                       ¢0+- Not Active
                       ¢1+- Active, maintain alias index but also use and
                         +  maintain VLF and mapping profiles. Reject alias
                         +  locates.
                       ¢2+- Active, maintain alias index but also use and
                         +  maintain VLF and mapping profiles. Allow alias
                         +  locates.
                       ¢3+- Active, maintain and use alias index. Mapping
                         +  profiles have been removed.
+
!Password Settings
+ @Change Interval  +- Password change interval
+ @Warning Period   +- Number of days warning prior to password expiration
+ @History Depth    +- Number of passwords remembered by RACF
+ @Maximum Attempts +- Maximum number of unsuccessful password attempts before
+                   +  revoking the userid.
+
!JES Options
+ @JES-XBMALLRACF   +- JES tests for RACF identification on batch jobs that
                    +  run with an execution batch monitor (JES2 only)
+ @JES-EARLYVERIFY  +- JES invokes SAF for jobs that do not qualify for user
                    +  identification propagation
+ @JES-BATCHALLRACF +- JES tests for RACF identification on all batch jobs
+ @NJE Userid       +- Userid associated with NJE jobs and sysout that arrive
                    +  without an RTOKEN or UTOKEN
+ @Undefined Userid +- Userid associated with local jobs that enter the system
                    +  without a userid.
+
!Exit Information
+ @Exit             +- Exit Name
+ @Description      +- Description of the exit
+ @Address          +- Entry point address
+ @Location         +- Storage location
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHRCLS
)END

MXIHRS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - RS Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current real storage usage by address space. This command
+  also shows the auxiliary storage slot usage.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @RS mask+
+
!Keywords
+  The value of 'mask' can be used to limit the display based on all or part of
+  the job name
+  A wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'+can be used.
+  The default value for mask is '*'+
+
!Example
+ @RS CIC*   +  - List real storage usage for all jobs starting 'CIC'
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Jobname         +- The address space name
  @ASID            +- The hexadecimal ASID
  @Real            +- The number of real storage frames used
  @Expand          +- The number of expanded storage frames used
  @Workset         +- The working set size in kilobytes
  @Fixed           +- The number of fixed frames used
  @NonVIO          +- The number of auxiliary storage slots (non-VIO) used
  @Data            +- The number of user key dataspace blocks (4K)
  @Hiper           +- The number of hiperspace pages in expanded storage
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSCLS
)END

MXIHRSYS.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - RSYS Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the known remote systems that are defined to the MXI server and
+  allows the user to direct subsequent MXI commands to them.
+
+  This list also includes the special value 'HOME' which points to the local
+  system.
+
+  The system name can be chosen from the displayed list by point and shoot
+  action and is then stored as the default MXI system. The current remote
+  system name is shown on the MXI panel title line on the right hind side of
+  the local system name.
+
+  This can be changed at ANY point during a MXI session by re-issuing
+  the RSYS command. The RSYS HOME command should always return the current
+  MXI session to the local system.
+
+  When the remote system name is different from the local system, the CPU
+  UIC and PAG values shown on the panel title are for the remote system.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @RSYS sysmask
+
!Keywords      +
  @sysmask     +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the system name.
               +The default value is '*'.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
+
!Examples
+ @RSYS S*                     +List all remote systems that start 'S'.
+ @RSYS IPO1                   +Set the remote system to IPO1. All subsequent
                               +MXI commands will be directed to the IPO1
                               +system.
+ @RSYS HOME                   +Reset to the local system.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Site            +- The system name.
  @Address         +- The TCP/IP address of the system.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSET0
)END

MXIHSET0.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SET Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Controls MXI options and settings.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SET DSCB  ON/OFF
+     @ENQ   ON/OFF
+     @JOB   mask
+     @MAJ   mask
+     @MQ    name
+     @SYS   mask
+     @XPT   xx
+     @SCREEN
+     @DS
+     @CONSOLE con
+
!Keywords
  @DSCB ON/OFF+Controls the collection of Format-1 and Format-3 DSCB information
              +for datasets displayed by the LPA, LINK and APF commands.
              +The default setting is@DSCB OFF
  @ENQ ON/OFF +Controls the display of enqueue information on the DA command for
              +a single address space.
  @JOB mask   +The 'mask' value filters the ENQ command output to all or part of
              +the job name. The wildcard '*' and placeholder '%' can be used in
              +any position within the 'mask'.
              +The default setting is@JOB *
  @MAJ mask   +The 'mask' value filters the ENQ command output to all or part of
              +the resource major name. The wildcard '*' and placeholder '%' can
              +be used in any position within the 'mask'.
              +The default setting is@MAJ SYSDSN
  @MQ name    +The 'name' value specifies the MQ Series subsystem to which
              +future MXI MQ commands are to report on.
  @SYS mask   +The 'mask' value filters the ENQ command output to all or part of
              +the system name. The wildcard '*' and placeholder '%' can be used
              +in any position within the 'mask'.
              +The default setting is@SYS *
  @SCREEN     +Controls the screen attributes of all output fields displayed by
              +MXI commands. Entering the@SET SCREEN+command will cause an ISPF
              +panel to be presented that contains all possible attribute values
              +for each field. The settings entered will be saved in your MXI
              +profile.
  @XPT xx     +Sets the exception table suffix (MXIXPTxx) to be used. This load
              +module contains the list of user-defined exceptions for the EXC
              +command.
  @CONSOLE con+Sets the E-MCS console name used by MXI. This value is saved in
              +the ISPF profile. Be careful to ensure that MXI has a different
              +value than other system software (eg SDSF).
  @DS         +Controls the specification of up to 32 personal dataset names
              +or DSLIST patterns that are used by the@DS+command. Entering the
              @SET DS+command will cause an ISPF panel to be presented that you
              +can enter the dataset names or DSLIST patterns. These entries
              +will be saved in your MXI profile.
+
!Examples
  @SET           +  Display the settings panel.
  @SET CONSOLE JIM+ Set the E-MCS console name to 'JIM'.
  @SET DSCB ON   +  Set DSCB collection ON.
  @SET JOB CIC*  +  Set the jobname filter so that the ENQ command only reports
                 +  information from address spaces that start 'CIC'.
  @SET MAJ SYS*  +  Set the major name filter so that the ENQ command reports
                 +  all system enqueues.
  @SET XPT 99    +  Set the exception table suffix to '99'. This causes MXI to
                 +  use load module MXIXPT99 as its table of exceptions for the
                 +  EXC command.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSORT
)END

MXIHSET1.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SET SCREEN Command -----------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Controls MXI screen attributes for specific panel elements.
+
!Force tab to point and shoot fields
+  When selected, this causes MXI to set on the ISPF 'Tab to point and shoot'
+  setting. When MXI is terminated, it will reset this ISPF setting to its
+  previous value. This setting only applies to users who have NOT set the
+  'Tab to point and shoot fields' in their ISPF settings.
+  Note that changes to this setting take effect on the next invocation
+  of MXI.
+
!Use EDIT for point and shoot dataset name
+  When selected, this causes MXI to use ISPF EDIT when a point and shoot action
+  is taken for a dataset name. If this option is not selected, MXI will use
+  ISPF VIEW instead.
+
!Colour
+  This specifies the colour of the field. This can be one of the
+  following values :
+  ¢RED
+  ¢YELLOW
+  ¢WHITE
+  ¢GREEN
+  ¢TURQ
+  ¢BLUE
+  ¢PINK
+
!Highlight
+  This specifies the highlighting attribute for the field. This can be
+  one of the following values :
+  ¢NORMAL      + No special attributes.
+  ¢USCORE      + The field is underlined.
+  ¢BLINK       + The field will blink.
+  ¢REVERSE     + The field will be displayed in reverse video.
+
!Intensity
+  This specifies the intensity of the field. This can be one of the
+  following values :
+  ¢LOW         + Low intensity.
+  ¢HIGH        + High intensity.
+
)INIT
)PROC
)END

MXIHSET2.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SET DS Command ---------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Specification of your personal dataset list.
+
+  You can specify up to 32 dataset names or DSLIST patterns that will be saved
+  in your MXI profile. You can also specify a volume serial for uncataloged
+  datasets.
+
+  Do NOT specify quotes or brackets in the dataset name
+
+  The@DS+command will treat any dataset name entry as follows :
+
+  o  If the dataset name contains the '*' wildcard or '%' placeholder the
+     dataset name and volser will be passed to ISPF DSLIST (option 3.4) when
+     the user performs point-and-shoot.
+  o  Otherwise the dataset name and volser are passed to ISPF EDIT (or VIEW).
+  o  If the dataset name contains brackets, it will be marked unusable.
+  o  If the dataset does not exist then it will be marked unusable.
+  o  The@DS+command will sort the dataset list prior to display.
+
)INIT
)PROC
)END

!Function

!Command Syntax

+
!Output Panel Fields

+
!Base Configuration
+ @Description      +- Description of the configuration
+ @Last Change Date +- The date (yyyy/mm/dd) of the last change
+ @Last Change User +- The userid that performed the last change
+ @Last Change Time +- The time (hh.mm.ss) of the last change
+ @SCDS Name        +- The dataset name of the SCDS
+ @ACDS Name        +- The dataset name of the ACDS
+ @COMMDS Name      +- The dataset name of the COMMDS
+ @Parmlib Suffix   +- IGDSMSxx member name suffix
+ @System           +- System ID
+ @ASCB Address     +- The SMS ASCB address
+ @ASID (Hex)       +- The SMS ASID number (hex)
+
!Defaults
+ @Management Class +- The default management class
+ @Unit Name        +- The default unit name
+ @Track Size       +- Track capacity in bytes
+ @Tracks/Cyl       +- Number of tracks per cylinder
+
!Exit Information
+ @Exit Name        +- Exit Description
+ @Module           +- Load module name
+ @Status           +- Status of exit (Active/Inactive)
+ @Address          +- Entry point address
+ @Location         +- Storage location
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'

)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function

MXIHSORT.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SORT Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Sort the current displayed data by column name.
+  Note that this command is only available on tabular displays.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SORT colname A/D
+
!Keywords      +
  @colname     +The name of the column as displayed on the screen.
  @A/D         +The direction of the sort :
               ¢A+Ascending
               ¢D+Descending
+
!Considerations+
+  Each column on a tabular display is defined to MXI so that both the default
+  sort direction and type of data (CHAR or HEX) is known. This means that MXI
+  will (for example) sort hexadecimal unit addresses correctly without the user
+  having to tell MXI the data type.
+
+  Note that placing the cursor on the column heading in a tabular display and
+  then pressing enter will internally invoke the SORT command.
+
!Usage
+ @SORT JOBNAME   +- Will sort the output by the column name 'JOBNAME' using its
+                    default direction.
+ @SORT UNIT A    +- Will sort the output by the column name 'UNIT' in
+                    ascending order.
+ @SORT LENGTH  D +- Will sort the output by the column name 'LENGTH' in
+                    descending order.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSRCH
)END

MXIHSP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SP Command -------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current common storage and LSQA subpool use.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SP mask+
+
!Keywords
+  The value of 'mask' can be used to limit the display based on all or part of
+  the subpool number and storage key. A dash '-' must be used to separate the
+  subpool number from the storage key.
+  A wildcard character of '*'+and a placeholder character of '%'+can be used.
+  The default value for mask is '*'+
+
!Example
+ @SP 22%-0  +  - List key 0 storage for subpools 226, 227 and 228.
+ @SP 231-6  +  - List key 6 storage for subpool 231.
+ @SP *-8    +  - List key 8 storage for all subpools.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @SP              +- Decimal Subpool Number
  @Key             +- Storage Key of the subpool
                     ¢0    +- System
                     ¢1    +- JES, TSO and APPC
                     ¢2    +- VSPC
                     ¢3    +- Availability Manager (AVM)
                     ¢4    +- Reserved
                     ¢5    +- Data Management (including Open/Close/EOV)
                     ¢6    +- TCAM and VTAM
                     ¢7    +- IMS and DB2
                     ¢8-9  +- V=V Problem Programs
                     ¢10-15+- V=R Problem Programs
  @Loc             +- Location of subpool (CSA/SQA/LSQA)
  @BBlks           +- Number of allocated blocks of storage (below 16Meg)
  @BAlloc          +- Total amount of storage allocated (below 16Meg)
  @BFree           +- Total amount of storage allocated but free (below 16Meg)
  @BTot            +- Percentage of the total storage (below 16Meg)
  @ABlks           +- Number of allocated blocks of storage (above 16Meg)
  @AAlloc          +- Total amount of storage allocated (above 16Meg)
  @AFree           +- Total amount of storage allocated but free (above 16Meg)
  @ATot            +- Percentage of the total storage (above 16Meg)
+
+The following fields are populated for each storage block within the subpool
+that match the storage key. For the owning jobname information to be
+present, SQA and CSA storage tracking must be enabled in DIAGxx.
+
  @Block           +- Storage Block Address
  @Blklen          +- Length of the entire storage block
  @Owner           +- Owning jobname (if available)
  @Location        +- Location of storage block
  @GQE             +- Address of the GQE (if available)
+
+The following fields describe the storage contents within the main storage
+block. Note that there may be more than one occurrence of the following within
+a single storage block.
+
  @Start           +- Starting address of the storage
  @End             +- End address of the storage
  @Length          +- Length of the storage
  @Status          +- Status of the storage :
                     ¢Allocated+The storage is being used
                     ¢Free     +The storage has been released
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSPD
)END

MXIHSPD.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SPD Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the storage subpool definitions and attributes.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SPD+
+
!Output Panel Fields
+ @SP             +-+The number of the subpool
+ @Location       +-+The storage location
+ @FProt          +-+Is fetch protection available (FProt/No)
+ @Type           +-+Type of storage (Pageable/Fixed/DREF)
+ @Owner          +-+The owner of the storage
+ @Key            +-+Storage protect key
+ @CStor          +-+Where the subpool in backed in central storage :
+                   ¢Below+ : Below the 16Meg line
+                   ¢Both + : Above and below the 16Meg line
+                   ¢LOC  + : Depends on the LOC keyword in GETMAIN/STORAGE
+ @VStor          +-+Where the virtual storage resides :
+                   ¢Above+ : Above the 16Meg line
+                   ¢Below+ : Below the 16Meg line
+                   ¢Both + : Above and below the 16Meg line
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSRVC
)END

MXIHSRCH.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SRCH Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Searches for member names that match a specified mask the dataset lists
+  produced by the LPA, LINK, APF, DDNS and PARM commands.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SRCH+mem-mask
+
!Keywords      +
  @mem-mask    +The member name pattern mask to search for in the displayed list
               +of datasets.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used.
+
!Examples
+ @SRCH IEB*   +Will search for all members that start 'IEB'.
+ @SRCH PROGA  +Will search for member 'PROGA'.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Dataset Name    +- The dataset name the member is from
  @Member Pattern  +- The member pattern used to search the dataset
  @Volume Serial   +- The volume serial of the dataset
  @Status          +- The result of the search :
                   +-¢Found           +- Member(s) were found in the dataset.
  +                  ¢Dataset Not PDS +- Dataset was not searched, it is not
  +                                      partitioned.
  +                  ¢Open Abend cccc +- MXI encountered a 'cccc' abend when
  +                                      trying to open the dataset.
+
!Considerations
+ +Using the 'point-and-shoot' function on the dataset name in the search
+ +results list will invoke ISPF BROWSE on the dataset using the member search
+ +pattern.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHVER
)END

MXIHSRVC.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SRVC Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the active WLM service classes
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SRVC class-mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @class-mask  +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the service class name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of class-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @SRVC BATCH*+ List all service classes that start 'BATCH'
+
+When more than one service class matches the specified pattern mask, a summary
+list is displayed.

!Output Panel Fields
  @Name            +- Service Class name
  @Workload        +- Associated workload name
  @ResGroup        +- Associated resource group
  @Periods         +- The number of periods within the service class
  @Descript        +- The description of the service class
+
+When only one service class matches the specified pattern mask, a more detailed
+list is displayed.

!Service Class Attributes
  @Name            +- Service Class name
  @Workload        +- Associated workload name
  @ResGroup        +- Associated resource group
  @Periods         +- The number of periods within the service class
  @Description     +- The description of the service class

+For each period in the service class, the following information is shown.

  @Period          +- Period number
  @Duration        +- The duration of the period in service units
  @Imp             +- Relative importance (1 to 5)
  @Goal            +- The service goal for the period
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHSSI
)END

)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - SYSX Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current system exit information, including JES2, TSO and RACF.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @SYSX +
+
!Considerations
+  There is a requirement that the module HASMHCCT is available to MXI via the
+  the LOAD instruction if JES2 exits are to be listed. This module is used to
+  determine certain JES2 control block offsets that are used to gather the
+  exit information. These modules are found in the SHASMIG dataset which is
+  usually in the linklist.
+
+  If MXI is running authorised and the SHASMIG dataset is NOT APF authorised,
+  then the BATCH invocation of this command requires the following JCL card to
+  be added the the jobstep:
+
+  //SHASMIG  DD  DISP=SHR,DSN=SYS1.SHASMIG
+
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Module          +- Name of the module associated with the exit
  @Descript        +- A description of the exit function (if known)
  @Status          +- Status of the exit
  @EPA             +- Entry point address of the module
  @Location        +- Storage location of the module
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHTAPE
)END

MXIHTCB.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - TCB Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current TCB tree and RB chains.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @TCB JOB(jobname)
+     @ASID(asid)
+
!Keywords
  @JOB(jobname)+An optional keyword that specifies the address space name whose
               +TCB structure is to be examined. Wildcards are not allowed.
  @ASID(asid)  +An optional keyword that specifies the hexadecimal ASID whose
               +TCB structure is to be examined. All four bytes of the
               +ASID keyword MUST be completed. Wildcards are not allowed.

               +Note that the JOB() and ASID() keywords require MXI to be
               +running authorized. For further information on running MXI in
               +authorized mode, please see the@MISC+section of this HELP dialog
+
!Examples
  @TCB              +  Show the TCBs for the current (local) address space
  @TCB JOB(JES2)    +  Show the JES2 TCBs
  @TCB ASID(002C)   +  Show the TCBs for address space whose asid is '2C'
+
!Considerations
  +When using the JOB() or ASID() keywords it is possible that no data will
  +be returned even though the address space is active. This is most likely
  +because :
  +(1) The SRB scheduled into the target address space did not complete within
       five seconds. This can happen when the system load is very high.
  +(2) The SRB abended while processing the RB chain. When this happens the FRR
       that covers the SRB will recover and release the allocated storage but
       will NOT retry.
+
!Output panel fields
+ @TCB              +- The address of the TCB
+ @Descript         +- If known, a description of the TCB
+ @RB               +- The address of the RB
+ @Type             +- The type of RB
+ @Pgm              +- The program name from the RB
+ @Storage          +- The total smount of storage allocated to the TCB
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHUCB
)END

MXIHUCB.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - UCB Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current real UCB addresses
+
!Command Syntax
+ @UCB unit-mask ONLY(type) NOT(type)
+
!Keywords      +
  @unit-mask   +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the unit address.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of unit-mask is '*'.
  @ONLY(type)  +Restrict the display to only show the UCBs for devices of a
               +particular class :
               ¢COMMS   += Communications Devices
               ¢CTC     += CTC Devices
               ¢DASD    += Disk Devices
               ¢DISPLAY += Display Devices
               ¢TAPE    += Tape Devices
               ¢UNITREC += Unit Record Devices (Printers, Readers..etc)
  @NOT(type)   +Restrict the display by omitting UCBs for devices of a
               +particular class :
               ¢COMMS   += Communications Devices
               ¢CTC     += CTC Devices
               ¢DASD    += Disk Devices
               ¢DISPLAY += Display Devices
               ¢TAPE    += Tape Devices
               ¢UNITREC += Unit Record Devices (Printers, Readers..etc)
+
!Example
+ @UCB 34*       + List all UCB information for devices 0340-034F
+ @UCB ONLY(DASD)+ List all UCB information for DASD devices
+
!Output panel fields
+ @Unit             +- The unit address of the device
+ @Volser           +- If known, the volser of the device
+ @Jobname          +- The jobname (if any) of the ASID using the device
+ @Devclass         +- The type of device (DASD,TAPE,CTC,..etc)
+ @Status           +- The status of the device (Online/Offline/Pending)
+ @UCB              +- The address of the UCB common segment
+ @Common           +- The address of the UCB common extension
+ @Prefix           +- The address of the UCB prefix
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHUIC
)END

MXIHUIC.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)

)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - UIC Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the UIC information by address space.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @UIC mask+
+
!Keywords
+  The value of 'mask' can be used to limit the display based on all or part of
+  the job name
+  A wildcard character of '*'+and a placeholder character of '%'+can be used.
+  The default value for mask is '*'+
+
!Example
+ @UIC CIC*  +  - List UIC information for all jobs starting 'CIC'
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Jobname         +- The address space name
  @ASID            +- The hexadecimal ASID
  @Real            +- The number of real storage frames used
  @Expand          +- The number of expanded storage frames used
  @Fixed           +- The number of fixed frames used
  @->yyyy          +- The number of frames in the UIC range
                   +  Note that the four ranges shown are defined and changed by
                   +  the SRM.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHUSP
)END

MXIHUSP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - USP Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current user subpool storage allocated by each TCB.
+  Where possible, the program name is extracted from the RB chain and
+  displayed.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @USP pgmmask JOB(jobname)
+ @            ASID(asid)
+
!Keywords
  @pgmmask     +An optional keyword that filters the display on all or part of
               +the program name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of is '*'.
  @JOB(jobname)+An optional keyword that specifies the address space name whose
               +USP structure is to be examined. Wildcards are not allowed.
  @ASID(asid)  +An optional keyword that specifies the hexadecimal ASID whose
               +USP structure is to be examined. All four bytes of the
               +ASID keyword MUST be completed. Wildcards are not allowed.

               +Note that the JOB() and ASID() keywords require MXI to be
               +running authorized. For further information on running MXI in
               +authorized mode, please see the@MISC+section of this HELP dialog
+
!Output panel fields
+ @Address          +- The starting address of the storage
+ @Alloc            +- The amount of storage allocated (bytes)
+ @Free             +- The amount of storage free (bytes)
+ @USP              +- The address of the USP using the storage
+ @SP               +- The subpool number
+ @Key              +- The storage key
+ @Type             +- The type of storage (OWN/SHR)
+ @Pgm              +- The program name from the RB
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHVMAP
)END
