MXIHVMAP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - VMAP Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current Virtual Storage Map
+
!Command Syntax
+ @VMAP
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Area            +- The area of storage described
  @Start           +- The low address of the storage area
  @End             +- The high address of the storage area
  @Size(K)         +- The length of the storage area in 'K'
                   +  Note that is normally the difference between the
                   +  upper and lower address boundaries. However when
                   +  SQA overflows into CSA the corresponding CSA size
                   +  is reduced by the overflow amount.
  @%Use            +- Percentage currently used (CSA and SQA only)
                   +  Note that when SQA overflows into CSA the size
                   +  of CSA used to calculate the percentage used is
                   +  reduced by the overflow amount.
  @Overflow        +- Amount of SQA that has overflowed into CSA
  @Size(Mb)        +- The length of the storage area in 'Mb'
+
+  The following three fields describe the storage allocation and use of the
+  home address space.
+
  @Region Requested+- Region size requested
  @Region Above 16M+- Extended private area allocated and used
  @Region Below 16M+- Private area allocated and used
+
+  The following three fields describe the current setting (via DIAGxx) of
+  various storage tracking options. They can be either 'Active' or 'Inactive'.
+
  @CSA Tracking+    - CSA and ECSA Storage Tracking
  @SQA Tracking+    - SQA and ESQA Storage Tracking
  @GFS Trace+       - GETMAIN and FREEMAIN Storage Trace
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHWLM
)END

MXIHWLM.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - WLM Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the current WLM policy information.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @WLM+
+
!Considerations
  +The@WLM+command requires MXI to be running in authorized mode. For further
  +information on running MXI authorized, see the@MISC+section of this Help
  +dialog.
+
!Output Panel Fields
+  The display is split into two main sections
+
!Active Policy
+ @Name                   +- Service policy name.
+ @Userid                 +- Userid that activated the policy.
+ @Date                   +- Date (yyyy/mm/dd) that policy was activated.
+ @Time                   +- Time (hh.mm.ss) that policy was activated.
+ @System                 +- System name from which policy activation was
+                         +  initiated.
+ @Description            +- The description of policy.
+
!Service Definition
+ @Name                   +- Service definition name.
+ @Userid                 +- Userid that installed the definition.
+ @Date                   +- Date (yyyy/mm/dd) that definition was installed.
+ @Time                   +- Time (hh.mm.ss) that definition was installed.
+ @System                 +- System name from which the  definition was
+                         +  installed.
+ @Description            +- The description of service definition.
+ @CPU                    +- CPU service coefficient value.
+ @IOC                    +- I/O coefficient value.
+ @MSO                    +- Storage service coefficient value.
+ @SRB                    +- SRB service coefficient value.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHWLMA
)END

MXIHWLMA.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - WLMA Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the active WLM Application Environments
+
!Command Syntax
+ @WLMA mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @mask        +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @WLMA DB2*  + List the application environments that start 'DB2'.
+
+When more than one service class matches the specified pattern mask, a summary
+list is displayed.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name            +- Application Environment name.
  @Sub             +- Subsystem name.
  @Proc            +- Procedure name.
  @Descript        +- Description of the application environment.
+
+When only one service class matches the specified pattern mask, a more detailed
+list is displayed.
+
!Application Environment
  @Name            +- Application Environment name.
  @Description     +- Description of the application environment.
  @Procedure Name  +- Procedure name.
  @Subsystem       +- Subsystem name.
  @Server Limit    +- The limit on the number of server address spaces :
                   + ¢No Limit +No Maximum
                   + ¢System   +One server address space per system.
                   + ¢Sysplex  +One server address space per sysplex.
  @Start Parameters+- Start parameters (if any) passed to the server address
                   +  space.

)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHWLMC
)END

MXIHWLMC.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - WLMC Command -----------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the active WLM classification rules.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @WLMC mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @mask        +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the subsystem name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @WLMC JES   + List the classification rules for batch jobs.
+

!Output Panel Fields
  @Subs            +- Subsystem name.
  @Type            +- Type of classification. This field can also have a special
                   +  value of '----' to indicate the default values entry.
  @Descript        +- Type description.
  @Nest            +- Nesting level of the rule.
  @Value           +- The comparison value. When the last character of the Type
                   +  is a 'G' this indicates that the value indicates a WLM
                   +  classification group.
  @Start           +- The start (if any) of a substring comparison.
  @Service         +- The assigned service class.
  @Report          +- The assigned reporting class.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHWLMG
)END

MXIHWLMG.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)

+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the active WLM classification groups.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @WLMG mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @mask        +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the group name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @WLMG CIC*  + List the classification groups that start 'CIC'
+

!Output Panel Fields
  @Group           +- Group name.
  @Type            +- Type of classification.
  @Descript        +- Type description.
  @Member          +- Member name.
+

¯                                                                              ¯
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Displays the known WLM Scheduling Environments
+
!Command Syntax
+ @WLMS mask+
+
!Keywords      +
  @mask        +An optional masking pattern that can be used to filter the
               +displayed list on all or part of the name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @WLMS DB2*  + List the scheduling environments that start 'DB2'.
+
+When more than one service class matches the specified pattern mask, a summary
+list is displayed.
+
!Output Panel Fields
  @Name            +- Scheduling Environment name.
  @Descript        +- Description of the environment.
  @#Res            +- Number of associated resources.
  @System          +- System name where scheduling environment defined.
  @State           +- Status of scheduling environment on the system.
+
+When only one service class matches the specified pattern mask, a more detailed
+list is displayed.
+
!Scheduling Environment
  @Name            +- Scheduling Environment name.
  @Description     +- Description of the environment.
  @Resources       +- Number of associated resources.
  @Resource        +- Name of the associated resource.
  @System          +- System name where scheduling environment defined.
  @State           +- Status of scheduling environment on the system.
+
!Resources
  @Resource        +- Name of the associated resource.
  @Description     +- Description of the resource.
  @ReqState        +- Required state of the resource.
  @System          +- System name where resource is defined.
  @State           +- Status of resource on the system.
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHWTOR
)END

)AREA MXIHAREA

!Keywords      +

               +displayed list on all or part of the originating system name.
               +The wildcard character of '*' and a placeholder character of '%'
               +can be used. The default value of sys-mask is '*'.
+
!Example
+ @WTOR IP*  +  List all WTORs from systems starting 'IP'.

!Considerations
  +The@WTOR+command requires MXI to be running in authorized mode. For further
  +information on running MXI authorized, see the@MISC+section of this Help

!Output Panel Fields
  @System Name     +- Name of the originating system.
  @Date            +- Date that the WTOR was issued (yyyy/mm/dd).
  @Time            +- Time that the WTOR was issued (hh.mm.ss).
  @JES Jobid       +- JES job identifier of issuing address space.

MXIHZAP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHLP2 ISR)
)ATTR
  ¢ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
  ! TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(WHITE)
  + TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(GREEN)
  @ TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ)
  # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(¯¯) DEFAULT($¦_)
¢MXI - HELP - ZAP Command ------------------------------------------------------
!Option ===>_ZCMD
#MXIHAREA                                                                      #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
#                                                                              #
+
)AREA MXIHAREA
!Function
+  Alters up to eight bytes of common storage. This command can only be
+  executed in BATCH.
+
!Command Syntax
+ @ZAP address VER(hex) REP(hex)
+
!Keywords      +
  @address     +The address of the data that you wish to change. This address
               +must reside within one of the following storage locations :
               +
               ¢  CSA
               ¢  SQA
               ¢  R/W Nucleus
               ¢  Extended CSA
               ¢  Extended SQA
               ¢  Extended R/W Nucleus
+
  @VER(hex)    +The existing hexadecimal contents at the specified address.
+
  @REP(hex)    +The hexadecimal contents that are to be be used to replace the
               +contents specified in VER().
+
!Considerations
+  1. Use this command with utmost care. Incorrect or mistaken use will most
+     likely cause a complete system outage.
+  2. The VER() keyword is always required.
+  3. The length of hexadecimal characters on the VER() and REP() keywords must
+     be equal.
+  4. By default MXI will issue a WTOR asking for confirmation of the storage
+     alteration. The operator must reply with a 'Y' before the storage
+     contents are changed.
+  5. By default MXI is shipped with the all users denied access to the ZAP
+     command and specific install actions are required to activate it.
+
!Example
+
+ @//ZAP    EXEC PGM=MXI,PARM=BATCH
+ @//STEPLIB  DD DISP=SHR,DSN=your.apf.loadlib
+ @//SYSPRINT DD SYSOUT=*
+ @//SYSIN    DD *
+   @ZAP FDEF0 VER(00000000) REP(00000001)
+ @/*
+
)INIT
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(!)  = 'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
.ATTRCHAR(+)  = 'COLOR(&M06C) HILITE(&M06H) INTENS(&M06I)'
.ATTRCHAR(@)  = 'COLOR(&M09C) HILITE(&M09H) INTENS(&M09I)'
)PROC
 &ZUP   = MXIHTOC
 &ZCONT = MXIHAUTO
)END

MXIMENU.text:
MACRO
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Name       : MXIMENU
.*
.* Function   : Constructs the MXI menu choices
.*
.*
.* Syntax     : MXIMENU START
.*
.*            : MXIMENU END
.*
.*            : MXIMENU SET,
.*                    COMMAND=command,
.*                    GROUP=command-group,
.*                    AUTH=command-auth-check,
.*                    OSLEVEL=opsys-level,
.*                    COMMENT=description
.*
.* Keywords   : START
.*                 Denotes the beginning of the table.
.*                 This must be the first entry.
.*
.*            : END
.*                 Denotes the end of the table.
.*
.*            : SET
.*                 Creates a menu choice in the current table.
.*
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
&LABEL    MXIMENU &INVOKE,                                             X
               &SUFFIX=00,                                             X
               &COMMAND=,                                              X
               &KEYWORDS='',                                           X
               &GROUP=SYSTEM,                                          X
               &AUTH=NO,                                               X
               &COMMENT=
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Ensure that we have all required parms
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'START').MENUSTRT
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'END').MENUEND
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'SET').MENUSET
           AGO .MSG0001
.MENUSTRT  ANOP
MXIMEN&SUFFIX CSECT
           DC   CL8'MXIMEN&SUFFIX'
           DC   CL8'&SYSDATE'
           DC   CL8'&SYSTIME'
           DC   AL4(NUMMEN&SUFFIX)
           DC   F'0'
BEGMEN&SUFFIX DS   0D
           AGO  .END
.MENUSET   ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Process the defined choices
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF  ('&COMMAND' EQ '').MSG0002
           AIF  ('&GROUP' EQ '').MSG0003
           AIF  ('&AUTH' EQ '').MSG0004
&CMDL      SETA K'&COMMAND
           AIF  (&CMDL GT 4).MSG0005
&KEYL      SETA K'&KEYWORDS-2
           AIF  (&KEYL GT 15).MSG0006
&GRPL      SETA K'&GROUP
           AIF  (&GRPL GT 8).MSG0007
&COML      SETA K'&COMMENT-2
           AIF  (&COML GT 32).MSG0008
           DC   AL1(&CMDL)
           DC   CL4'&COMMAND'      Command
           DC   AL1(&KEYL)
           DC   CL15&KEYWORDS      Command
           DC   AL1(&GRPL)
           DC   CL8'&GROUP'        Command Group
           DC   AL1(&COML)
           DC   CL32&COMMENT       Description
           DC   CL1'&AUTH(1,1)'
           DC   CL16' '            Reserved
           AGO .END
.MENUEND   ANOP
ENDMEN&SUFFIX DS 0H
NUMMEN&SUFFIX EQU (ENDMEN&SUFFIX-BEGMEN&SUFFIX)/80
           END
           AGO  .END
.MSG0001   MNOTE 12,'Invalid Invocation - Use START/SET/END'
           AGO .END
.MSG0002   MNOTE 12,'COMMAND must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG0003   MNOTE 12,'GROUP must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG0004   MNOTE 12,'AUTH must be specified'
           AGO .END
.MSG0005   MNOTE 12,'COMMAND must be 4 characters or less'
           AGO .END
.MSG0006   MNOTE 12,'KEYWORDS must be 15 characters or less'
           AGO .END
.MSG0007   MNOTE 12,'GROUP must be 8 characters or less'
           AGO .END
.MSG0008   MNOTE 12,'COMMENT must be 32 characters or less'
           AGO .END
.END     MEND

MXIOPTL.text:
)ATTR
  # TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(WHITE)
  ! TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(WHITE)
  ¢ TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(YELLOW)
  @ TYPE(INPUT)  INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(ON) COLOR(RED)
  + TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
)BODY EXPAND({{) WINDOW(70,13)
+
#MXILB3
+DSCB Collection (ON/OFF)        @MDC+

+ENQ Major Name                  @MEQM    +
+ENQ System Name                 @MEQS    +
+ENQ Job Name                    @MEQJ    +

+Exception Table Suffix          @MX+
+E-MCS Console Name              @MCNME   +

+Initial Menu Filter Keywords    @MMCMD                       +
)INIT
&ZWINTTL = 'MXI - Specify Setting'
.HELP = MXIHSET0
.ATTRCHAR(¢)  = 'COLOR(&M7CC) HILITE(&M7CH) INTENS(&M7CI)'
.ATTRCHAR(+) =  'COLOR(&M05C) HILITE(&M05H) INTENS(&M05I)'
.ATTRCHAR(#) =  'COLOR(&M08C) HILITE(&M08H) INTENS(&M08I)'
)PROC
VER (&MDC,LIST,OFF,ON)
VER (&MCNME,NB)
IF (&MMCMD = &Z) &MMCMD = '*'
IF (&MEQM = &Z) &MEQM = '*'
IF (&MEQJ = &Z) &MEQJ = '*'
IF (&MEQS = &Z) &MEQS = '*'
IF (&MX = &Z) &MX = '00'
VPUT (MCNME) PROFILE
VPUT (MMCMD) PROFILE
)END

               MSGOPER=OFF,                                            x
               LLASMF=NO,                                              x
               CA1PWD=ON,                                              x
               MQ=CSQ1,                                                x
               DB=DSN1,                                                x
               DEFMQQ=*,                                               x
               XMEM=YES,                                               x
               PORT=8001

MXIPMAKE.text:
)ATTR
 # TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(BLUE) SKIP(ON)
 ! TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(WHITE)
 @ TYPE(INPUT)  INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(ON) COLOR(RED)
 + TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
)BODY WINDOW(54,11)

!Specify address space
@Z!1.+Jobname  :@MXJOBN  +
  !2.+Hex ASID :@MASD+

!Enter option
@Z!1.+Address space to be marked non-swappable
  !2.+Address space to be marked swappable
  !3.+Address space to have no CPU time limit.
  !4.+Address space to be abended with a 322 abend.

)INIT
 &ZWINTTL = 'MXI - Change Address Space'
 .ZVARS = '(MXASL,MXPSL)'
 &MXASL = '1'
 &MXPSL = '2'
 .HELP = MXIHMAKE
)PROC
 VER (&MXASL,LIST,1,2)
 VER (&MXPSL,LIST,1,2,3,4)
 IF (&MXASL EQ '1')
    VER (&MXJOBN,NB)
 IF (&MXASL EQ '2')
    VER (&MASD,NB)
)END

MXIPMSG.text:
MACRO
          MXIPMSG
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MXIPMSG
.*
.* Function        : MXI TCP/IP Input Message
.*
.*                   This control block describes the client populated
.*                   TCP/IP input message.
.*
.*                   When this input message has been constructed by
.*                   MXI for MVS->MVS requests, both the userid and
.*                   group fields are filled in. For nonMVS->MVS
.*                   requests only the userid is expected to be
.*                   supplied although the MXIPUSR max field length
.*                   is extended to 17 bytes.
.*
.*                   The MXIPUDAT field is available for installation
.*                   use. An example of possible uses include supplying
.*                   a mainframe userid/password combination so that
.*                   extra security checks can be performed by the
.*                   MXISECX1 user exit (which is presented with the
.*                   MXIPMSG for all cross-system requests).
.*
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXIPMSG   DSECT
MXIPCMDL  DS   X                MXI Command Length
MXIPCMD   DS   CL71             MXI Command Text
MXIPRESV  DS   CL56             Reserved - set to blanks
MXIPUSRL  DS   X                Username Length
MXIPUSR   DS   CL8              Userid (8 bytes on MVS, 17 on non-MVS)
MXIPGRPL  DS   X                Group Length (MVS only)
MXIPGRP   DS   CL8              Group        (MVS only)
MXIPMQ    DS   CL4              Default MQ subsystem
MXIPDB    DS   CL4              Default DB2 subsystem
MXIPOS    DS   CL8              Client Operating System
MXIPUDAT  DS   CL32             User data
MXIPMSGL  EQU  *-MXIPMSG
          MEND

MXIPPEEK.text:
)ATTR
 # TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(BLUE) SKIP(ON)

 + TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(ON) COLOR(TURQ)

!Specify address space
@Z!1.+Userid   :@MXJOBN  +
  !2.+Hex ASID :@MASD+

)PROC

    VER (&MXJOBN,NB)

    VER (&MASD,NB)
)END

)ATTR
 # TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(OFF) COLOR(BLUE) SKIP(ON)

 @ TYPE(INPUT)  INTENS(LOW)  CAPS(ON) COLOR(RED)

)END

MXIRULE.text:
MACRO
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Name       : MXIRULE
.*
.* Function   : Constructs the MXI exception rules table
.*
.*
.* Syntax     : MXIRULE START,SUFFIX=sufiix
.*
.*            : MXIRULE END,SUFFIX=suffix
.*
.*            : MXIRULE SET,
.*                    TYPE=rule_type,
.*                    ITEM=item_name,
.*                    operator, (EQ/LT/GT)
.*                    VALUE=comparison_value,
.*                    STC=(YES/NO),
.*                    JOB=(YES/NO),
.*                    TSU=(YES/NO),
.*                    SEV=(INFO/WARN/ERROR)
.*
.* Keywords   : START
.*                 Denotes the beginning of the exception rules table.
.*                 This must be the first entry.
.*
.*            : END
.*                 Denotes the end of the exception rules table.
.*                 This must be the last entry and the SUFFIX keyword
.*                 must match the one specified on the START invocation
.*                 of the macro.
.*
.*            : SET
.*                 Creates an exception rule in the current table. The
.*                 specification of TYPE and IETM determine which type
.*                 of exception is set.
.*
.*            : SUFFIX=suffix
.*                 Specifies the two character suffix to be appended
.*                 to 'MXIXPT' to make up the name of the exception
.*                 rules table. This is only valid for MXIRULE START
.*                 and MXIRULE END invocations of the macro.
.*
.*            : TYPE=rule_type
.*                 Specifies the type of exception that is to be set.
.*                 Valid values are :
.*                 (o) DASD   - Define which DASD volumes should be
.*                              online or offline.
.*                 (o) TASK   - Define which address spaces should
.*                              be active or inactive.
.*                 (o) SYS    - Define a system level exception
.*                 (o) ASID   - Define a address space level exception
.*
.*            : ITEM=item_type
.*                 Identifies the specific item to be examined for
.*                 an exception.
.*                 (o) For TYPE=DASD, 'item_value' is the 1-6 character
.*                     volume serial number mask. A placeholder of '%'
.*                     and wildcard of '*' can be used.
.*                 (o) For TYPE=TASK, 'item_value' is the one to eight
.*                     character address space name mask. A placeholder
.*                     of '%' and wildcard of '*' can be used.
.*                 (o) For TYPE=SYS, 'item_value' can be one of the
.*                     following :
.*                     (a) CPU%     - System CPU percent busy
.*                     (b) UIC      - High UIC count
.*                     (c) ASVTFREE - Number of free ASVT slots
.*                     (d) CSA%     - Percentage of CSA used
.*                     (e) SQA%     - Percentage of SQA used
.*                     (f) ECSA%    - Percentage of E-CSA used
.*                     (g) ESQA%    - Percentage of E-SQA used
.*                     (h) CSACONV  - Amount (in K) of CSA converted
.*                                    to SQA.
.*                     (i) ECSACONV - Amount (in K) of E-CSA converted
.*                                    to E-SQA.
.*                     (j) CPUS     - Number of CPUs online
.*                     (k) WTOR     - Number of WTORs
.*                     (l) SMFDUMP  - Number of SMF Datasets that are
.*                                    in 'DUMP REQUIRED' status
.*                 (o) For TYPE=ASID, 'item_value' can be one of the
.*                     following :
.*                     (a) REAL     - Amount (in frames) of real
.*                                    storage in use by any address
.*                                    space.
.*                     (b) EXPAND   - Amount (in frames) of expanded
.*                                    storage in use by any address
.*                                    space.
.*                     (c) NONVIO   - Amount (in slots) of non-VIO
.*                                    auxiliary storage in use by any
.*                                    address space.
.*                     (d) EXPAND   - Amount (in frames) of fixed
.*                                    storage in use by any address
.*                                    space.
.*                     (e) WORKSET  - Size (in K) of the working set
.*                                    for any address space.
.*                     (f) CSA      - Size (in K) of CSA storage used
.*                                    by any address space.
.*                     (g) SQA      - Size (in K) of SQA storage used
.*                                    by any address space.
.*                     (h) ECSA     - Size (in K) of E-CSA storage used
.*                                    by any address space.
.*                     (i) ESQA     - Size (in K) of E-SQA storage used
.*                                    by any address space.
.*                     (j) WAIT     - Time (in minutes) that an address
.*                                    space has been waiting.
.*                     (k) CPU%     - Address space CPU percentage
.*                                    busy
.*
.*            : operator
.*                 Specifies the logical comparison operation to be
.*                 made between the ITEM and the VALUE. This can be
.*                 one of the following :
.*                 (o) EQ     - Equal
.*                 (o) LT     - Less Than
.*                 (o) GT     - Greater Than
.*
.*            : VALUE=comparison_value
.*                 Specifies the value to be compared to the specified
.*                 ITEM.
.*                 (o) For TYPE=DASD, this will be either 'ONLINE' or
.*                     'OFFLINE'
.*                 (o) For TYPE=TASK, this will be either 'ACTIVE' or
.*                     'INACTIVE'
.*                 (o) For TYPE=SYS and TYPE=ASID, this will typically
.*                     be a number.
.*
.*            : STC=(YES/NO)
.*                 Specifies that for TYPE=ASID exceptions, started
.*                 tasks are to be examined (YES) or not (NO)
.*                 The default setting is STC=YES
.*
.*            : JOB=(YES/NO)
.*                 Specifies that for TYPE=ASID exceptions, batch
.*                 jobs are to be examined (YES) or not (NO)
.*                 The default setting is JOB=YES
.*
.*            : TSU=(YES/NO)
.*                 Specifies that for TYPE=ASID exceptions, TSO
.*                 users are to be examined (YES) or not (NO)
.*                 The default setting is TSU=YES
.*
.*            : SEV=severity
.*                 Specifies the severity of the exception if matched.
.*                 Valid values are :
.*                 (o) INFO   - Informational (default)
.*                 (o) WARN   - Warning
.*                 (o) ERROR  - Serious error
.*                 The default setting is SEV=INFO
.*
.*
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Changes
.* 07/07/1999   Rob Scott     Code Written                     V2.1.C
.* 10/09/1999   Rob Scott     Added ability to include or      V2.1.C
.*                            exclude STC, JOB or TSU address
.*                            spaces for TYPE=ASID exceptions.
.* 10/09/1999   Rob Scott     Set default severity to INFO.    V2.1.C
.* 18/11/1999   Rob Scott     Added the CPUS exception         V2.1.D
.* 10/05/2000   Rob Scott     Added support for patterns in    V2.2.A
.*                            jobname and DASD volsers for
.*                            TYPE=TASK and TYPE=DASD
.* 01/12/2000   Rob Scott     Added SYS WTORS                  V3.1.A
.* 08/01/2001   Rob Scott     Added SYS SMFDUMP                V3.1.B
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
&LABEL    MXIRULE &INVOKE,                                             X
               &TYPE=,                                                 X
               &ITEM=,                                                 X
               &OPER,                                                  X
               &VALUE=,                                                X
               &SUFFIX=,                                               X
               &STC=YES,                                               X
               &JOB=YES,                                               X
               &TSU=YES,                                               X
               &SEV=INFO
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Ensure that we have all required parms
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'START').RULESTRT
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'END').RULEEND
           AIF ('&INVOKE' EQ 'SET').RULESET
           AGO .MSG0001
.RULESTRT  ANOP
           AIF (K'&SUFFIX NE 2).MSG0002
           AIF ('&TYPE' NE '').MSG0003
           AIF ('&ITEM' NE '').MSG0003
           AIF ('&VALUE' NE '').MSG0003
MXIXPT&SUFFIX CSECT
           DC   CL8'MXIXPT&SUFFIX'
           DC   CL8'&SYSDATE'
           DC   CL8'&SYSTIME'
           DC   AL4(NUMXPT&SUFFIX)
           DC   F'0'
BEGXPT&SUFFIX DS 0D
           AGO  .END
.RULESET   ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Process the defined exceptions
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&TYPE' EQ 'DASD').RULEDASD
           AIF ('&TYPE' EQ 'TASK').RULETASK
           AIF ('&TYPE' EQ 'ASID').RULEASID
           AIF ('&TYPE' EQ 'SYS').RULESYS
           AGO  .MSG0005
.RULEDASD  ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* DASD Rules
.* Keys : 01  = EXCEPTION IF DASD ONLINE
.*        02  = EXCEPTION IF DASD OFFLINE
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&VALUE' EQ 'ONLINE').DASDON
           AIF ('&VALUE' EQ 'OFFLINE').DASDOFF
           AGO  .MSG0007
.DASDON    ANOP
           DC   X'01'         Set Rule Key (DASD Online)
           DC   XL7'00'
           DC   CL8'&ITEM'    Set ITEM Value
           DC   D'0'
           AGO  .RULESEV
.DASDOFF   ANOP
           DC   X'02'         Set Rule Key (DASD Offline)
           DC   XL7'00'
           DC   CL8'&ITEM'    Set ITEM Value
           DC   D'0'
           AGO  .RULESEV
.RULETASK  ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* TASK Rules
.* Keys : 03  = EXCEPTION IF TASK ACTIVE
.*        04  = EXCEPTION IF TASK INACTIVE
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&VALUE' EQ 'ACTIVE').TASKON
           AIF ('&VALUE' EQ 'INACTIVE').TASKOFF
           AGO  .MSG0009
.TASKON    ANOP
           DC   X'03'         Set Rule Key (TASK Active)
           DC   XL7'00'
           DC   CL8'&ITEM'    Set ITEM Value
           DC   D'0'
           AGO  .RULESEV
.TASKOFF   ANOP
           DC   X'04'         Set Rule Key (TASK Inactive)
           DC   XL7'00'
           DC   CL8'&ITEM'    Set ITEM Value
           DC   D'0'
           AGO  .RULESEV
.RULEASID  ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* ASID Rules
.* Keys : 05  = NONVIO slots
.*        06  = REAL frames
.*        07  = EXPAND frames
.*        08  = FIXED frames
.*        09  = WORKSET size
.*        0A  = CSA usage (K)
.*        0B  = SQA usage (K)
.*        0C  = ECSA usage (K)
.*        0D  = ESQA usage (K)
.*        0E  = WAIT time (mins)
.*        18  = CPU%
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&VALUE' EQ '').MSG0011
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'NONVIO').ASIDNVIO
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'REAL').ASIDREAL
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'EXPAND').ASIDEXPD
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'FIXED').ASIDFIX
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'WORKSET').ASIDWRKS
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'CSA').ASIDCSA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'SQA').ASIDSQA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'ECSA').ASIDECSA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'ESQA').ASIDESQA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'WAIT').ASIDWAIT
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'CPU%').ASIDCPU
           AGO  .MSG0010
.ASIDNVIO  ANOP
           DC   X'05'         Set Rule Key (NONVIO slots)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDREAL  ANOP
           DC   X'06'         Set Rule Key (REAL frames)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDEXPD  ANOP
           DC   X'07'         Set Rule Key (EXPAND frames)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDFIX   ANOP
           DC   X'08'         Set Rule Key (FIXED frames)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDWRKS  ANOP
           DC   X'09'         Set Rule Key (WORKSET size)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDCSA   ANOP
           DC   X'0A'         Set Rule Key (CSA Usage)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDSQA   ANOP
           DC   X'0B'         Set Rule Key (SQA Usage)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDECSA  ANOP
           DC   X'0C'         Set Rule Key (ECSA Usage)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDESQA  ANOP
           DC   X'0D'         Set Rule Key (ESQA Usage)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDWAIT  ANOP
           DC   X'0E'         Set Rule Key (WAIT Time)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDCPU   ANOP
           DC   X'18'         Set Rule Key (CPU%)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.ASIDCOM   ANOP
           DC   XL7'00'
           DC   CL8'&ITEM'    Set item value
           DC   F'0'          Filler
           DC   F'&VALUE'     Set amount
           AGO  .RULESEV
.RULESYS   ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* System Wide Exceptions
.* Keys : 0F  = ASVTFREE
.*        10  = CSA% Used
.*        11  = SQA% Used
.*        12  = ECSA% Used
.*        13  = ESQA% Used
.*        14  = CSACONV in K
.*        15  = ECSACONV in K
.*        16  = CPU%
.*        17  = UIC
.*        19  = CPUS
.*        1A  = SMFDUMP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF ('&VALUE' EQ '').MSG0013
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'ASVTFREE').SYSASVT
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'CSA%').SYSCSA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'SQA%').SYSSQA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'ECSA%').SYSECSA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'ESQA%').SYSESQA
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'CSACONV').SYSCSAV
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'ECSACONV').SYSECSAV
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'CPU%').SYSCPU
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'UIC').SYSUIC
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'CPUS').SYSCPUS
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'WTOR').SYSWTOR
           AIF ('&ITEM' EQ 'SMFDUMP').SYSSMFD
           AGO  .MSG0012
.SYSASVT   ANOP
           DC   X'0F'         Set Rule Key (ASVTFREE)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSCSA    ANOP
           DC   X'10'         Set Rule Key (CSA%)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSSQA    ANOP
           DC   X'11'         Set Rule Key (SQA%)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSECSA   ANOP
           DC   X'12'         Set Rule Key (ECSA%)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSESQA   ANOP
           DC   X'13'         Set Rule Key (ESQA%)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSCSAV   ANOP
           DC   X'14'         Set Rule Key (CSACONV)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSECSAV  ANOP
           DC   X'15'         Set Rule Key (ECSACONV)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSCPU    ANOP
           DC   X'16'         Set Rule Key (CPU%)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSUIC    ANOP
           DC   X'17'         Set Rule Key (UIC)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSCPUS   ANOP
           DC   X'19'         Set Rule Key (CPUS)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSSMFD   ANOP
           DC   X'1A'         Set Rule Key (SMFDUMP)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.SYSWTOR   ANOP
           DC   X'20'         Set Rule Key (WTOR)
           AGO  .ASIDCOM
.RULESEV   ANOP
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
.* Process the severity
.*--------------------------------------------------------------------
           AIF  ('&SEV' NE 'INFO').SEVWARN
           DC   XL3'00'
           DC   X'06'         Indicate Severity (INFO)
           AGO  .SETASIDT
.SEVWARN   ANOP
           AIF  ('&SEV' NE 'WARN').SEVERR
.SEVDFLT   ANOP
           DC   XL3'00'
           DC   X'04'         Indicate Severity (WARN)
           AGO  .SETASIDT
.SEVERR    ANOP
           AIF  ('&SEV' NE 'ERROR').SEVDFLT
           DC   XL3'00'
           DC   X'03'         Indicate Severity (ERROR)
.SETASIDT  ANOP
           AIF  ('&TYPE' NE 'ASID').NOTASID
           AIF  ('&STC' EQ 'YES').INCLSTC
           AIF  ('&STC' NE 'NO').MSG0014
           DC   X'00'         Exclude STCs
           AGO  .TESTJOB
.INCLSTC   ANOP
           DC   X'01'         Include STCs
.TESTJOB   ANOP
           AIF  ('&JOB' EQ 'YES').INCLJOB
           AIF  ('&JOB' NE 'NO').MSG0015
           DC   X'00'         Exclude JOBs
           AGO  .TESTTSU
.INCLJOB   ANOP
           DC   X'01'         Include JOBs
.TESTTSU   ANOP
           AIF  ('&TSU' EQ 'YES').INCLTSU
           AIF  ('&TSU' NE 'NO').MSG0016
           DC   X'00'         Exclude TSUs
           AGO  .SETOPER
.INCLTSU   ANOP
           DC   X'01'         Include TSUs
           AGO  .SETOPER
.NOTASID   DC   XL3'010101'
.SETOPER   ANOP
           AIF  ('&OPER' NE 'EQ').OPERLT
           DC   X'01'         Logical operator
           AGO  .END
.OPERLT    ANOP
           AIF  ('&OPER' NE 'LT').OPERGT
           DC   X'02'         Logical operator
           AGO  .END
.OPERGT    ANOP
           AIF  ('&OPER' NE 'GT').MSG0008
           DC   X'03'         Logical operator
           AGO  .END
.RULEEND   ANOP
           AIF (K'&SUFFIX NE 2).MSG0002
           AIF ('&TYPE' NE '').MSG0004
           AIF ('&ITEM' NE '').MSG0004
           AIF ('&VALUE' NE '').MSG0004
ENDXPT&SUFFIX DS 0H
NUMXPT&SUFFIX EQU (ENDXPT&SUFFIX-BEGXPT&SUFFIX)/32
           END
           AGO  .END
.MSG0001   MNOTE 12,'Invalid Invocation - Use START/SET/END'
           AGO .END
.MSG0002   MNOTE 12,'SUFFIX must be two characters long'
           AGO .END
.MSG0003   MNOTE 12,'The only valid keyword for START is SUFFIX'
           AGO .END
.MSG0004   MNOTE 12,'The only valid keyword for END is SUFFIX'
           AGO .END
.MSG0005   MNOTE 12,'Unknown SET TYPE'
           AGO .END
.MSG0007   MNOTE 12,'TYPE=DASD must use either VALUE=(OFFLINE/ONLINE)'
           AGO .END
.MSG0008   MNOTE 12,'Invalid operator between ITEM and VALUE'
           AGO .END
.MSG0009   MNOTE 12,'TYPE=TASK must use either VALUE=(ACTIVE/INACTIVE)'
           AGO .END
.MSG0010   MNOTE 12,'Invalid ITEM for TYPE=ASID'
           AGO .END
.MSG0011   MNOTE 12,'Invalid VALUE for TYPE=ASID'
           AGO .END
.MSG0012   MNOTE 12,'Invalid ITEM for TYPE=SYS'
           AGO .END
.MSG0013   MNOTE 12,'Invalid VALUE for TYPE=SYS'
           AGO .END
.MSG0014   MNOTE 12,'TYPE=ASID must use either STC=YES or STC=NO'
           AGO .END
.MSG0015   MNOTE 12,'TYPE=ASID must use either JOB=YES or JOB=NO'
           AGO .END
.MSG0016   MNOTE 12,'TYPE=ASID must use either TSU=YES or TSU=NO'
           AGO .END
.END     MEND

MXIS.text:
MACRO
          MXIS
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MXIS
.*
.* Function        : MXI Result Set Attributes Control Block
.*
.*                   This control block describes the result set
.*                   attributes of the result set (MXDT) returned
.*                   by an MXI command.
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXIS      DSECT
MXISID    DS   CL4              MXIS eyecatcher = 'MXIS'
MXISFLAG  DS   X                MXIS flag settings
MXISSCRL  EQU  X'80'            scrolling is available
MXISSORT  EQU  X'40'            SORT is available
MXISSRCH  EQU  X'20'            SRCH is available
MXISVOLP  EQU  X'10'            Volume serial numbers are present
MXISNCHN  EQU  X'08'            don't chain this MXIS
MXISLNNM  EQU  X'04'            Show line numbers for scroll
MXISSETS  EQU  X'02'            Show settings on top line
MXISDVRB  EQU  X'01'            Move in creation verb on enter
MXISFLG2  DS   X                MXIS flag 2
MXISFBWD  EQU  X'80'            FIND Backwards
MXISFNXT  EQU  X'40'            FIND Next
MXISFFST  EQU  X'20'            FIND First
MXISFLST  EQU  X'10'            FIND Last
MXISFALL  EQU  X'08'            FIND All
MXISFRPT  EQU  X'04'            Repeat FIND
MXISFLG3  DS   X                MXIS flag 3
MXISXMEM  EQU  X'80'            MXIS is for X-MEM MEM Command
MXISAUTO  EQU  X'40'            AUTO is allowed
MXISFLG4  DS   X                Reserved
MXISDSNO  DS   F                Offset in line to dataset name
MXISVOLO  DS   F                Offset in line to volser
MXISMEMO  DS   F                Offset in line to member
MXISSMEM  DS   CL8              Member name to search for (SRCH)
MXISHELP  DS   CL8              HELP Panel name
MXISRC    DS   F                Return code from panel
MXISSOFF  DS   F                Screen offset
MXISFNUM  DS   F                Returned number of finds (for find all)
MXISDTAB  DS   F                MXDT address
MXISSTAB  DS   F                Shadow table address
MXISBUFS  DS   F                Size of mxibuf
MXISBUFA  DS   F                Address of mxibuf
MXISLNEA  DS   F                Address of mxilne
MXISLAB2  DS   F                Address of mxilb2
MXISLAB3  DS   F                Address of mxilb3
MXISFLEN  DS   X                FIND length
MXISFDAT  DS   CL48             FIND data
MXISVERB  DS   CL72             MXICMD requested
MXISCVRB  DS   CL72             MXICMD that created this MXIS
MXISSRTI  DS   CL4              Saved SORT command parms
MXISPANM  DS   CL8              Panel name to display results
MXISRCLA  DS   CL8              Reserved
MXISXMJL  DS   X                X-memory jobname length
MXISXMJB  DS   CL8              X-memory jobname
MXISXMAS  DS   CL4              X-memory asid
          DS   0D               Column Meta-data
MXISSNUM  DS   F                Number of Columns
MXISSF1   DS   CL16             Column #1 :
*                               Label Length       AL1(n)
*                               Label              CL8(n)
*                               Record length      AL1(n)
*                               Field offset       AL1(n)
*                               Field length       AL1(n)
*                               Default Sort Dir   CL1(A/B/D/E)
*                                                      A=Ascend Char
*                                                      B=Ascend Hex
*                                                      D=Descend Char
*                                                      E=Descend Hex
*                               Data Type          CL1(C/H)
*                               Reserved           XL2
*
MXISSF2   DS   CL16             Column #2
MXISSF3   DS   CL16             Column #3
MXISSF4   DS   CL16             Column #4
MXISSF5   DS   CL16             Column #5
MXISSF6   DS   CL16             Column #6
MXISSF7   DS   CL16             Column #7
MXISSF8   DS   CL16             Column #8
MXISSF9   DS   CL16             Column #9
MXISSF10  DS   CL16             Column #10
MXISSF11  DS   CL16             Column #11
MXISSF12  DS   CL16             Column #12
MXISSF13  DS   CL16             Column #13
MXISSF14  DS   CL16             Column #14
MXISSF15  DS   CL16             Column #15
MXISSF16  DS   CL16             Column #16
MXISSF17  DS   CL16             Column #17
MXISSF18  DS   CL16             Column #18
MXISSF19  DS   CL16             Column #19
MXISSF20  DS   CL16             Column #20
MXISSF21  DS   CL16             Column #21
MXISSF22  DS   CL16             Column #22
MXISSF23  DS   CL16             Column #23
MXISSF24  DS   CL16             Column #24
          DS   0D
MXISLEN   EQU  *-MXIS           Length of DSECT
          MEND

    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=SRVC,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW

    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=UCB,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW

    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=USP,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=VER,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=VMAP,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=WLM,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=WLMA,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=WLMC,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=WLMG,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=WLMS,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=WTOR,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=XCFM,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=XCFS,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=XM,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=/,USER=*,ACCESS=ALLOW
    MXIAUTH SET,CMD=ZAP,USER=*,ACCESS=DENY
    MXIAUTH END

MXISECX1.text:
MXISECX1 TITLE 'MXI TCP/IP Security Exit'
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Name            : MXISECX1
*
* Function        : MXI TCP/IP Security Exit
*
* Register Usage  :
* r1  - parameter passed : +0 Input message
*                        : +4 Client TCP/IP address
* r2  - Work
* r3  - Input message (mapped by MXIPMSG)
* r4  - Client IP address
* r5  -
* r6  -
* r7  -
* r8  -
* r9  - RC
* r10 -
* r11 -
* r12 - base
* r13 - work area
*
*
* Attributes : RENT AC(1) AMODE(31) RMODE(ANY)
*
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Changes
* 2003/01/29   Rob Scott     Code Written                      V4.3
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXISECX1 CSECT
MXISECX1 AMODE 31
MXISECX1 RMODE ANY
         BAKR  R14,R0                 linkage stack
         LR    R12,R15                copy entry address to base
         USING MXISECX1,R12           address it
         LR    R2,R1                  copy parms passed
GETSTOR  DS    0H
         STORAGE OBTAIN,              get the workarea storage         X
               LENGTH=WORKLEN,        this much                        X
               ADDR=(R13),            put address in r13               X
               SP=0,KEY=8,                                             X
               LOC=ANY,               anywhere                         X
               COND=NO                unconditional
         USING WORKAREA,R13           address workarea
         LR    R14,R13                Copy workarea address
         L     R15,=A(WORKLEN)        Get length of workarea
         XR    R0,R0                  Clear
         XR    R1,R1                  Clear
         MVCL  R14,R0                 Init to zeros
         MVC   4(4,R13),=C'F1SA'      set acronym
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Copy in model RACROUTE macros to list forms
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         MVC   VERIFYC(VERIFYCL),VERIFYCM
         MVC   VERIFYD(VERIFYDL),VERIFYDM
         XR    R9,R9                  Zero return code
GETPARMS DS    0H
         LM    R3,R4,0(R2)            Copy in parms
         USING MXIPMSG,R3
         MVC   CLIENTIP(4),0(R4)      Copy in IP Address
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Ignore MVS->MVS client conversations as we trust the sending
* system to have verified userid/password.
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         CLC   MXIPOS(8),=CL8'MVS'    Check for MVS->MVS
         BE    RETURN                 Yes - no need to RACROUTE
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* As supplied, this exit will do nothing.
* To use the RACF password checking exit you need to do the
* following :
* (1) Adjust your client application to send the RACF userid and
*     password in the first 16 bytes of the userdata portion of the
*     MXI TCP/IP request message. (Remember to send in EBCDIC!).
* (2) Comment out the following line of code
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         B     RETURN                 Comment out to invoke CHECKPW
*
CHECKPW  DS    0H
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Sample code to perform a RACF userid/password check
* This code assumes :
* (1) RACF userid is in the first 8 bytes of the userdata portion
*     of the incoming TCP/IP request.
* (2) RACF password is in the second 8 bytes of the userdata portion
*     of the incoming TCP/IP request.
* (3) Both the userid and password fields are terminated with spaces
*     or x'00' if less than 8 bytes long.
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         MVC   USERID(8),MXIPUDAT     Copy in userid
         LA    R1,USERID
         BAL   R14,GETLEN             Get length of userid
         STCM  R15,B'0001',USERIDL
         MVC   PASSWRD(8),MXIPUDAT+8  Copy in password
         LA    R1,PASSWRD
         BAL   R14,GETLEN             Get length of password
         STCM  R15,B'0001',PASSWRDL
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Attempt to create an ACEE with userid and password
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         RACROUTE REQUEST=VERIFY,     Model RACROUTE                   x
               ENVIR=CREATE,                                           x
               ACEE=@ACEE,                                             x
               USERID=USERIDL,                                         x
               PASSCHK=YES,                                            x
               PASSWRD=PASSWRDL,                                       x
               RELEASE=1.8,1,         Lowest release                   x
               WORKA=RACFWORK,        Use this workarea                x
               MF=(E,VERIFYC)
         LTR   R9,R15                 Return RACF rc to MXISERV
         BNZ   RETURN
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* ACEE was created - need to clean it up before returning
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         RACROUTE REQUEST=VERIFY,     Model RACROUTE                   x
               ENVIR=DELETE,                                           x
               ACEE=@ACEE,                                             x
               RELEASE=1.8,1,         Lowest release                   x
               WORKA=RACFWORK,        Use this workarea                x
               MF=(E,VERIFYD)
RETURN   STORAGE RELEASE,             release workarea storage         X
               LENGTH=WORKLEN,                                         X
               ADDR=(R13),                                             X
               SP=0,KEY=8,                                             X
               COND=NO
         LR    R15,R9                 Pass back rc (maybe from RAC)
         PR                           return
*
GETLEN   DS    0H
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Routine to calc the length of a string terminated by space or null
* R1 = Input string
* R15= Output length
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
         ST    R14,R14SAVE            Save ret address
         LA    R14,8                  max eight chars
         XR    R15,R15                Clear
LENLOOP  CLI   0(R1),X'40'            Is it a blank ?
         BE    GOTLEN                 Yes
         CLI   0(R1),X'00'            Is it a null ?
         BE    GOTLEN                 Yes
         LA    R15,1(,R15)            Add to length
         LA    R1,1(,R1)              Point to next byte
         BCT   R14,LENLOOP            Check next byte
GOTLEN   L     R14,R14SAVE
         BR    R14
*
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
* DSECTS
*-------------------------------------------------------------------*
VERIFYCM RACROUTE REQUEST=VERIFY,     Model RACROUTE                   x
               ENVIR=CREATE,                                           x
               ACEE=*-*,                                               x
               USERID=*-*,                                             x
               PASSCHK=YES,                                            x
               PASSWRD=*-*,                                            x
               RELEASE=1.8,1,         Lowest release                   x
               WORKA=*-*,             Use this workarea                x
               MF=L
VERIFYCL EQU   *-VERIFYCM             Length of model macro
*
VERIFYDM RACROUTE REQUEST=VERIFY,     Model RACROUTE                   x
               ENVIR=DELETE,                                           x
               ACEE=*-*,                                               x
               RELEASE=1.8,1,         Lowest release                   x
               WORKA=*-*,             Use this workarea                x
               MF=L
VERIFYDL EQU   *-VERIFYDM             Length of model macro
*
WORKAREA DSECT
SAVEAREA DS    18F
R14SAVE  DS    F
@ACEE    DS    F
CLIENTIP DS    AL1(0),AL1(0),AL1(0),AL1(0)
USERIDL  DS    X
USERID   DS    CL8
PASSWRDL DS    X
PASSWRD  DS    CL8
         DS    0D
VERIFYC  DS    CL(VERIFYCL)
         DS    0D
VERIFYD  DS    CL(VERIFYDL)
         DS    0D
RACFWORK DS    XL512
         DS    0D
WORKLEN  EQU   *-WORKAREA
*
         YREGS
         MXIPMSG
         END

MXISRV00.text:
SUBSYS=ADD
IEFU83=YES
MSGLEVEL=LOUD
TCPIP=YES
NONSWAP=YES
TRUSTED=NO
SITE=SYSA(10.0.0.1)
SITE=SYSB(SYSB.UK.COMPANY.COM)
CLIENT=10.0.*.*
USERTRAN=WINDOWSUSER(WINUSER,USER)
USERTRAN=*(DEFUSER,USER)

MXITSO.text:
/* REXX                                                             */
/* This EXEC provides a TSO READY PROMPT interface to MXI using     */
/* the MXIREXX API.                                                 */
/*                                                                  */
do forever
  say "ENTER MXI COMMAND"             /* Ask for input              */
  pull cmd                            /* Pull command               */
  if cmd = "END" then leave           /* If END - leave             */
  line.0 = 0                          /* Clear stem                 */
  line. = ""                          /* Clear stem                 */
  x = mxirexx('line.',cmd)            /* Invoke MXI                 */
  i = 1                               /* Init loop count            */
  if x = 0 then do line.0
   say substr(line.i,1,79)            /* Say the result             */
   i = i + 1                          /* next line please           */
  end                                 /*                            */
  say " "                             /* put out blank line         */
end

MXIXPT00.text:
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* SAMPLE MXI EXCEPTION RULES
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
*
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* CREATE MEMBER : MXIXPT00
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
    MXIRULE START,SUFFIX=00
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* SET SYSTEM-WIDE EXCEPTIONS
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* (1)  ERROR IF CPU% > 99
* (2)  WARN IF UIC < 254
* (3)  ERROR IF FREE ASVT SLOTS < 50
* (4)  WARN IF CSA% USED > 80
* (5)  WARN IF SQA% USED > 80
* (6)  WARN IF E-CSA% USED > 80
* (7)  WARN IF E-SQA% USED > 80
* (8)  WARN IF CSA CONVERTED TO SQA > 0
* (9)  WARN IF E-CSA CONVERTED TO E-SQA > 0
* (10) INFO IF SMF DATASETS NEED DUMPING > 0
* (11) INFO IF WTORS > 0
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=CPU%,GT,VALUE=99,SEV=ERROR
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=UIC,LT,VALUE=254,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=ASVTFREE,LT,VALUE=50,SEV=ERROR
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=CSA%,GT,VALUE=80,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=SQA%,GT,VALUE=80,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=ECSA%,GT,VALUE=80,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=ESQA%,GT,VALUE=80,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=CSACONV,GT,VALUE=0,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=ECSACONV,GT,VALUE=0,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=SMFDUMP,GT,VALUE=0,SEV=INFO
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=SYS,ITEM=WTOR,GT,VALUE=0,SEV=INFO
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* SET KEY TASK EXCEPTIONS
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* (1)  INFO IF GTF IS ACTIVE
* (2)  ERROR IF JES2 IS NOT ACTIVE
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=TASK,ITEM=GTF,EQ,VALUE=ACTIVE,SEV=INFO
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=TASK,ITEM=JES2,EQ,VALUE=INACTIVE,SEV=ERROR
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* SET SINGLE ADDRESS SPACE EXCEPTIONS
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* SET ADDRESS SPACE EXCEPTIONS
* (1)  WARN IF NONVIO SLOTS > 5000
* (2)  WARN IF REAL FRAMES > 5000
* (3)  WARN IF EXPANDED FRAMES > 1000
* (4)  WARN IF WORKING SET SIZE > 20000K
* (5)  ERROR IF FIXED FRAMES > 300
* (6)  WARN IF CSA USED > 100K
* (7)  WARN IF SQA USED > 100K
* (8)  WARN IF E-CSA USED > 1000K
* (9)  WARN IF E-SQA USED > 1000K
* (10) INFO IF WAIT TIME > 30 MINS (EXCLUDING STCS)
* (11) WARN IF CPU% BUSY > 10%
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=NONVIO,GT,VALUE=5000,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=REAL,GT,VALUE=5000,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=EXPAND,GT,VALUE=1000,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=WORKSET,GT,VALUE=20000,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=FIXED,GT,VALUE=300,SEV=ERROR
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=CSA,GT,VALUE=100,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=SQA,GT,VALUE=100,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=ESQA,GT,VALUE=1000,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=ECSA,GT,VALUE=1000,SEV=WARN
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=WAIT,GT,VALUE=30,STC=NO,SEV=INFO
    MXIRULE SET,TYPE=ASID,ITEM=CPU%,GT,VALUE=10,SEV=WARN
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* END OF MEMBER : MXIXPT00
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
    MXIRULE END,SUFFIX=00

MXLS.text:
MACRO
          MXLS
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MXLS
.*
.* Function        : MXI LLA Module Stats Table
.*
.* Pointed to by   : MXCTMXLS of the MXCT
.*
.* Location        : E-CSA Subpool 241 Key 4
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXLS      DSECT
MXLSID    DS   CL4               MXLS eyecatcher
*
MXLSSIZE  DS   F                 MXLS Size
MXLSADDR  DS   A                 MXLS Address
MXLSSP    DS   X                 MXLS Subpool
MXLSKEY   DS   X                 MXLS Storage Key
*
MXLSFLG1  DS   X                 MXLS Flag settings #1
*                                Reserved
MXLSFLG2  DS   X                 MXLS Flag settings #2
*                                Reserved
MXLSFLG3  DS   X                 MXLS Flag settings #3
*                                Reserved
MXLSFLG4  DS   X                 MXLS Flag settings #4
*                                Reserved
*
MXLSMAX   DS   F                 Maximum Number of MXLEs
MXLSNUME  DS   F                 Current Number of MXLEs
MXLSLOCK  DS   F                 Lock word (serialised using CS)
*                                X'00000000' = Free
*                                X'00000001' = MXLS/MXLE Being Updated
MXLSMXLE  DS   0D                Start of MXLE entries
MXLSLEN   EQU  *-MXLS            length of MXLS
*
MXLE      DSECT
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MXLE
.*
.* Function        : MXI LLA Module Stats Table Entry
.*
.* Pointed to by   : MXLSMXLE of the MXLS
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
MXLEDSN   DS   CL44              Dataset Name
MXLEMEM   DS   CL8               Member Name
MXLEBLDL  DS   CL76              BLDL Entry mapped by IHAPDS
MXLEPFFD  DS   D                 Module First PGMF Date/Time (STCK)
MXLEPFLD  DS   D                 Module Last PGMF Date/Time  (STCK)
MXLELFFD  DS   D                 Module First LLAF Date/Time (STCK)
MXLELFLD  DS   D                 Module Last LLAF Date/Time  (STCK)
MXLEFJOB  DS   CL8               Jobname causing first entry
MXLEFASD  DS   XL2               ASID of above
          DS   XL2               Reserved
MXLELJOB  DS   CL8               Jobname causing last entry
MXLELASD  DS   XL2               ASID of above
          DS   XL2               Reserved
MXLEPNUM  DS   F                 Number of PGMF requests
MXLELNUM  DS   F                 Number of LLAF requests
MXLEPTTM  DS   D                 Total duration in PGMF (CPU TOD Units)
MXLELTTM  DS   D                 Total duration in LLAF (CPU TOD Units)
MXLEPFLT  DS   D                 Last PGMF Duration (CPU TOD Units)
MXLELFLT  DS   D                 Last LLAF Duration (CPU TOD Units)
MXLELEN   EQU  *-MXLE            Length of one entry
          MEND

MXSMFREC.text:
MACRO
         MXSMFREC
.*-------------------------------------------------------------------
.* MACRO USED TO MAP THE MXI SMF RECORD USED IN THE CSVLLIX1 EXIT
.*-------------------------------------------------------------------
MXSMBASE DSECT                      BASE RECORD ADDRESSABILITY
MXSMRDW  DS    H                    RECORD DESCRIPTOR WORD
MXSMRLEN DS    H                    LENGTH OF WHOLE RECORD
MXSMIND  DS    X                    SYSTEM INDICATOR
MXSMTYPE DS    X                    RECORD TYPE
MXSMTIME DS    XL4                  TIME RECORD WRITTEN
MXSMDATE DS    PL4                  DATE RECORD WRITTEN
MXSMSID  DS    CL4                  SYSTEM ID
MXSMLLP1 DS    CL152                LLP1 AREA (MAPPED BY IHALLP1)
MXSMLEN  EQU   *-MXSMBASE           LENGTH OF RECORD
MXSMESA  EQU   X'0E'                MVS/ESA INDICATOR
         MEND

MX88.text:
MACRO
          MX88
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
.* Name            : MX88
.*
.* Function        : MXI SMF-88 Table
.*
.* Pointed to by   : MXCTMX88 of the MXCT
.*
.* Location        : E-CSA Subpool 241 Key 4
.*
.*------------------------------------------------------------------*
MX88      DSECT
MX88ID    DS   CL4               MX88 eyecatcher
*
MX88SIZE  DS   F                 MX88 Size
MX88ADDR  DS   A                 MX88 Address
MX88SP    DS   X                 MX88 Subpool
MX88KEY   DS   X                 MX88 Storage Key
*
MX88RLEN  DS   H                 Length of one SMF-88 record
*                                Reserved
MX88FLG1  DS   X                 MX88 Flag settings #1
*                                Reserved
MX88FLG2  DS   X                 MX88 Flag settings #2
*                                Reserved
*
MX88MAX   DS   F                 Maximum Number of SMF-88 records
MX88NUME  DS   F                 Current Number of SMF-88 records
MX88LOCK  DS   F                 Lock word (serialised using CS)
*                                X'00000000' = Free
*                                X'00000001' = MX88 Being Updated
MX88STRT  DS   0D                Start of MXLE entries
MX88LEN   EQU  *-MX88            length of MX88
*
          MEND
